El comité denominado Santa Ana es de la Ciudad de Asunción. Cuenta actualmente con 12 integrantes, todas ellas trabajan de forma solidaria y responsable, dentro de un ambiente de cooperación. Ellas tienen un objetivo común que es el de procurarse mayores ingresos, para que de esa forma puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida, no solo para ellas, sino también para sus hijos.
La Sra. Estela se dedica a la venta de hortalizas. Ella comenta que todos los días empieza su jornada a muy tempranas horas de la mañana cuando va a comprar las hortalizas que va a vender y vuelve ya cuando termina de vender sus productos. Por medio de este trabajo ella ha podido solventar todos los gastos que implica la manutención de su hogar. Sueña con algún día poder tener un pequeño local donde vender sus productos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de hortalizas, para que de esa forma pueda ampliar la variedad que tiene. Sabe que la ayuda de la Fundación le sera de mucha utilidad en su pequeño negocio.
texts.en:
The committee named “Santa Ana” is from the city of Asunción.  There are currently 12 members.  They are all supportive of one another and work responsibly in a spirit of cooperation.  All of them have a common goal of generating more income so that they can have a better life, not only for themselves, but also for their children.

Sra. Estela sells vegetables.  She says that every day her journey begins in the early morning hours when she has to go buy the vegetables that she will sell.  Through her work, she is able to cover all of the expenses related to maintaining her household.  She dreams of someday having a small shop where she can sell her products.  Estela is requesting a loan to buy vegetables so that she can expand the variety that she offers.  She knows that the assistance from Fundación Paraguaya will be a great help to her small business.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario nos cuenta que nació en la comunidad del Tambo Real (provincia de Anta, departamento Cusco, Perú), tiene 32 años de edad y tiene su pareja y con ella tiene dos hijos. Actualmente, Mario vive en la misma comunidad donde nació y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas. Mario se dedica a la ganadería pues tiene varias vacas lecheras quienes producen leche. Ya son 10 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más ganado mejorado.
  
Mario es una persona trabajadora y responsable que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal “Solidaridad de Tambo Real” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Mario says he was born in the community of Tambo Real in Anta Province, Department of Cusco, Peru. He is 32 years old and has two children with his partner. Mario currently lives in the same community where he was born and has developed his business activities. He raises cattle and has several dairy cows that produce milk. Mario has already been in business for 10 years and has done very well as a result of the effort he puts into his work. He is taking this opportunity to request a loan to buy better cattle.

Mario is a hardworking and responsible person. As a result of these qualities, his fellow group members invited him to participate in the Communal Bank “Solidaridad de Tambo Real”, which is part of Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy better cattle.

loans.name: Segundo Galo

texts.en:
Segundo Galo, who goes by his middle name, is 54 years old. He lives near the city of Latacunga, Ecuador, with his wife and four children. His children are aged 31, 24, 26 and 25 years old. Galo also has several grandchildren. He is a cheerful person who gets along well with his neighbors and always works hard to provide the best he can for his children.
Galo makes and sells typical Ecuadorian food. His specialty is “cuero”, a popular food made with the fried skin sections of pork. In the photo, Galo is holding a bag full of cuero cut into squares and ready to bring to the market to cook and sell. He also sells popular accompaniments such as potatoes and beans. He sells his wares at fairs and parties across the province. Galo has been running his business with his wife for 12 years. He is seeking this loan to buy more products to make and sell. Thanks to past loans, Galo reports that he has been able to invest in his business and watch it grow incrementally. In the future, he wants to work hard and buy a cart so that he can sell more of his wares. Galo appears in this photo with his wife and some of his grandchildren.

loans.use: to invest in his food production business by purchasing more pork, beans and potatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA GENERACION III”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio tiene 55 años de edad y es casado y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de transporte, el es propietario de un taxi que realiza servicio de taxi en las diferentes calles de la ciudad de Cusco, el socio trabaja desde las 6.00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m, por medio de este trabajo la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere mejorar el negocio de transporte. El  socio solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento de su carro, para comprar llantas y repuestos.
                                                
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member is part of the Communal Bank “Nueva Generación III” (New Generation III), which is located in the District, Province, and Department of Cusco.

He is 55 years old, married, and has two children. The member divides his time between his daily activities and his transportation business. He is the owner of a taxi and provides his service by traveling through different streets in the city of Cusco. The member works from 6am to 8pm. Through his work, he is able to help his children get ahead. The member wants to improve his transportation business. He is requesting a loan to maintain his automobile and buy tires and parts.

The member is happy with the loan and promises to complete his payments.

loans.use: to pay for vehicle maintenance and to buy tires and spare parts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock for the business.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Sabina  es una persona trabajadora y responsable que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal “Solidaridad de Tambo Real” de la Asociación Arariwa.

Sabina  nos cuenta que nació en la comunidad del Tambo Real (provincia de Anta, departamento Cusco, Perú), tiene 55 años de edad y tiene su pareja y con ella tiene dos hijos. Actualmente, Sabina vive en la misma comunidad donde nació y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas. Sabina se dedica a la ganadería pues tiene varias vacas lecheras quienes producen leche. Ella pertenece a una asociación productores de leche “Tambo Lac”. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más ganado mejorado y para el mantenimiento del establo.
texts.en:
Sabina is a hardworking and responsible person. As a result of these qualities, her fellow group members invited her to participate in the Communal Bank “Solidaridad de Tambo Real”, which is part of Asociación Arariwa.

Sabina says she was born in the community of Tambo Real in Anta Province, Department of Cusco, Peru. She is 55 years old, in a relationship with her partner, and has two children. Sabina currently lives in the same community where she was born and has developed her business activities. She raises cattle and has several dairy cows that produce milk. Sabina is a member of the “Tambo Lac” Association of Milk Producers. She has been in business for several years and has done very well as a result of the effort she puts into her work. Sabina is taking this opportunity to request a loan to buy better cattle and pay for the maintenance of her stable.

loans.use: to buy better cattle and to pay for the maintenance of her stable.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en: Florencia, 45, was born in Chinchero and currently lives in Urquilloz. She is in the agriculture business and sells flowers and vegetables that she grows on her farm. She also raises animals such as guinea pigs and chickens, which she sells from her home. Florencia is asking for a $500 loan in order to buy fertilizer and seed for her farm. She wishes to grow a larger amount of vegetables on her farm to sell. Florencia is happy about the loan and is committed to making all the necessary payments.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed for her farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to hire workers and to buy pineapple plants.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock for her business.

loans.name: Valentine Ablawa

texts.fr:
Valentine est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle vend des condiments, des céréales sur mesure, de la boisson traditionnelle communément appelée SODABI, des sacs de charbon et des produits alimentaires. Tous ses articles sont exposés à son domicile. Parallèlement, la cliente exerce l'activité de restauration, ce qui lui permet d'accroître le niveau de son chiffre d'affaire. 

L'approvisionnement est fait au marché international du Bénin et au marché de Cococodji, un marché situé à l'Ouest de Cotonou, la capitale économique. En vue de mieux satisfaire ses clients, Valentine a décidé d'augmenter son fonds de roulement,raison pour laquelle, elle a sollicité et obtenu un micro crédit à FINADEV. 

Le revenu supplémentaire généré par ce micro crédit pourrait l'aider à augmenter sa participation aux charges du foyer et améliorer ainsi la vie quotidienne de sa famille. Elle est a son 1er crédit à FINADEV. Elle souhaiterait faire la vente en gros et aussi avoir sa propre maison.
texts.en:
Valentine is married and has three children. She sells condiments, mixed cereals, traditional beverages commonly known as "Sodabi", bags of charcoal, and food products. All of these items are displayed at her house. At the same time, she also runs a food preparation business, which allows her to raise the level of her sales.

She gets her supplies at the international market in Benin and at the Cococodji market, which is situated west of Cotonou, the economic capital. In order to better satisfy her customers, Valentine decided to increase her working capital, which is why she sought and obtained a micro-loan through FINADEV.

The additional income generated by this micro-loan would help her play a bigger role in providing for her household and thus improve her family's day-to-day life. She is on her first loan with FINADEV. She would like to sell in bulk and also have her own house.

loans.use: To obtain supplies in bulk: 10 bags of cereals and 2 cases of "Sodabi" (a local beverage).

loans.name: Duo Vidas Iluminandas Group

texts.es: Duo Vidas Iluminandas. la señora Eulalia se dedica a la venta de ropa variada ella es la lider de este duo ella nos cuenta que se a dedicado a esta actividad desde hace varios años esta solicitando este credito para la compra de ropa variada nueva ya que sus clientes le piden nuevos estilos entonces por eso solicita este credito la otra socia se dedica a la venta de tortillas y esta solicitando este credito para la compra de maiz para la elavoracion de tortillas.
texts.en:
Duo Vidas Iluminandas. 

Eulalia sells various clothing. She is the leader of this duo. She tells us that she has done this activity for several years. She is asking for this loan to buy varied new clothing since her customers are asking her for new styles. That is why she is asking for this loan. The other member sells tortillas and she is asking for this loan to buy corn to make tortillas.

loans.use: to buy a variety of new clothing.

loans.name: Dorris

texts.en:
Dorris is 44 years old and lives in the Kakata area. She is married with six children aged between 5 and 29, all of whom live at home and have attended school.
Since 1992, Dorris has run her own tailoring business. She makes a wide range of clothing including traditional African clothing, school uniforms and shirts. Dorris has requested this loan to purchase more cloth in other to increase the range of styles she makes. The main problem she faces is the need to repair and maintain her sewing machines. Dorris wants to open another tailor’s shop and will use the profits to send her children to university.

loans.use: to purchase more cloth in order to increase the range of styles she makes.

loans.name: Carlos Javier

texts.es:
El señor Carlos tiene 27 años de edad, es soltero, convive con la Srita. Noelia, aún no tienen hijos, cuentan con casa propia.
El Sr. Carlos se dedica a la venta de colchas, actividad que desarrolla desde su infancia ya que sus padres se dedican a la misma actividad y le han legado en forma innata dicha profesión.
Cabe destacar que el cliente tiene 4 operaciones con excelentes antecedentes lo cual le favorece para seguir operando con créditos y seguir apostando en aumentar su inversión en su labor cotidiana.
El solicita el credito para la compra de frazadas, sabanas, colchas y demás, para la posterior venta.
texts.en:
Carlos is 27 years old, single, and lives in a committed relationship with Noelia with whom he has no children yet. They have their own home. 

Carlos earns a living selling bedspreads, a business he has been involved with since childhood as his parents are in the same business and have passed said profession on to him naturally. 

It bears mentioning that the client has four operations with excellent track records, which reflects favorably on his continued operation with credit and on risking increasing his investment in his daily labor. 

He is requesting the loan to buy blankets, sheets, bedspreads and other items for subsequent sale.

loans.use: to purchase sheets, blankets and other items.

loans.name: Silvia Elena

texts.es: La señora Silvia, tiene 48 años de edad, originaria de León, es madre de tres hijos , esta casada, su nivel académico es básico solo termino la primaria llego hasta sexto grado , ella es comerciante, tiene su propia pulpería. Inicio su negocio hace 12 años , lo puso con capital propio , fue comprando inventario en poca cantidad tales como sodas, leche ,arroz, frijoles, aceite, huevo , también compro ropa y accesorios de mujer para vender de esta manera fue surtiendo su pequeña pulpería hasta convertirla en su medio de subsistencia, su esposo aporta en el hogar con el salario que recibe como electricista.  Solicito el préstamo para comprar carnes de res y de pollo que son productos de consumos diarios  y demandados por sus clientes.  Al invertir en compra de mayor cantidad de este producto le ofrecerán mayor descuento y podrá sacarle una mejor ganancia y así poder invertir en comprar otros  productos que también son muy demandados en su pulpería. Ella desea comprar 2 vitrinas y un estante grande de aluminio,pintar su pulperia darle una mejor apariencia, pues sus expectativas es hacer crecer su negocio y mejorar cada día , hacer compra de mas inventario para mantener surtida su venta y hacer clientes nuevos y mantener satisfechos a lo que ya son clientes de ella.
texts.en:
Silvia is 48, originally from León and is married with three children. Her academic level is basic as she only completed primary school up to the sixth grade. She is a shopkeeper with her own grocery store. She started her business 12 years ago. Using her own money she bought small amounts of products such as drinks, milk, rice, beans, oil and eggs. She also bought women's clothing and accessories to sell, and grew her small grocery store until it was her means of survival. Her husband contributes to the household with the money he earns as an electrician. 

She asked for this loan to buy beef and chicken, everyday products asked for by her customers. By buying a greater amount of these products, she will be able to offer her customers a better deal and make more profit. In this way she will be able to invest in buying other products which are also in great demand in her shop. She wants to buy two glass cabinets and a large aluminium shelf and to paint her shop to improve its appearance, as she is expecting her business to expand and improve each day. She wants to buy more inventory to keep her store well stocked, as well as to gain new customers and keep her current customers satisfied.

loans.use: To buy everyday products such as beef and chicken.

loans.name: Dálida Rosa

texts.es:
Dálida es una mujer emprendedora que a sus 42 años es propietaria de una microempresa que existe desde hace 8 años, es una mujer que ha luchado por sacar adelante sus sueños, y como madre de 2 hijos lo que espera es poder brindarles en un futuro una mejor calidad de vida. 

Actualmente Dálida genera 4 empleos desde su negocio, donde se presta el servicio de confección a terceros labor que aprendió hace 18 años y desde entonces se ha dedicado a pulir sus técnicas para brindar un buen servicio y poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, sin embargo así como se preocupa por sus clientes, es para Dálidad muy importante la comodidad de sus empleadas ya que el lugar donde trabajan es un espacio cerrado donde el calor muchas veces no las deja cumplir adecuadamente con los pedidos ya que en algunas ocasiones el calor para la producción, es por esto que hoy Dálida solicita un prestamos con el cual hacerle adecuaciones a las instalaciones de su microempresa, en las cuales comprará ventiladores que le brinden frescura y comodidad a sus empleadas y una mejora en el piso, el cual no tiene el material adecuado para el progreso de la microempresa. 

Esta emprendedora sueña con poder en un futuro generar más empleos y convertir su negocio en un legado que mejore su economía y su calidad de vida en un futuro.
texts.en:
Dálida is an enterprising woman, who at her 42 years of age is the owner of a micro-enterprise that has been in existence for eight years. She is a woman who has fought to pursue her dreams, and as the mother of two children, she hopes to be able to offer them a better quality of life in the future. 

Currently Dálida generates four employment positions with her business, in which she provides dressmaking services to others. She learned the work 18 years ago and since then has dedicated herself to polishing her techniques, in order to provide a good service and be able to meet the needs of her clientele. However, while she is concerned for her customers, for Dálida her employees' comfort is of great significance, since the place where they work is a closed-in area where the heat often does not allow them to fulfill orders adequately, owing to the heat at times in the production process. For this reason Dálida today is requesting a loan with which to make adaptations to the premises of her micro-business, namely that she will buy fans for bringing fresh air and comfort to her employees, and improve the flooring, which is not of appropriate material for the advancement of the micro-business. 

Dálida dreams of one day being able to generate more employment, and of turning her business into a legacy which may improve her finances and future quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fans and make improvements to the premises.

loans.name: 30 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “30 DE DICIEMBRE” iniciará su segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Patricia. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: confección de overoles, venta de ropa americana, producción de lienzos y sogas, taller de costura y colchones, venta de velas,  venta de frescos y venta de pitas

La señora Patricia,  indica que hace un año que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora en la zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de trenzado de pitas, negocio que viene trabajando hace dos años aprendiendo el mismo de su familia.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de la calle Huyustus y lo comercializará a pedido en diferentes mercados. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros
texts.en:
The Community Association "December 30th" is beginning its second lending cycle through Pro Mujer, as part of the Andes focal center.  The Association is made up of ten members and is led by a board headed by Señora Patricia.  The businesses that community association members conduct are varied, among them are: manufacturing overalls, selling American clothes, making canvas and rope, a workshop for sewing and mattresses, selling candles, selling sodas and selling fresh agave.

Señora Patricia says that she's been working with Pro Mujer for a year, and that she integrated with the institution at the invitation of a spokesperson in the area.  She currently has a business braiding agave fibers.  It's a business that she has been working in for two years, learning it from her family.

The loan that she will now be drawing on is to raise capital for the purchase of fibers that she acquires on Huyustus Street and sells to order in different markets. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family, as she is married and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says she likes the savings.

loans.use: to buy agave fibers.

loans.name: Los Girasoles De Compone Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LOS GIRASOLES DE COMPONE”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Srta. Tania Nélida; ella es soltera y tiene 36 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja con su negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes, gallinas y chanchos y también tiene un pequeño terreno de cultivo donde siembra maíz y verduras y luego los vende en las distintas ferias que existe en el distrito de Compone y los animales también lo vende en el mercado de Anta, la socia por medio de estos pequeños negocios saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de animales y mejorar sus negocio de agricultura. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar animales y alimentos para los animales y para comprar semillas para las tierras de cultivo.

Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de venta de lácteos, negocio de venta de queso, negocio de venta de verduras, negocio de venta de leche, negocio de ganadería.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These borrowers belong to the "Los Girasoles de Compone" ["The Sunflowers of Compone"]. The bank is located in the district of Anta, which is part of Anta province, department of Cusco. 

One member is Ms. Tania Nélida. She is single, 36 years old, and has one son. She works in her business raising young animals like guinea pigs, chickens, and pigs. She also has a small plot of land where she plants corn and vegetables, which she sells at the various markets in the district of Compone. She also sells her animals at the market in Anta. Through these small businesses, Tania is able to help her child get ahead. She would like to expand her animal sales business and to improve her agriculture business. She is requesting this loan to buy animals and feed for them and to buy seeds for her fields.

The other members' businesses include: dairy sales, cheese sales, vegetable sales, milk sales, and cattle.

Tania is grateful to those who, through this means, will form a part of her dream. She promises to comply with her repayment plan according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy animals and feed for them, as well as seeds to plant

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha nos cuenta que nació en la comunidad del Tambo Real (provincia de Anta, departamento Cusco, Perú), tiene 34 años de edad y es casada y tiene dos hijos. Actualmente, Martha vive en la misma comunidad donde nació y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas. Martha se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para hacer el mantenimiento de los galpones osea limpiar y arreglar los malogrados. 

Martha es una persona trabajadora y responsable que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal “Solidaridad de Tambo Real” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
A native of Tambo Real (a community located in the Anta province, Cusco department), Martha is 34 years old, she is married and has two children. Martha currently lives in the same community where she was born, and here she engages in her economy activities. She breeds small animals such as “cuyes” (“cuy” is Quechua for Guinea pig). She has been engaging in this activity for various years now, and things are going very well thanks to the determination she works with. The loan she is requesting in this occasion will be used to pay for maintenance of her sheds, or rather to clean and fix the broken ones.

Martha is a responsible and hardworking woman, and thanks to these qualities she has been invited to join “Solidaridad de Tambo Real” (Tambo Real Solidarity), a communal bank of Asociación Arariwa, by its fellow members.

loans.use: To pay for maintenance of her sheds.

loans.name: Ramona De La Concepcion

texts.es: Ramona De La Concepción tiene 2 hijos de 22 y 27 años, su negocio es la venta de mercadería en general, inicio su negocio desde hace 23 años lo aprendió de su Mama ya que Ramona la acompañaba a vender en el mercado fue así como ella logro relacionarse con los clientes y obtener fama.  Con el financiamiento quiere comprar productos como sabanas, toallas, ropa en general, calzado, cosméticos y bolsos. Agradece a la financiera por el gran apoyo al desarrollo de su negocio.
texts.en: Ramona De La Concepción has 2 children aged 22 and 27. She runs a general store, an activity she started 23 years ago. Ramona learnt from her mother, while going with her at the market. This is how she succeeded in mixing with customers and in gaining a reputation. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy products such as bed sheets, towels, clothes, shoes, cosmetics and bags. She is thankful to the financial institution for the great support offered to the development of her activity.

loans.use: To buy products such as bed sheets, towels, clothes, shoes, cosmetics and bags.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma, 31, was born in Yucay and still lives there. She lives with her partner and has one child who is four years old. Norma has a farm on which she produces vegetables such as onions, lettuces and cabbages. In addition, she raises guinea pigs in order to sell them. With her $1,000 loan Norma plans to buy guinea pigs and better tools in order to cultivate her crops. Her dream is to eventually purchase cars and become a driver who transports people from place to place. She is very dedicated to her work and promises to follow through with all the necessary payments.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and tools for her farm.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
El señor Juan es casado, tiene 35 años de edad, tiene un hijo, con quien vive en casa propia.
Juan es muy trabajador, ya que trabaja de lunes a lunes. Dice que de lunes a viernes trabaja en una estación de expendio de combustibles y fines de semana trabaja vendiendo de forma ambulante todo tipo de artículos. Gracias al esfuerzo conjunto, es decir, el de él y su esposa, lograron construir una casa y su máximo sueño es elevar su nivel de vida y así aportar a su hijo una buena educación y que el día de mañana cuente con el apoyo suficiente para lograr una profesión digna para enfrentar los vaivenes económicos que sufren los habitantes del tercer mundo.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de sabanas, frazadas, y demás para la posterior venta. Cree que el credito le sera de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Juan is married, 35 years old, and has one son. He sells a variety of items from door to door, a profession he learned from infancy because his parents also did this type of work and taught him the same. Juan is very industrious, working every day of the week. He notes that his wife supports him by producing bedspreads, which minimizes the cost. Thanks to their joint efforts, they succeeded in building a house. Their greatest dream is to improve their quality of life and to give their son a good education so that, in the future, he can secure a dignified job to help him face the economic swings suffered by inhabitants of the third world.

He is requesting this loan to buy more sheets, blankets, and other items to resell. He thinks that this loan will be a great help.

loans.use: to purchase sheets, blankets, and other items

loans.name: Duo Mujeres Con Bendicion Group

texts.es: Duo Mujeres Con Bendicion:la señora Enma se dedica a vender tortillas desD. hace varios años siendo la lider D. ese duo  a lado D. su esposo ella sigue luchando para sacar adelante esta solicitando este credito para la compra D. maiz por mayor para la elavoracion D. tortillas el sueño D. ella es tener un comal industrial y tener un local mas a la orillas D. la calle al igual que la otra socia se dedica a la  venta D. calzado variado tambien ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra D. calzado para surtir su negocio y asi aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
'Mujeres Con Bendicion' group.

Enma has been selling tortillas for several years.  She is the leader of this two-member group.  AlongsiD. her husband, she continues working hard in order to get ahead in life.  She is requesting this loan to buy corn wholesale for making her tortillas.  Her dream is to have an industrial 'comal' (a special pan used for cooking tortillas) and additional premises at the edge of the street.

The other member of this group sells footwear.  She is requesting this loan to buy footwear to stock her business and thereby increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy corn for making tortillas

loans.name: Daniela

texts.en: Daniela is 19 years old and lives in Ibarra, Ecuador. She is single and lives on her own with her four-year-old daughter. Daniela is a sociable and friendly person. She recently began her own small business selling Yanbal, a brand of cosmetics products that are sold by individual women entrepreneurs across the country. She wants to expand the amount of products she is able to offer though Yanbal and is seeking this microloan to purchase more cosmetics for resale. This is her first loan and she hopes it will increase the products she sells and add to her well-being and the well-being of her family. In the future, she hopes to own a Yanbal store.

loans.use: to purchase more Yanbal brand cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Activas se denomina el excelente grupo D. mujeres conformado en L. ciudad VilL. Elis, gracias a que L. Sra. Anna, contactó con L. asesora en una reunión semanal que L. misma tenía en L. zona, para informarse D. L. forma D. trabajo que tiene el Comité D. Mujeres Emprendedoras,una vez asesorada acerca del Programa logró juntar a 15 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 4° ciclo,en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro sel programa.
L. Sra Anna se dedica a L. venta D. comidas hace ya varios años. Comenta que todos los dias empieza su jornada desD. muy tempranas horas, prepara todos los alimentos que va a vender. ElL. por medio D. este trabajo ha logrado mantener a su familia. Se siente muy orgullosa D. si misma, ya que gracias a su esfuerzo pudo obtener todo lo que tiene.
ElL. solicita el credito para L. compra D. los insumos que necesita para L. elaboraiocn D. los alimentos, somo ser carnes, huevos, especias, pastas y demas.
texts.en:
"Mujeres Activas" ["Active Women"] is the name of this excellent group of women that formed in the city of VilL. Elis, thanks to Ms. Anna. Anna contacted the adviser at a weekly meeting she had in the area to inform people of how the Committee of Women Entrepreneurs Program works. Once Anna was educated about the program, she was able to gather 15 women who are now very pleased to be working in their fourth loan cycle. They work with solidarity and in a unified manner within the program.

Ms. Anna has been selling food for many years. She says that every day she starts working at a very early hour, preparing the dishes she will sell. Through this work, she has succeeded in maintaining her family. She feels very proud of this, as she has been able to achieve everything she has thanks to her efforts.

She is requesting this loan to purchase ingredients that she needs for making her dishes, such as meat, eggs, spices, pasta, and others.

loans.use: to buy meat, eggs, spices, pasta, and other ingredients

loans.name: Juana Marlene

texts.en: Juana Marlene, who goes by her middle name, is 36 years old and lives in the city of Ibarra. She is single and lives on her own. Marlene is a sociable and friendly person who works as an artisan. Her craft is embroidery. She began her embroidery work recently and is starting her business with the help of this loan. This is her first loan and it will go toward cloth and thread for dressmaking. She hopes that this loan will help her increase the amount of dresses she is able to make for her customers and that it will increase her well-being. Marlene’s goal is to have her own business and export her dresses.

loans.use: to buy cloth and thread for dressmaking.

loans.name: Las Palmeras Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LAS PALMERAS”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luz Marina; la socia tiene 32 años de edad, la socia es casada, La socia tiene 2 hijos; La socia se dedica a la elaboración de diferentes platos típicos, la socia trabaja vendiendo sus platos de comidas en el centro comercial paraíso, la socia solía trabajar atendiendo un kiosco escolar en la época escolar y ahora está elaborando comidas; la socia también es dueña de un stand en el centro comercial Paraíso y su esposo atiende el stand de venta de calzados; la socia trabaja mucho para poder dar lo mejor a sus hijos en cuanto a una buena educación, la socia desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de ingredientes e insumos para la elaboración de sus platos diversos y de este modo poder crecer e incrementar sus ventas.

Los otros socios invertirán su dinero en la venta de condimentos, reciclaje, venta de chatarra, venta de gas a pedido, elaboración de picarones, tejido de chompas.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
This member is part of the “Las Palmeras” communal bank, located in the Huanchac district of the Province and Department of Cusco.

Luz Marina is 32 years old, is married, and has two children.  She makes and sells various typical dishes in the Paraíso shopping center.  She used to run a kiosk when she attended school, but now she makes food.  She also owns a stand in the Paraíso shopping center, where her husband sells shoes.  Luz works hard in order to be able to provide a good education for her children.  She wants to invest the money from this loan into supplies and ingredients to make her various dishes so that she can increase her sales.

The other members will invest their money into making condiments, recycling, scrap metal sales, gas sales to order, desserts, and knitting sweaters.

She appreciates the support and is likewise committed to make her payments faithfully.

loans.use: to buy supplies and ingredients

loans.name: Virgen Inmaculada Concepcion Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN INMACULADA CONCEPCION”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito D. Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia D. Urubamba y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Srta. Alejandrina; ella es casada y tiene 67 años; La socia trabaja con su negocio D. venta D. animales y el negocio D. venta D. chicha que es una bebida a base D. maíz, la socia venD. animales como chanchos, cuyes y pollos los hace engordar y crecer y luego los venD. en las diferentes ferias que existe en la provincia D. Urubamba y la chicha también lo venD. en forma ambulatoria, por medio D. estos pequeños negocios sale adelante junto a su esposo, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio D. venta D. animales y negocio D. venta D. chicha. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar animales como chanchos, cuyes y gallinas y también para comprar maíz y jora para preparar la chicha.


Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio D. venta D. fruta, negocio D. venta D. verduras, negocio D. venta D. agricultura, negocio D. venta D. chicha, negocio D. tienda D. abarrotes.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte D. este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members are part of the Communal Bank “Virgen Inmaculada Concepcion” which is located in the District and Province of Urubamba, Department of Cusco.

One of the members is Sra. Alejandrina. She is married and 67 years of age. Alejandrina has one business selling animals and another one selling “chicha”, a beverage maD. from corn. She sells animals such as pigs, guinea pigs, and chickens. Once the animals are fattened, she sells them at different fairs throughout Urubamba Province. Alejandrina sells “chicha” as a street vendor. Through her small businesses, she and her husband are able to get ahead. Alejandrina wants to expand and improve both of her businesses, so she is requesting a loan to buy animals (such as pigs, guinea pigs, and chickens) and also corn and maize for making “chicha”.

The other members engage in business activities such as selling fruit, selling vegetables, farming, selling “chicha”, and selling groceries.

Alejandrina would like to thank those responsible for making this part of her dream a reality. She also promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to purchase pigs, guinea pigs, and chickens, as well as corn for making "chicha".

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Alicia tiene muchas energías para seguir trabajando, tiene 58 años y vive sola en su casa que es propia. En su tierra natal ha trabajado como agricultora así como en la crianza de animales, sus padres siempre le encomendaron cuidar del ganado ovino y vacuno, de las cuales aprendió lo necesario. Una vez que se casó, ella y su esposo compartieron 20 años de experiencia sembrando juntos los terrenos que heredaron y produciendo en cantidades suficientes para generarse ganancias. Pero ella considera más rentable la actividad ganadera, por ello desea aumentar la cantidad de animales que tiene en su establo. Es su décimo crédito que tiene con MFP,  siempre ha trabajado de manera grupal de las cuales ha disfrutado de gratos momentos con los demás integrantes del grupo solidario a los que pertenece. Considera que los préstamos son un apoyo vital para el crecimiento de su negocio ya que puede verlo de su propia experiencia. Con el dinero que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de 2 toros para su establo.
texts.en:
Alicia has plenty of energy to continue working. She is 58 years old and lives alone in her own home. In the land of her birth, Alicia works as a farmer and also raises animals. Her parents always entrusted her with the care of the sheep and the cattle, so she learned what the work requires. After getting married, she and her husband shared 20 years of experience working on the land they inherited and producing sufficient quantities of products to generate income. However, she considers her most profitable activity to be raising cattle. For this reason, she wants to increase the number of animals in her stable.

This is her tenth loan with MFP. She has always worked as part of a solidarity group and enjoys the good times she has shared with the other members. Based on her own experience, Alicia considers the loans to be a vital form of support for growing her business. The money she requested will be invested in the purchase of two bulls for her stable.

loans.use: to purchase two bulls.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en: Dominga, 57, was born in Urquillos and currently lives there. She is married and has six children who all live independently from her. Her business is growing flowers on her farm, which she then sells at various markets around the Cusco region, such as Huancaro Market. She also raises guinea pigs and chickens on her farm, which she then sells. In addition to her farm, Dominga has a small grocery store that she runs from her house. With the $1,000 loan, Dominga plans to purchase fertilizer and insecticides to maintain the health of her flowers. She is committed to making all of the necessary payments on time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticides for her flower farm.

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es:
Yanet nos cuenta que nació en la comunidad del Tambo Real (provincia de Anta, departamento Cusco, Perú), tiene 35 años de edad y es madre soltera y tiene cinco hijos. Actualmente, Yanet vive en la misma comunidad donde nació y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas. Yanet se dedica  a la venta de leche en el mercado de Huancaro en la ciudad del Cusco los días sábados. Ella tambien se dedica a la producción  de queso en el mercado central del Cusco “San Pedro”. Ya son cinco años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar leche e insumos para preparar más quesos.  

Yanet es una persona trabajadora y responsable que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal “Solidaridad de Tambo Real” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Yanet says she was born in the community of Tambo Real in Anta Province, Department of Cusco, Peru. She is 35 years old and a single mother with five children. Yanet currently lives in the same community where she was born and has developed her business activities. She sells milk on Saturdays at the Huancaro Market in the city of Cusco. Yanet also produces cheese at the central market in Cusco called “San Pedro”. She has been in business for five years and has done very well as a result of the effort she puts into her work. At the moment, she is taking this opportunity to request a loan to buy milk and supplies for making more cheese.

Yanet is a hardworking and responsible person. As a result of these qualities, her fellow group members invited her to participate in the Communal Bank “Solidaridad de Tambo Real”, which is part of Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to purchase milk and supplies for making cheese.

loans.name: Alba

texts.en: Alba is 40 years old and lives in the city of Ibarra. She is single and lives with her children. She has a 19-year-old daughter, a 16-year-old daughter, a 15-year-old son and a 5-year-old daughter. Alba is sociable and friendly. She is an artisan who works on embroidery. She began her work with embroidery eight months ago when she was taught the craft by a friend. She works alongside her friends. This is Alba's second loan, which she will use to purchase cloth and fabric to make blouses and dresses. Her past loan helped her increase the articles of clothing she was able to produce for her customers. Alba also reports that the microloan helped her family’s well-being. Alba’s goal is to have a larger business and she dreams of exporting her embroidery one day.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and cloth to make blouses and dresses.

loans.name: Stanely

texts.en:
Stanely is 38 years old and lives in the town of Makindye in the Kampala central region of Uganda. He is married and has three children, all of whom are currently in school. Stanely has a a small retail shoe shop business, which he has run for three years. He also has a produce business that sells beans and maize.
To help expand his business, Stanely has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase shoes for resale. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Stanely hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. In the future, Stanely hopes to expand his business and buy more shoes.

loans.use: to purchase shoes for resale.

loans.name: Rosas De Mercedes Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSAS DE MERCEDES” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Hilaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de galletas y dulces, tienda comercial, albañilería, cerrajería, ayudante de albañil, venta de comida.

La señora Hilaria,  indica que esta es la primera ves que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora y su hija. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida que viene trabajando desde hace mucho tiempo.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de verduras), que compraran por mayor de la ceja y posterior a la elaboración lo venderá en la cancha de su zona. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene seis hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y la verificación en el consultorio de salud.

En la fotografia existen dos acompañantes de la Banca comunal son familiares de las socias, pero se colocaron en la parte de atras
texts.en:
The “Rosas de Mercedes” community bank is about to start its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Santiago II regional office.  The group has eight members and is run by a board of directors which is led by Hilaria.  The businesses that the members of the group are engaged in are varied and include: selling cookies and sweet treats, a store, construction work, locksmith, builder's assistant and selling food.

Hilaria tells us that this is the first time that she has worked with Pro Mujer.  She joined through an invitation from a loan officer and her daughter.  She currently has a business selling food and she has been working in this business for a long time.

Hilaria will use this loan to increase her capital (buying vegetables).  She will buy them wholesale in La Ceja and, when she has made her food, she will sell it at the sports field in her area.  This work allows Hilaria to make money to support her family.  She is married and has six children.

When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the training and the check-ups in the health clinic.

* In the photo, there are two people who were accompanying members of the community bank.  They are family members but they stood at the back of the photo.

loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: Ismail

texts.en:
Ismail, a 35-year-old resident of the town of Makindye in the Kampala central region of Uganda, is married and has four children, three of whom are currently in school. For the past six years Ismail has operated a business selling charcoal, and he also has rental houses.

To help expand his business, Ismail has requested a loan of 2000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more charcoal for resale by which he hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. In the future, Ismail hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Byron Andres

texts.es:
Byron es un joven soñador que ha hecho de su creatividad y talento una manera de generar ingresos, Byron es un tatuador que viven en la ciudad de Medellín, del departamento de Antioquia quien lleva varios años ejerciendo esta labor no solo como una manera de expresarse y prestar un servicio satisfactorio a sus clientes si no también como una manera de salir adelante, generar ingresos y mejorar su situación económica.

Su mayor sueño es tener su propio local ya que actualmente atiende a sus clientes desde su casa, pero para esto él es conciente que tiene que seguir trabajando mucho y esforzarse por mejorar cada día, así el progreso que logrará poco a poco le brindará la oportunidad de cumplir sus sueños. Por ahora Byron está trabajando para mejorar el servicio, por lo tanto deberá comprar insumos e implementos de higiene indispensables para su labor, y solicita un crédito que le permita comprar dichas cosas con las cuales esta seguro mejorará su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Byron is a young dreamer who has turned his creativity and talent into a way of making money.  Byron is a tattoo artist who lives in the city of Medellín, in Antioquia department.  He has been in this line of work for several years.  It is not only a way of expressing himself and providing a satisfactory service to his customers but also a way to get ahead in life, make income and improve his financial situation.

Byron's biggest dream is to own his own premises since he currently serves his customers in his home.  However, in order to achieve this he is aware that he must continue working a lot and make an effort to improve every day.  In this way, the progress that he gradually makes will provide him with the opportunity to fulfil his dreams.  For now, Byron is working to improve his service.  He needs to buy supplies and hygiene tools which are essential for his work.  He is requesting a loan that will enable him to buy these items.  He is certain that this will enable him to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies and hygiene tools

loans.name: Milly

texts.en:
Milly, a 45-year-old resident of the town of Makindye in the Kampala central region of Uganda, is single and has four children, three of whom are currently in school. For over 10 years Milly has operated a business selling beans and rice, and she also has rental houses.

To help expand her business, Milly has requested a loan of 2000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to purchase beans and rice to stock for resale in order to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. In the future, Milly hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice to stock for resale.

loans.name: Seyram

texts.fr: Responsable d’un salon de coiffure, Seyram a 29ans. Elle vend des mèches et défrisant qu’elle achète au Grand Marché de Lomé à ses clientes. Célibataire, Seyram sollicite ce prêt pour acheter 05 cartons de mèches et 18 boites de défrisant.
texts.en: Seyram is 29 years old and manages a hair salon. She sells hair extensions and hair relaxer, which she buys at the Grand Market in Lomé, to her clients. Unmarried, Seyram is seeking this loan to buy five boxes of hair extensions and 18 cans of hair relaxer.

loans.use: To buy hair extensions and relaxer.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
Leonarda vive en la ciudad de Tambo Real donde un grupo de personas en especiales mujeres formaron el banco comunal “Solidaridad de Tambo Real”. 

Leonarda es viuda, tiene 35 años y tiene cinco hijos, ella nos cuenta que se dedica a la ganadería y agricultura, ella vende leche y prepara queso en su domicilio. La mayoría de sus clientes son personas que vienen de la ciudad del Cusco y otras son de su comunidad. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar leche e insumos para preparar más quesos.
texts.en:
Leonarda lives in the city of Tambo Real, where a group of people, particularly women, make up the "Solidaridad de Tambo Real" communal bank.

Leonarda is a widow. She is 35 and has 5 children. She tells us that she works in livestock and agriculture. She sells milk and prepares cheese in her home. The majority of her customers are people who come from Cusco city, and others are from her community. She has had this business for several years and it is going very well for her, thanks to the hard work that she puts into her job. At the moment, she needs this loan to purchase milk and items to prepare more cheese.

loans.use: to purchase milk and supplies to prepare more cheese.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “REYNA DE LOS ANGELES DE URQUILLOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Marina; ella tiene 40 años de edad y es casada y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales y venta de animales, ella cría pollos y los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en el mercado del distrito de Urubamba, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m,por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de crianza de pollos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar pollos y alimentos para los pollos.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "REYNA DE LOS ANGELES DE URQUILLOS" which is located in the district and province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco.

Mrs. Marina, 40, is married and has five children.  She alternates her daily activities with her business raising chickens which she sells at market in the district of Urubamba.  Her work hours are from 8:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m.   With this small business she has been able to provide for her children.  She wants to expand and improve her business by using the loan to buy chickens and chicken feed.

She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back in time.

loans.use: To buy chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred, a 26-year-old resident of the town of Makindye in the Kampala central region of Uganda, is married and has one child who is not yet attending school. For the past three years Fred has operated a small retail shop that sells electronic items and plates. He also has rental houses.

To help expand his business, Fred has requested a loan of 2000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to purchase electronic items and plates for resale. With the help of the loan, he hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for his family. In the future, Fred aspires to earn more profits and send his child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase electronic items and plates for resale.

loans.name: Dodzi

texts.fr: Revendeuse d’épices (ail, piment, cube) et d’huile végétale depuis 2005, Dodzi a 03 enfants et son conjoint est revendeur. Elle est à son premier prêt et veut ce montant pour  acheter 03 bidons d’huile végétale et des épices pour contribuer aux charges de la famille.
texts.en: A retailer of spices (garlic, peppers, bouillon cubes) and vegetable oil since 2005, Dodzi has three children and her spouse is a retailer. She is on her first loan and would like to use the amount to buy three cans of vegetable oil and spices for resale in order to contribute to providing for her family.

loans.use: To buy spices, oil, and onions.

loans.name: Jalia

texts.en:
Jalia is 33 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom are currently in school. Jalia has a beauty salon business that sells body lotions and braids for the hair. She has run this business for six years.
To help expand her business, Jalia has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase braids and body lotions for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Jalia hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family. In the future, Jalia hopes to expand her business further.

loans.use: to purchase braids and body lotions for resale.

loans.name: Amidatou

texts.fr: Revendeuse de tissu, pagnes et des petits trucs depuis 01 an, Amidatou s’approvisionne au Grand marché de Lomé et revend  au marché d’Akodessewa. Elle est mariée à un revendeur et est maman de 02 enfants. Ce prêt l’aidera à renforcer son activité afin de subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en: Amidatou has been selling fabrics, pagnes (colorful West African cloths) and haberdasheries for one year. She gets her supplies at the Great Market in Lomé and resells at the market in Akodessewa. She is married to a merchant and is the mother of two children. This loan will enable her to boost her activity level in order to provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and pagnes.

loans.name: Lovisa

texts.en:
Lovisa is 50 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is single and has three children, one of whom is currently in school. Lovisa has a stationery business, which she has run for five years. She also has rental houses.
To help expand her business, Lovisa has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase exercise books and reams of paper. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Lovisa hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, Lovisa hopes to start up another business.

loans.use: to purchase exercise books and reams of paper.

loans.name: Emelin Morena

texts.es:
Emelin, de 35 años, es originaria de León , de oficio comerciante, esta casada, es madre de dos hijos de 14 y 1 años de edad respectivamente. Ella es dueña de una pequeña pulpería ubicada en Subtiava  un barrio ubicado en León. Su primera experiencia como comerciante fue a los 25 años de edad ella tenían un negocio de ventas de fritanga (venta de comidas fritas), este negocio lo tuvo por 5 años, después decidió vender comida a los trabajadores de una fabrica textilera, lo hizo por tres años y hace dos años que decidió poner la pulpería con apoyo de su esposo y su hija que le ayuda a atender la venta después de la escuela.
Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar inventario tales como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, maíz, trigo, huevo. Con esta inversión espera tener variedad de productos que ofrecer a sus clientes, satisfacer la demanda que tiene, aumentar su clientela y mejorar sus ingresos. Además ella quiere poner en marchas uno de sus objetivos futuros que es comprar un vehículo para que su esposo venda granos básicos ambulante por las calles de la ciudad y de esta manera tenga otros ingresos.
Ella quiere convertir su venta en una distribuidora de productos varios.
texts.en:
35-year-old Emelin is a retail merchant from León. She is married with two children, aged 14 and 1. She is the owner of a small grocery store in Subtiava, a neighborhood located in León. Emelin's first experience as a trader was at the age of 25, when she ran a business selling fried foods. She had this business for 5 years, after which she decided to sell food to workers in a textile factory and did so for three years. Two years ago she decided to set up the grocery store with the support of her husband and daughter, who helps in the store after school. 

Emelin needs this loan to purchase stock such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, corn, wheat, and eggs. With this loan she hopes to be able to offer her customers a variety of products and meet their demands, grow her client base, and increase her income. Furthermore, she aims to achieve one of her future goals - to buy a vehicle for her husband which will enable him to travel around the city selling bulk beans and grains, and thus establish an additional source of income. Emelin would like to transform her small shop into a distributor of a variety of products.

loans.use: to purchase stock such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, corn, wheat, and eggs.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen es natural de Sicaya, tiene 53 años, toda su vida radicó en este lugar y en la actualidad vive con su esposo y su hija en su casa propia. Posee una granja donde cría animales menores, actividad que lo realiza desde hace 2 años. Ella posee espacios grandes de terrenos que se encuentran cercanos a su casa, ahí construyó un ambiente grande para sus aves como pollos y gallinas; ahora también de cuyes, que los vende periódicamente y  es administrado por uno de un familiar de confianza y que son socios actualmente. La venta de pollos ha ido en aumento porque tiene un cuidado especial con sus animales, además de que siempre esta pendiente de ver lo mejor para el crecimiento de su negocio. En adelante desea tener una granja grande y ser abastecedora de estos animales dentro de su zona. Viene trabajando de manera grupal en MFP por medio de la invitación personal de sus vecinos la cual se animó a integrar y en la actualidad este es su crédito número 16, por el cual solicita un préstamo en beneficio de su negocio. Con el dinero que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de cuyes productores y en la siembra de alfalfa que sirve de forraje para sus animales.
texts.en:
Carmen, 53, is from Sicaya and has lived there all her life.  She lives with her husband and daughter in her own house, and has a farm where she has been raising small animals for two years.  Near her house she has two large strips of land where she built a house for her chickens.  Now she also raises and sells guinea pigs and is in business with a relative.  Chicken sales have increased thanks to her special care with the animals.  She is always looking for ways to improve and grow her business.

In the future she wants to have a larger farm so she can be the main supplier in the area.  She has been working as part of a group through MFP which she was asked to join through an invitation from neighbors who encouraged her to join.  This is her 16th loan, which she plans to use to buy guinea pigs for breeding and to plant alfalfa seeds which will be used as fodder.

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs and alfalfa seeds.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is 35 years old and lives in the town of Gaba in the Kampala central region of Uganda. He is married and has seven children, four of whom are currently in school. Henry has a small retail shop that sells essential commodities such as sugar. He has run this business for four years. He also has rental houses.
To help expand his business, Henry has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities, such as sugar, for resale. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Henry hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. In the future, he hopes to expand his retail business further.

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities, such as sugar, for resale.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria, 49, who was born in Urubamba and currently resides there, is the married mother of four children, three of whom live independently. A farmer for 30 years, she cultivates a wide variety of vegetables such as corn, onions, lettuce, cauliflower, and potatoes. The crops that she chooses to grow are based upon the different seasons. When she is not able to grow vegetables on her farm, Victoria goes to the market to buy vegetables that she then sells to her clients.

Victoria is requesting a $600 loan in order to buy vegetables to bring to her clients so that she does not lose their business. She is committed to making all necessary payments on time.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell to her clients when her farm is not producing enough.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 32 years old and lives in the town of Gaba in the Kampala central region of Uganda. He is married and has five children, two of whom are currently in school. John has a wholesale shop business that sells produce such as maize. He has run this business for two years.
To help expand his business, John has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase and stock more produce for resale. With the help of his loan from BRAC, John hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. In the future, he hopes to expand his business further.

loans.use: to purchase and stock more produce for resale.

loans.name: Afiwavi

texts.fr: Jeune dame de 30ans,  Afiwavi  achète du mais dans les villages et fermes du Togo et revend dans un marché de la place.  Elle a 01 enfant. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer  son activité afin de répondre plus à la demande.
texts.en: Afiwavi is a young lady of 30 years. She buys corn in villages and farms in Togo and resells it at the local market. She is the mother of one child. She applies for this loan to strengthen her business and better meet the demand of her customers.

loans.use: to buy sacks of corn.

loans.name: Isimah

texts.en:
Isimah is 29 years old and lives in the town of Gaba in the Kampala central region of Uganda. He is married and has one child, who does not currently attend school. Isimah has a health clinic business, which he has run for four years. He also has rental houses.
To help expand his business, Isimah has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase medicine to sell at the clinic. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Isimah hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for his family. In the future, he hopes to expand his clinic further.

loans.use: to purchase medicine to sell at his clinic.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.en:
Blanca is 47 years old and lives in Machachi in central Ecuador. She is divorced and lives in her own house with her two children. Her daughter is 13 years old and her son is 10 years old. Blanca is a person who fights adversity and her enterprising personality gives her the ability to move forward with her children.
Blanca has a car wash service that was established as a family business. The business washes, vacuums and sprays cars. It also does oil changes, air filters and gas filters. Through this loan, Blanca is going to finance new machinery. She began working in 1994 with only one machine. Later, with her profits, she began growing the business little by little. Now, with the help of a loan from Kiva partner, FODEMI, she is better equipping her business. She is seeking this loan to continue equipping her business, changing old and obsolete machines for more modern ones. Blanca hopes this loan will improve her equipment and that her family will have a larger income. She wants it to improve their quality of life. Blanca’s goals are to continue her family’s business tradition and for her family to have good health.

loans.use: to upgrade the machinery at her auto service station

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Assaba Ayaba

texts.fr: Assaba  est âgée de 55ans. Elle est sage- femme de profession. Son mari est retraité et ils ont deux enfants. Pour  répondre aux besoins de la famille, elle fait du bon yaourt et vend à ses collègues à l’Hôpital de Bé. Cet argent lui servira à acheter des sacs de lait, du sucre et des aromes.
texts.en: Assaba is 55 years old. She is a midwife by profession. Her husband is retired, and they have two children. In order to provide for the family’s needs, she prepares tasty yogurt and sells it to her coworkers at the Bé Hospital. These funds will allow her to buy bags of milk [powder], sugar and flavors.

loans.use: to buy bags of sugar and milk

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 38 years old and lives in the town of Gaba in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is married and has 6 children.  Two of her children are currently in school.  Ruth has a business selling clothes, which she has had for 6 years.  She has rental houses.

To help expand her business, Ruth has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase clothes for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Ruth hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.  In the future, Ruth hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr: Veuve de 36ans, Abra a 02 enfants. Elle a commencé en 2009 par vendre des bijoux, sacs et chaussures à toutes personnes. Ce prêt lui servira à acheter des marchandises afin de subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en: Abra is a 36 year old widow with two children.  In 2009, she started selling jewelry, handbags and shoes to the public. This loan will help her to buy merchandise, the sale of which will help her to meet the needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy jewelry and handbags.

loans.name: Maria Cleofe

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “REYNA DE LOS ANGELES DE URQUILLOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria Cleofe; ella tiene 53 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de pollos y también tiene un negocio de tienda de abarrotes donde vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azúcar,aceite y fideos y los pollos lo vende en las diferentes ferias que existe en la provincia de Urubamba, por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de crianza de pollos y mejorar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar alimentos para los pollos y productos para las tiendas de abarrotes.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "REYNA DE LOS ANGELES DE URQUILLOS" which is located in district and province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco.

Ms. Maria Cleofe, 53, is single and has son.  She alternates her daily activities with her chicken raising business and grocery store where she sells basic needs items such as rice, sugar, oil, and pasta.  The chickens are sold at the different fairs held throughout the province of Urubamba.  With her income she has been able to provide for her family.  She wants to expand her chicken business and improve her grocery store.  The loan she is requesting will be used to buy chicken feed and products for her store.

She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed and products for her grocery store.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is 40 years old and lives in the town of Makindye in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is married and has 4 children. Two of her children are currently in school. Justine has a business of selling clothes, which she has had for 3 years.  She has rental houses.  

To help expand her business, Justine has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase clothes for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Justine hopes to generate greater profits and buy basic needs for her family.  In the future, Justine hopes to open up another branch that sells clothes.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale

loans.name: Jesus Pan De Vida Group

texts.es:
La Alcancía Comunal “Jesús Pan de Vida” es un grupo responsable que se mantiene unido y está conformada por 10 personas dedicadas a diversas actividades de comercio y en donde la Sra Carmen Rosa lo preside hace mas de 1 año.
Carmen Rosa es casada y tiene 2 hijos, la cual sigue apoyando al menor de ellos en sus estudios. Carmen Rosa se dedica  a la   venta de productos de belleza llevando así mas de 4 años dedicándose a dicho rubro, a sus 41 años Carmen se siente feliz porque ha logrado sacar adelante con la ayuda de sus esposo  a sus hijos. El deseo de  Carmen es de terminar de construir su vivienda para   poder instalar una bodega en donde pueda vender productos de primera necesidad y habilitar habitaciones para que pueda alquilar. Con el préstamo solicitado piensa comprar colonia, talcos, cremas, entre otros productos en oferta. La Alcancía Comunal “Jesús Pan de Vida” están comprometido a seguir trabajando bien con el Programa.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Jesús Pan de Vida" is as responsible, united group comprised of ten people who are involved in different areas of commerce.  Mrs. Carmen Rosa has been the president of the group for over a year.

Carmen Rosa is married and has two children, the youngest of which is still in school.  Carmen Rosa has been selling beauty products for over four years.  At age 41, she is happy that she has been able to help provide for her husband and children.  Her dream is to build a house with enough space to set up a store to sell basic needs products, and to fix up rooms to be rented.

She plans to use the loan to buy cologne, talcum powder and creams, among other items.  The communal bank "Jesús Pan de Vida" is committed to continue working well with the Program.

loans.use: To buy cologne, talcum powder and creams.

loans.name: Milagro Group

texts.es:
El grupo Milagro lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora Margarita del Carmen de 39 años quien se dedica al comercio de productos Avon y ropa desde hace 10 años. Ella inicio con la empresa Avon, ya que esta proporciona sus productos al crédito y luego fue creciendo e invirtiendo. 
Ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos a su cargo de 17 y 12 años de edad y su meta es sacar adelante a sus hijos.
Las otras integrantes son Brígida de 24 años comerciante de productos Avon y ropa, y Berta Adilia vende comida desde hace 3 años.
texts.en:
The Milagro group is comprised of three hard-working, enterprising women, one of whom is Mrs. Margarita del Carmen, 39, who has been selling Avon products and clothing for the last ten years.  She started with Avon since they supply products on a credit basis, and then she began growing and investing.

She is single and has two children under her care, ages 17 and 12.  Her goal is to see her family get ahead.

The other members of the group are Brígida, 24, who sells Avon products and clothing, and Berta Adilia, who has been selling food for three years.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Jeune dame de 25ans,  Akouvi vend des produits congelés (poisson ailes de dinde…) à Bé Kpota (un quartier de la place). Elle est dans l’activité depuis 2006 et s’approvisionne à Lomé.  Son mari est employé de société et ils ont 02 enfants. Une personne l’aide dans l’exercice de son activité.
texts.en: Akouvi, a young woman of 25, sells frozen products (fish, turkey wings, etc.) in Bé Kpota, a district of her locale.  She has been doing this type of work since 2006 and she gets her supplies in Lomé.  Her husband is employed by the bank and they have two children.  One other person helps her in her business.

loans.use: to buy frozen products such as fish and turkey wings.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy pepper, cooking oil, salt, margi, tomatoes, etc. in a larger quantity to add to her business

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy is 50 years old and lives in the town of Gaba in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is widowed and has no children. Teddy has a poultry firm business, which she has had for 2 years.         

To help expand her business, Teddy has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase chicken for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Teddy hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself.  In the future, Teddy hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicken for resale

loans.name: Rocio

texts.en:
Rocio, 40, was born in Quillabamba and currently resides in Urubamba. She has three children and lives with her partner.

Rocio is a cook for a woman who has a restaurant that serves local workers. She is saving up to buy her own house. With the 200 dollar loan, she plans to begin to construct a house for herself. It is her dream to have her own house because right now she rents her house from the children of the woman for whom she works. Rocio is very ambitious and is committed to making all the necessary payments on time.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of her new house

loans.name: Yawo

texts.fr: Couturier de profession, Yawo a crée son salon de couture en 1996. A cette activité, il ajoute la vente des tissus, des matériels de couture (épingle, ruban, fermetures). Sa femme est revendeuse .Il a 39ans  et papa de 03 enfants.
texts.en: A clothing designer by profession, Yawo opened his fashion boutique in 1996.  In addition to this work, he sells fabric and sewing accessories such as pins, ribbons, and zippers. His wife is a saleswoman.  He is 39 and the father of three children.

loans.use: to buy fabric and sewing accessories.

loans.name: Scovia

texts.en:
Scovia is 38 years old and lives in the town of Ggaba in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is married and has three children. All of her children are currently in school.  

Scovia has a business of a bar and restaurant, which she has had for four years. She also has a poultry firm.  

To help expand her business, Scovia has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase beer, sodas and food for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Scovia hopes to generate greater profits and provide some basic needs for her family.  

In the future, Scovia hopes to become a popular businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase beer, sodas and food for resale.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 39 years old and lives in the town of Ggaba in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is widowed and has seven children. One of her children is currently in school. 

For the past year, Hellen has had a business of a small retail shop that sells essential commodities like sugar. She also has rental houses.  

To help expand her business, Hellen has requested a loan of 2,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities like sugar for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Hellen hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her child.  

In the future, Hellen hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities like sugar for resale.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es: Catalina tiene 52  años, vive  en compañía de su esposo e hijos en su casa que es propia. Toda su vida  ha trabajado en las tareas del campo, sus padres la enseñaron  a realizar estas tareas que a lo largo de los años se ha convertido en su fuente principal de ingresos.
