María Dolores will use her loan to buy merchandise in order to improve her business and continue growing.  Her goals are to improve her home and for her son to study and become a professional.

loans.use: to buy clothes (shirts, pants, etc.)

loans.name: San Marcos Group

texts.en: Dunia, Jose, and Alva, all of whom reside in Danli, Honduras, formed the San Marcos solidarity group in June, 2011. Dunia, the group leader, has made a living for the past year and a half by running a small convenience shop. Her shop is located near a busy street in her village, thus helping her sales. Dunia is requesting a loan of Lps. 8,000 with which to purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.use: to purchase beans, rice, cornmeal, cooking oil, butter, fruits, vegetables, snacks, candy, soft drinks, personal hygiene products, and household cleaning supplies for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bags of rice, sugar and noodles

loans.name: Duo Mujeres De Sumpango Sacatepequez Group

texts.es: Duo Mujeres D. Sumpango sacatepequez. este grupo esta conformado por doña Ericka quien es la lider D. este grupo quien se dedica a la venta D. ropa nueva variada para dama caballero y niños ella se dedica a esta actividad desD. ya hace barios años,ella nos cuenta que tiene muchos clientes que le hacen pedidos grandes pero que ella no pueD. satisfacer porque no cuenta con el capital necesario por eso esta solicitando este credito para la compra D. ropa variada y asi aumentar sus ventas y su ganancia,la Siguiente socia se dedica a la venta D. alimentos como empanadas tambien ella esta solicitando este credito porque nececita mas capital D. trabajo,
texts.en: The Women of Sumpango Sacatepequez Duo is a group including Ericka, who is the leader of the group and sells assorted new clothing for women, men, and children. She has been doing this for several years already and tells us that she has many customers who put in large orders that she is unable to meet because she lacks the necessary capital. That's why she's requesting this loan to purchase assorted clothing and increase her sales and profit. The second member sells food items like empanadas and she is also requesting this loan because she needs more capital.

loans.use: to purchase assorted clothing.

loans.name: Pedro Julio

texts.es: El Sr. Pedro  vive en la zona de chinchaya que esta ubicada a cuarenta minutos del centro de la ciudad. En esta localidad los comunarios se dedican a la crianza de vacas lecheras y al sembradío de verduras en el caso de las mujeres y los hombres al lavado de arena y piedra para construcción que sacan del rio. El Sr. Pedro vive acá toda su vida y antes se dedicaba a lavar arena pero como ya es un poco mayor de edad ahora trababa realizando el mantenimiento en el cementerio de mascotas. Él llegó a nuestra institución gracias a su hijo Eusebio quien lo recomendó para que trabaje con préstamos, el Sr.  pedro es una persona alegre y muy trabajadora y solicita el préstamo para la compra de herramientas nuevas, ya que su trabajo consiste principalmente en cavar nuevas tumbas para mascotas y hacer que el lugar siempre se vea limpio.
texts.en:
Pedro lives in Chinchaya area which is located forty minutes from the city center.  In this town, the women raise dairy cows and grow vegetables and the men wash building sand and stone which they pull from the river.  

Pedro has lived here his whole life.  He used to wash sand too but, as he is a little older, he now works maintaining a pet cemetery.  He came to our institution thanks to his son Eusebio who recommended him to work with loans.  Pedro is a cheerful and very hard-working person and he is requesting this loan to buy new tools as his work consists mainly of digging new graves for pets and making sure the place always looks clean.

loans.use: to buy tools for maintaining a pet cemetery

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa siempre ha sido muy trabajadora y esforzada, tiene 56 años de edad vive con su esposo y con el menor de sus 4 hijos en su casa que es propia. Tiene más de 40 años de experiencia en la agricultura, siembra papa y maíz en sus terrenos que posee. Sus hijos y su esposo trabajan activamente en estas tareas, del mismo modo posee una granja en donde cría cuyes; vacas, cerdos y ovejas, pues le  agrada trabajar en esta tarea, aunque reconozca que muchas veces es muy sacrificada. Las ventas de los productos que cosecha, le permiten recuperar el capital invertido, además de almacenar para su propio consumo; sin embargo tiene proyectos de incrementar su producción en las siguientes cosechas para poder vender a mayores cantidades y generarle ganancias. Por esta razón, desea  continuar y extender la siembra. Supo de MFP  por medio de sus vecinos que la invitaron a integrarse al banco comunal  de la cual se ha convertido en una integrante muy responsable, que cumple con los acuerdos. En esta ocasión el dinero que solicita,  lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono orgánico para sembrar papa.
texts.en:
Rosa has always been a very hard-working and dedicated person.  She is 56 years old and lives with her husband and the youngest of her four children in her own home.

Rosa has more than 40 years experience in farming.  She grows potato and corn on land that she owns.  Her children and husband work actively in this business too.  Rosa also owns a farm where she raises guinea pigs, cows, pigs and sheep as she enjoys this work although she recognizes that it is often very demanding.  The sale of the products which she harvests allow Rosa to recover the capital that she has invested.  She also stores some of her produce for her own consumption.  However, she has plans to increase her production in her upcoming harvests so that she can sell in larger quantities and make more profits.  She would like to continue and extend her sowing.

Rosa found out about MFP through her neighbors who invited her to join their community bank.  She has become a very responsible member of the bank who honors agreements.  On this occasion, she will invest the money that she is requesting in buying sacks of organic fertilizer so that she can sow her potatoes.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Ramon Justo

texts.es: El Sr. Ramon de profesión sastre desde hace varios años, su  taller se encuentra en la misma casa donde el vive y aparte que la casa es propia. El cliente de muy buena actitud el cliente es casado tiene dos hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, también vale recalcar que el señor tiene muchos clientes ya que su mano de obra es muy buena y actualmente tiene varios contratos vigentes por las festividades de la de la zona y la entrada universitaria, para esto solicita el crédito para la compra de telas. Nuestro cliente ya trabajo dos años con nuestra institución, es una persona responsable y muy trabajadora agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Ramon is a tailor by profession.  He has been in this business for several years.  His workshop is located in his home which he owns.

Ramon has a good attitude.  He is married and has two school-age children.  We should also stress that the gentleman has many customers as his labor is very good and he has several current contracts for the area's festivities and also the 'entrada universitária' parades.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan to buy fabric.

This client has been working with our institution for two years.  He is a responsible and very hard-working person who si grateful to the institution for the support he has received.

loans.use: to buy material and fabric

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es: El Señor Luis es cliente nuevo de la institución, el sr.  Fernando vive en la zona de chasqui pampa en la casa de sus padres, el tiene su movilidad y su terreno en Ovejuyo,  Luis trabaja en una línea de taxi trufis  desde hace cuatro años el es muy activo en el sindicato y sus compañeros lo conocen por ser muy colaborador el préstamo que esta solicitando es para la compra de llantas para  la movilidad ya que sus llantas ya están muy usadas y no quiere tener problemas en el transporte de sus pasajeros, es una persona joven y muy trabajador agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Luis is a new client of the institution.  He lives in the chasqui plains area in his parent's house.  He has his car and his land in Ovejuyo.  Luis drives on a taxi-trufi line (a fixed route taxi).  He has done this work for four years.  He is very active in the union, and his colleagues know him as being very cooperative.  

He is asking for this loan to purchase tires for his car since his tires are very used and he does not want to have problems transporting his passengers.  He is a young person and is very hard-working.  He is thankful to the institution for the support they have given him.

loans.use: to purchase tires.

loans.name: Sante Yalla Group

texts.fr:
le groupe de solidarité sante yalla a été créé le 16/06/2007.Il est composé de 21 femmes qui sont issues du même village.Leur principale activité est l'agriculture et le commerce.

Madame coumB. en position assise,à l'extreme droite sur la photo est responsable du groupement, elle est âgée de 53 ans ,veuve et mère de 06 enfant,en plus elle s'occupe de 03 autres enfants dont elle assure la charge.

Sa principale activité est le commerce de légumes et la culture du mil.Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience de cette activité pour l'avoir pratiquer plusieurs fois.

Son prêt lui permettra de s'approvisionner en quantité suffisante pour satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle.

Son objectif est de renforcer sa capacité d'épargne et d'améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Sante Yalla solidarity group was created 06/16/2007. It is composed of 21 women coming from the same village. Their main activities are agriculture and retail.

Mrs. CoumB., who is sitting all the way to the right in the photo, is the group leader. She is 53 years old, windowed, and a mother of six. Additionally, she takes care of three other children whom she supports financially.

Her main activities are retailing vegetables and growing millet. She is quite experienced in this activity for having practiced it several times.

Her loan will make it possible for her to procure enough supplies to meet customer demand. Her aim is to increase her saving capacity and to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase millet seeds.

loans.name: Marie Riviére Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité marie rivière a été créé le 28/06/2007.IL est composé de 18 membres issus de la même zone.Leur principale activité est le commerce.

Madame Victorine en position debout, à l'extreme droite sur la photo,levant le bras, est responsable du groupement,elle est âgée de 50 ans,elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants,en plus elle en charge un autre enfant dont elle assure la garde.

Sa principale activité est le commerce de tissus dont elle dispose une bonne expérience.

Son prêt lui permettra de s'approvisionner en quantité suffisante et d'investir dans une autre activité:l'élevage.

Son objectif est de renforcer son épargne,améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Solidarity group Marie Rivière was created on June 28, 2007. It is composed of 18 members, all coming from the same region. Their main activity is retail.

Mrs. Victorine, who is standing all the way to the right in the picture, with her hand raised, is the group's leader. She is 50 years old, married and a mother of three; she also supports another child, who is in her care.

Her main activity is fabric retail, in which she has a good amount of experience. Her loan will allow her to procure sufficient supplies and to invest in another activity, raising livestock. Her objective is to increase her savings and to improve her children's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fabrics.

loans.name: Nely Juana

texts.es: La Sra. Nely, tiene como actividad, el acopio D. fierros y chatarras las misma que venD. para su reciclaje, esta actividad se convierte en su principal fuente D. ingreso para su familia, que esta compuesta por su esposo y sus tres hijos, quienes también ayudan en esta actividad, es una familia muy unida y con muchas ganas D. surgir en la vida, el destino del crédito es comprar mercadería D. ocasión, así D. esta manera ayudar a mejorar los ingresos D. su familia, es una persona muy trabajadora agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Nely's business is collecting iron and scrap metal, which she sells for recycling. This work has become her main source of income for her family, which is maD. up of her husband and three children, who also help with this work. They are a very united family with a great desire to get ahead in life. The loan will be used to buy seasonal merchandise, which will help increase the family's income. She is a very hard-working person, and she is grateful for the support offered to her by the institution.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Sope Baye Niass Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité sope baye niass a été créé le 29/06/2009.Il est composé de 11 membres issus de la même localité.Leur activité principale est le commerce.

Madame Tabara en position assise , à l'extrême droite est la responsable du groupement elle est mariée, âgée de 45 ans et mère de 02 enfants .

Sa principale activité est le commerce de chaussures,d'écharpes,de mil et des arachides.

Son prêt lui permettra de s'approvisionner en quantité suffisante afin  de répondre à la demande de sa clientèle qui est essentiellement féminine.

Son objectif est d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaires,construire sa maison.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Sope Baye Niass was created on June 29, 2009. It is composed of eleven members from the same town. Their main work involves commerce. 

Ms. Tabara (seated at the far right in the photo) is the group's official. She is 45 years old, married, and the mother of two children.  Her main business involves commerce in footwear, scarves, millet, and peanuts. 

Her loan will enable her to stock up on a sufficient quantity of merchandise in order to respond to the demands of her customer base, which is essentially made up of women. Her goal is to increase her turnover and to build a house.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (footwear and scarves)

loans.name: Kawral Apress Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe kawral est créé Juin 2009  au jour de l’inauguration du banc villageois. Il est composé de 21 femmes qui toutes issues du même quartier. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce et la gestion de restaurant.

Madame Sounkara  (assise à extrême droite) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 55 ans, est mariée et mère de 04 enfants, elle a 07 autres membres de sa famille en charge (petits fils et petites filles).

Elle vend de la  bouillie de mil et niébé le soir. Cette activité, elle la maîtrise très bien pour l’avoir pratique pendant plus de vingt ans.

Avec ce prêt elle va acheter des sacs de mil du niébé et du sucre.

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront d’épargner  et  de soutenir ses petits enfants dans leur formation scolaire.
texts.en:
Kawral is a group that was created in June 2009 on the inauguration day of the Banc Villageois. The group is composed of 21 women who are all from the same district. Their main work involves small-scale commerce and managing restaurants.

Ms. Sounkara (seated at the far right in the photo) is the group's official. She is 55 years old, married, and the mother of four children. She has seven other family members to support (grandsons and granddaughters). She sells millet porridge and black-eyed peas in the evenings. She has mastered this business very well for having done it for over twenty years. 

With this loan, Ms. Sounkara is going to buy sacks of millet, black-eyed peas, and sugar. The profits from her business will enable her to save money and to support her grandchildren’s training and education.

loans.use: to buy sacks of millet, black-eyed peas, and sugar

loans.name: Aydee

texts.es: Aydee tiene 53 años, vive con su esposo  y sus 4 hijos en su casa que es propia. Toda su vida ha estado ligada a las tareas del campo, cada día trabaja en el campo, cuidando sus terrenos, fertilizándolas, ahí siembra papa y de algunas variedades, y las ganancias esperadas se da cuando logra cosechar una buena producción. Su deseo ahora es seguir implementando técnicas para optimizar sus cosechas. Por otro lado cría animales, como ovejas que luego son vendidas de manera periódica en la feria ganadera de su zona o algunos clientes acuden a su casa para comprarle. Es una de las socias más antiguas de su banco comunal que considera como su segundo hogar, porque  confía en cada uno de sus integrantes. Tiene más de 8 años trabajando con MFP y hasta el momento se considera muy puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita, comprará sacos de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Aydee is 53 years old and lives with her husband and their four children in their own home.  She has spent all of her life linked to work in the fields.  Each day, she works in the field, caring for her land, fertilizing it, and then planting potatoes and other varieties.  She earns the income she hopes for when her harvest has a good production.  Her dream now is to continue implementing techniques to optimize her harvests.  She also raises animals, such as sheep, that she later sells periodically in the livestock fair in her area or customers will come to her house to purchase them.  

She is one of the oldest members of her community bank, which she considers as her second home, because she trusts every one of the members.  She has worked with MFP for more than eight years and she has always been very punctual with her payments.  She is asking for this loan to purchase sacks of manure.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of manure.

loans.name: Tulipan Group

texts.es:
El grupo Tulipán lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora Luz Marina de 50 años quien inicio hace 13 años con un pequeño crédito en la empresa Avon, conocida por sus ventas vía catálogo. Ella con los préstamos ha podido comprar mayor cantidad de mercancía y crecer, además que su filosofía de trabajo es atender bien al cliente. 
Ella tiene tres hijos menores de 17, 15 y 14 años los cuales estudian y su sueño es aumentar su negocio y vender ropa. 
Las otras dos integrantes son Sandra Margarita quien inicio hace 8 años con pequeño termo a vender café con leche y pan, ahora vende más y María Salvadora tiene una pequeña venta en su casa.
texts.en:
The Tulipán ("Tulip") group is made up of three hard working and enterprising women.  One of them is Señora Luz Marina, aged 50.  Thirteen years ago, with a small loan, she started working with the Avon company, which is well known for its catalog sales.  With loans she has been able to buy more goods and grow further; not only that, but her business philosophy is to serve her clients well.

She has three young children aged 17, 15 and 14, who are students, and her dream is to grow her business and sell clothing.

The other two members are Sandra Margarita who started 8 years ago with a small thermos selling milky coffee and bread, now she sells more than that; and María Salvadora who has a small shop in her home.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Árbol Group

texts.es:
El grupo el árbol lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora Lidia Marina de 48 años quien desde 1981 inicio con una tortillería, luego empezó a realizar tamales, fritanga los fines de semana y postres. Ella con el crédito comprara un quintal de maíz, arroz, aceite, carne…etc. todo por mayor.
Las otras integrantes son Margot del Carmen de 60 años quien vende hace 20 años tiste, pozol, pan, huevo…etc.
Las otras integrantes del grupo Margot de 60 años se dedica al comercio de tiste, pozol, pan, huevo…etc. y Eugenia del Carmen de 20 años vende tiste, pozol y pan casero que trae de Mandaime.
texts.en:
The "El Árbol" ("The Tree") group consists of three hard-working and entrepreneurial women.  One of them is Lidia Marina, 48 years old, who started with a tortilla shop in 1981.  Then she began to make tamales and desserts and to run a restaurant on the weekends.  She will use the loan to purchase a hundred pounds of corn, as well as rice, oil, meat, etc., all wholesale.

The other members are Margot del Carmen, 60 years old, who for 20 years has sold tiste and pozol (traditional Nicaraguan drinks), bread, eggs, etc, and Eugenia del Carmen, 20 years old, who sells tiste, pozol, and homemade bread that she brings from Mandaime.

loans.use: to purchase corn, rice, oil, meat, etc.

loans.name: Anconeras Emprendedoras Group

texts.es: “Esther y su familia viven en Ancón Lima Perú, por ser una zona playera hay mucho movimiento ella tiene su restaurante cevicheria “MARRONI” le puso ese nombre en honor a uno D. sus hijos, su negocio lo tiene en su misma casa y es donD. trabaja junto a su esposo, lo que ofrecen en su restaurante son comidas  sobretodo mariscos por ser una zona costera hay mucho pescado fresco, su esposo antes era pescador al retirarse  contaban con poco dinero aun así iniciaron su negocio ahora han crecido mucho y  les va muy bien sobretodo en la época veraniega que hay mucha fluidez D. publico actualmente su esposo es el cocinero y ella se encarga D. la administración también tienen otros ingresos adicionales como el alquiler D. un bote y D. una bodega, para mas adelante quieren abrir otra sucursal D. su restaurante para seguir creciendo, Esther es la tesorera del grupo “ ANCONERAS EMPRENDEDORAS”  son 08 socias que lo conforman todas viven e la misma zona.
texts.en:
Esther and her family live in Ancón, Lima, Perú, a town situated on the coast. It’s a busy place, and Esther runs a ceviche restaurant there called Marroni. She named it after one of her children.

She and her husband run the restaurant out of their home. The restaurant serves mainly seafood as it is located on the coast where there is a lot of fresh fish.

Her husband used to be a fisherman, and when he retired they didn’t have enough money so they started this business. It has grown a lot since then and all is going well especially in the summer season when there are a lot of people about. 

Currently her husband is the cook and Esther is the manager. They also have other income from a boat they rent out and a small store. In the future they wish to open a second restaurant.

Esther is the treasurer of the Anconeras Emprendedoras group. There are eight members who get on well together and live in the same area.

loans.use: to buy cooking utensils and drinks for her restaurant

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Vicenta works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport. Vicenta is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase materials to repair a fishing boat for her fishing/fish vending business.

Vicenta has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving money and to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials to repair a fishing boat.

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama is 46 years old and married. She has seven children, three of which are in school.

Salama is in the agricultural business as a rice farmer in the Philippines. Salama requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. Salama has been farming rice for 10 years now, and she has borrowed ten times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Salama would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling herbal products in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of herbal products to sell. Arlene has been in this business for two years. Arlene earns more income from selling ready-to-wear clothing and fruit, including coconuts.

Arlene has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of herbal products

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan works hard to support her family. She is married and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines.

Susan has requested a PHP 20,000 loan, through NWTF, to purchase additional stocks of vegetables to sell. She has been in this business for 7 years now. In the future, Susan would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Yolanda has requested a PHP 19500 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell. She has been in this business for 7 years now. In the future, Yolanda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Redentor

texts.en:
Redentor, 39 years old, lives in the rural village of Ilagan. He is a simple and hardworking man and lives in his own house with his wife, Cielito. They have been married for 16 years. They have two wonderful children. 

Redentor has been engaged in growing rice for 10 years and puts into practice everything he learned from his parents. He plants twice a year. The first period is during the rainy season, when crops grow without having to be watered, and the second is in the watering season, when they grow with the help of irrigation.

What he enjoys most about his work is taking care of his produce, because he feels like he has done a good job each harvest time when he goes to the wholesale market in town. He also has a cow that he uses to plow the fields. He plows for his own farm and for others' also who pay him extra money, around 150 Philippine pesos (PHP) per day. He is now preparing to plant the rice, and he is hoping for a good harvest.

He belongs to one of the leading microfinance institutions in the Philippines, Alalay Sa Kaunlaran Inc. (ASKI), where he counts on the help of the lenders to assist him in his business. He is committed to paying back the loan on time. Redentor is requesting a loan of 17,000 PHP. The loan will be used to buy various sacks of organic fertilizer to begin planting his rice.

In the future, Redentor dreams of having a small store to earn extra income for his family, to be able to meet all their needs.

loans.use: to buy various sacks of organic fertilizer, such as manure

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Abraham is 34 years old and lives in San Antonio, Ilagan, Isabela. He is married, and his wife works as a domestic helper in another country. Abraham says that he wants to save money to help his wife to earn an income and come back to the Philippines to stay with him and their only child. That's why he works hard in his farm business. He plants and harvests rice and corn. 

Abraham is requesting a loan of 27,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy fertilizer and seeds, and to finance the other needs of his farm. He makes his purchases in the market and sells in the wholesale market in the same town.

The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs. His plan is to save money for the future of his child and also for his wife.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 42 years old and married. She has three grown-up children. She is so thankful to her husband, who is very supportive in their farm business. They help each other maintain their farm. Nora enjoys visiting the farm. She says that their farm is the only property that they have in their family, so they really want to take care of it.

She is requesting the loan to plant rice and corn. She wants to buy pesticides and fertilizers for the crops. Economic support from the loan will help her to improve production and meet her needs in everyday living. Her dream is to have a small store to continue moving forward with her goals in life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for her crops

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth is married and has only one child. To make a living, Maribeth owns and operates a business raising crops. The main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Maribeth has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

Maribeth joined ASKI in order to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maribeth is requesting a new loan of 23,000 PHP, which will be used to buy fertilizers, such as manure, and seeds to grow. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds to grow

loans.name: Mahabat's Group

texts.en:
Mahabat is the treasurer of this group. She is 36 and married to a constructor. She and her husband are raising two sons and a daughter, all of whom are in school. In order to earn additional money to meet the family's needs, Mahabat breeds livestock. She started this activity seven years ago with an initial investment of 3,000 Kyrgyzstani soms (KGS). Reselling livestock after fattening, Mahabat earns an additional 2,000 soms per month. With money received from the loan, Mahabat wants to purchase a calf for breeding. In the near future, she plans to enlarge a shed in order to keep more cattle there. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious, and socially focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line—People (building human capital and taking care of customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly), and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team—Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - Mol Bulak Finance—at: http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a calf

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia is 41 years old, married and has six children. Her eldest son left his education after 10th and started working in a factory. Her second son also works in a factory. Her third and youngest sons are able to continue their education. 

Her husband operates a plant-selling business. He is very fair in his prices and deals with his clients in a professional manner. He has good number of business contacts and meets their requirements. 

Razia is a housewife who stays at home and does her household responsibilities very well. Part time, she also sews clothes for her neighboring clients. She is very good at her work and receives a good number of orders every month.
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s plant selling business. With the loan, he will buy plants of different kinds that will allow him to make more sales and earn better profits. 

He has been doing this business for the past 10 years and Razia hopes that an investment will bring very good changes to his business and improve the life style of her family.

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Razia.

loans.use: To buy plants to sell

loans.name: Elnura's Group

texts.en:
Elnura, 26, is the treasurer of this group. She is married and has two children. Her husband makes a living by working at the high school. She is employed in the same school as a teacher. Elnura wants to improve her living conditions. She would like to spend a loan on a purchase of a washing machine. That would extremely simplify her household chores. Elnura’s dreams include building a big house and purchasing an automobile. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
	
 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
 MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a washing machine

loans.name: Zarina's Group

texts.en:
Zarina, 26, is the treasurer of this group. She is married to a construction worker and together they bring up a four-year-old son. The couple has been doing farming for six years now. They cultivate and sell agricultural products, the biggest part of which is barley. Receiving 3 000 soms monthly, the family has built a house with three rooms and have made more improvements. The purpose of the loan is to purchase mineral fertilizers (500 kg for 50 soms per kilogram). In the future, Zarina hopes to increase the number of livestock she owns in the household.
 
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
	
 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
 MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman with ten children, seven of whom attend school while threehave  graduated from school. She lives in a house that she owns with electricity but no piped water.

For the past four years, Mwanamisi has operated a fish selling business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of becoming a wholesale supplier of fish in the future.

With the Kshs 15,000 loan Mwanamisi wants to renovate her selling stall and purchase sacks of fish for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To renovate her selling stall and purchase sacks of fish for sale.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is  47 years old and married with 5 children between ages 13 and 29, two of whom are currently attending school. She has a mixed farm in Kitale town where she has been farming for 7 years. Her farm produces milk and eggs which are all sold locally. She mainly depends on the income from her farm to meet the basic needs of her family.

Grace has made a loan request of 30,000Kes in order to buy additional stock of chickens for her poultry farm. She believes that by expanding her poultry farm her sales volume will increase and this will earn her more income. Grace faces the challenge of diseases which affects her production. She plans to expand her poultry farm in the near future and also to construct a posho mill.

loans.use: To buy additional stock of chickens for her poultry farm.

loans.name: Ainura's Group

texts.en:
Ainura, 36, is the leader of this group. Ainura is a highly experienced cook in one of the small cafes in the  town of Tup. She and her husband have two high school age children who depend on their parents financially. Her husband works as a construction worker in order to attain improvements in the economic state of the family.  Ainura has faced difficulties at her work due to an increasing slump in average income of the town residents. This has lessened the  demand for services including restaurant service. Two years ago a considerable portion of family capital was invested in a new business start up. 7 000 soms were used for the purchase of a young calf for fattening and reselling. A monthly profit of 3 000 soms made it possible for her to make home improvements and construct a shed for livestock. Ainura has applied for a loan from Kiva with the purpose of purchasing three head of livestock for further fattening and reselling. In the future, Ainura hopes to help her children get  college education. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
	
 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
 MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Kuttubek's Group

texts.en:
Kuttubek, 34, is a member of this group. He is married and brings up three kids. Kuttubek makes a living by working as a coach in a local sports school, while his wife is also a teacher. Six years ago he bought two calves and sent them to grow in the highlands. The fattening and reselling of livestock brings 3 000 soms monthly, which has allowed the family to build a house. The purpose of this loan is for the purchase of more livestock for further fattening and reselling. In the future Kuttubek plans to build a shed to keep the livestock in better conditions. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
	
 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
 MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously).  If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Aijamal's Group

texts.en:
Aijamal, 47, is a leader of this group. She is divorced and resides in a town of Toktogul with three sons, who actively participate in taking care of livestock. Aijamal got interested in this sphere of business five years ago when she purchased her first heads of livestock with 10,000 soms of savings. Since then she has increased her income and now receives 5 000 soms per month. With this loan she plans on purchasing more cattle and letting them grow in the highlands. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
	
 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
 MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Meerimby's Group

texts.en:
Meerimby, 35, is the treasurer of this group. She is divorced and has two kids, the youngest of whom is only eight months old. Meerimby resides in the town of Uzgen. Her parents help her run a small business growing and selling agricultural products. The business was started 17 years ago when her family received land during privatization. At that time, she also had a cow and a calf, which helped to produce dairy products too. Their monthly income is 3 000 soms and their initial capital was only 500 soms. She applied for a loan in order to buy construction materials to build a small house for her and her children. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
	
 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
 MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase building materials

loans.name: Wella

texts.en:
Wella is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Wella has a shop selling canned goods, biscuits, detergents & noodles. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, detergents & beverages.

Wella has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Wella hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, detergents & beverages

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
This is Milagros, 45, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Ricardo, a tailor. She is the mother of three children, all of whom are still in school. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send her children all the way through college. Like most Filipino parents, Milagros believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children, as she herself has been an undergraduate. 

Milagros operates a dressmaking business. She mainly offers clothing like dresses, blouses, and shirts. She sells the clothes directly to her to neighbors and the local community, as well as to suppliers. She earns a minimum of PHP 330 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 29,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more raw materials like fabric, thread and newspapers for patterns. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Milagros dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy raw materials like fabric and thread

loans.name: Dalmacio

texts.en:
Dalmacio is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with one child. 

Dalmacio has a shop that sells detergents, breads & snacks. He has had this business for 25 years. He requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & detergents.

Dalmacio has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Dalmacio hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & detergents

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a farmer from Kitale town in western Kenya where he has been farming for 10 years now. His mixed farm is currently producing tomatoes, vegetables and maize, which are all sold locally. He earns additional income from his motorcycle transport business and a small video shop in the same town. He is 46 years old and married with three children who all attend school.

Moses has made a loan request of 40,000 KES in order to purchase chickens to enable him to practice poultry farming. He says that by diversifying his farming activities, he will be guaranteed a stable income and this will enable him to meet the basic needs of his family. His major challenges in this business have been diseases and the high cost of production, which affects his output. He is optimistic that his poultry farm will do well and that he will be one of the major suppliers of eggs in his town.

loans.use: To purchase chickens

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with eight children. 

Nenita has a retail shop that sells vegetables like cabbages & carrots. She has had this business for 17 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy sacks of vegetables to sell.

Nenita is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Nenita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Gamzagul

texts.ru: Гамзагул проживает в районе Хамадони. Она замужем. У неё пятеро детей. Она имеет среднее образование. Уже восемнадцать лет Гамзагул торгует на базаре овощами. Она берет кредит для покупки овощей.
texts.en: Gamzagul lives in the Hamadoni region. She is married and has five children. She has secondary education. Gamzagul has been selling vegetables on the market for eighteen years. She is taking out the loan to purchase vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables

loans.name: Julie Mae

texts.en:
Julie Mae is 20 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Julie Mae has a retail shop selling biscuits, canned goods & snacks. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, detergents & beverages.

Julie Mae is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Julie Mae hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, detergents & beverages

loans.name: Nilufar

texts.en:
Nilufar is a 44-year-old farmer who lives in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She has two children. In 1998, in order to support her family and cover all expenses, Nilufar decided to start her own land cultivating business. With a starting capital of 50,000 KGS, she managed to expand her business by engaging in cultivating cherries and crab cherries. With her business revenues, she was able to pay for education of her children. 

Nilufar plans to use this loan of 100,000 KGS to buy mineral fertilizers and package materials for harvest transportation. With the revenues from the loan, she plans further broadening of her business. 

About Bai-Tushum and Partners

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. It is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
This is Gilda, 53, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Edwin, an Operations Manager, and a mother.  At this time, she is working hard to provide continual income for their everyday expenses. 

Gilda maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fullerlife, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue are, and these are the profits that dealers are investing as their income. Aside from the direct selling business, Gilda also earns by selling frozen food products. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 1.550 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 11, 000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy orders for her customers and additional frozen food products. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Gilda dreams of being able to give her family a better life through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for merchandise ordered by her customers and to buy frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Kathy Leen

texts.en: Kathy Leen, a 33-year-old married mother of four children, lives in the Philippines where, for the past five years, she has operated a retail shop that sells snacks, beverages and canned goods. A new member of HSPFI, Kathy Leen has  requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy beverages and snacks. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy beverages and snacks.

loans.name: Jelma Luz

texts.en: Jelma Luz, a 26-year-old married mother of one child, lives in the Philippines where, for the past three years, she has operated a retail shop that sells biscuits, beverages and breads. A new member of HSPFI, Jelma Luz is  requesting a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods and beverages. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods and beverages.

loans.name: Glenn

texts.en:
Glenn is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with one child. 

Glenn is providing motorela or habal-habal services. He has had this business for two years. He requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy tools & pay for the utilities for the service.

Glenn is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Glenn hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for the utilities

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Jean has a retail shop that sells beverages, snacks & canned goods. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 12,000 to buy snacks & beverages to sell.

Jean is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Jean hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks & beverages to sell

loans.name: Roel

texts.en:
Roel is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with seven children. 

Roel has a shop that sells beverages, breads & canned goods. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan for PHP 9,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & breads.

Roel has been a member of HSPFI since 2005. In the future, Roel hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & breads

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 56 years old and has 1 child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy items like groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

Vilma has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 6 years and also earns an income from fishing. Vilma aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Josie has a shop that sells several kinds of dried fish. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 6,000 to buy additional dried fish to sell.

Josie has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Josie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional dried fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy chickens and poultry feed

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is 30 years old and married. She has 2 children. She earns a living with her poultry business in the Philippines. Leah is borrowing PHP 29,500, through NWTF, to buy feed and vitamins for her chickens.

Leah has been in the poultry business for 13 years and also earns additional income from a sari-sari store. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her chickens.

loans.name: Hayk

texts.en:
41-year-old Hayk lives in Ddmashen village, in the area of Sevan. He is married and has three children.  His wife stays at home and doesn’t work and his children attend school. Hayk graduated from an industrially-technological secondary school and by profession, he is a flour production technologist. After graduation, he worked at Ddmashen village Sovkhoz as supplies manager. After that, he worked at different construction companies. 

Since 2001, Hayk’s main line of business is farming. Thanks to his wife’s help, he breeds cows, sheep and chickens, and grows potatoes and garlic. Hayk sells his agricultural products at market or sells them to his neighbors.
  
Hayk has received a loan from Nor Horizon three times and he has never delayed his repayments. Now he is asking for a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy fodder for his farm animals and a motorized cultivator, which helps him to increase land cultivation efficiency.

loans.use: to buy fodder for his farm animals and a motorized cultivator

loans.name: Bintihamisi

texts.en: Bintihamisi is a married woman with eight children, six boys and two girls, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. For the past two years, she has operated a food stall business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She does farming as her other source of income and faces a major challenge of seasonality. Bintihamisi dreams of expanding her business to improve her living standards. With the Kshs 28,724 she wants to purchase goats for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase goats for sale.

loans.name: Firmin

texts.en: Firmin is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with six children. Firmin has had a shop that sells green bananas for 5 years. He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional green and yellow bananas. He has been a member of HSPFI since 2007. In the future, Firmin hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy additional green and yellow bananas

loans.name: Eriolita

texts.en:
Eriolita is 46 years old. She is married and has 5 children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Eriolita is borrowing PHP 28,000, through NWTF, to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Eriolita has been raising pigs for 3 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling coconuts. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Salam

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 37 years old, married and has one child.

Salam has had a food market since 2007, selling soft drinks, juices, cheese and dairy products. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His store is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. 
  
He is requesting a $2,000 loan to buy a generator and a refrigerator and to purchase additional foodstuffs. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a generator and refrigerator and to purchase additional foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Warsiti

texts.en: Warsiti is a soft drink agent. She began this business in 1998 and has had as many as 21 loan cycles with VFI. She started her business small and has become a big agent. As a result, she has been able to educate her children, buy a motorcycle, and even a house. Her current loan from VFI is being used to increase the stock of soft drinks, also for gas and equipping the inside of her shop. She has future plans to renovate her place of business. She is very happy with the VFI loan because of the easy access and loan processes.

loans.use: to pay for soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.en: Jacinto is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with three children. He provides motorcycle or habal-habal services. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy tools and utilities needed for the service. Jacinto has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and utilities needed for his transport service

loans.name: Bakari

texts.en: Bakari is a married man with five children; four children attend school while one is too young for school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family. For the past seven years, Bakari has operated a retail shop, selling to his neighbors and passersby. In addition he also operates a tailoring business and a bodaboda (motorcycle) businesses which add to his income. He faces a major challenge of seasonality during rainy season when transportation becomes difficult. He dreams of expanding his business to wholesale in the future. With the Kshs 80,000 Bakari wants to purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour, beans, cow peas, sugar and cooking oil for his store. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour, beans, cow peas, sugar and cooking oil for his store.

loans.name: Nicel

texts.en:
Nicel is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Nicel has a retail shop that sells breads, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

Nicel is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Nicel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks

loans.name: Abubakar

texts.en:
Abubakar is a married man with three children. One of his children attends and the other two are still too young for school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and electricity bills.

For the past five years, he has operated a spare parts shop and a phone batteries charging and mobile accessories business. He sells to his neighbors and passersby. Abubakar faces the major challenge of the high costs of transportation, especially during rainy seasons. His major dream is to expand his business to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KSHS 20,000 loan, he wants to purchase motorcycle spare parts for his shop. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle spare parts for his shop.

loans.name: Brigida

texts.en:
Brigida is 59 years old and married with five children. For five years Brigida has had a shop where she sells snacks, canned goods and noodles.

Brigida is a new member of HSPFI. She has requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. In the future, Brigida hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Shalva

texts.en:
Shalva is 35 years old and comes from the village of Geguti in the western part of Georgia. He lives with his wife, Sophia, and two-year-old daughter.

Shalva and Sophia have a greenhouse, where greens (between October and May) and tomatoes (between June and September) are grown. He has six years in the business. Shalva sells tomatoes in the local open market; the greens are sold to exporters who ship them to the Ukraine. Their average total income is 615 GEL.

Along with the abovementioned greenhouse the family also owns another greenhouse. With the requested loan of 1,500 GEL Shalva plans to purchase polyethylene materials to cover the structure and make the greenhouse ready for sowing. It will also be used for growing tomatoes and greens. A small part of the loan will be used to purchase fertilizer. By fertilizing the land in both greenhouses, he will get double the amount of greens and tomatoes.

Shalva plans to reinvest the increase in income in further development of his farm.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and polyethylene materials for his greenhouse.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas is 55 years old and married with five children. For the past six years Felicitas has had a shop where she sells rice by the kilogram.

Felicitas has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy sacks of rice to sell. In the future, Felicitas hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Ghazi

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 46 years old, married and has six children.

Ghazi has a store selling household items, gifts and artificial flowers. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs, a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $2,400 loan to rebuild the ceiling of his store and to make showcases. He is aiming to gain more profits to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To rebuild the ceiling of his store and to make showcases.

loans.name: Aigul's Group

texts.en:
Aigul, 53, is a member of this group of four. Her husband and their six children are from the small northern town of Tup. Both Aigul and her husband are farmers, and their younger children also get involved in seeding, watering and gathering their produce.

For Kyrgyz farmers there is much to gain from cultivating vegetables like potatoes, onions, carrots and cabbages, since these ingredients are much used in the local cuisine. Ten years ago with an initial investment of 3,000 KGS Aigul purchased potato seeds. Aigul has put a lot of effort into growing a rich harvest of the best sort of potatoes. However, expenses include not only the cost of seeds but also money for fuel, lubricants, equipment rental and fertilizers.

With her share of the loan Aigul plans to purchase pest killers and 300 liters of fuel to use on developing her fields. In the fall after gathering and selling her crops, Aigul plans to buy a refrigerator.

loans.use: to purchase pest killers and 300 liters of fuel.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice is thirty years old and is married with three children. For the past five years she has had a food shop that sells delicacies such as afritada and caldereta.

Janice is a new member of HSPFI. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy the ingredients needed for cooking her dishes.

In the future, Janice hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy the ingredients needed for cooking her dishes.

loans.name: Janylkan's Group

texts.en:
Janylkan, 48, is the treasurer of this group. She is a very hardworking woman. Together with her husband, she started cattle breeding. However, due to high investment needs, she switched to farming. It was 2002 when she, with her own funds of 4,000 soms, bought her first potato seeds and fertilizers. Soon she had generated enough revenue to organize the wedding ceremonies for her son according to Kyrgyz traditions. Janylkan’s purpose for this loan is to purchase fertilizers for proper care of her potatoes. Janylkan is grateful to Mol Bulak Finance for providing access to Kiva funds. She realizes how getting financial assistance in hard times is helpful for the continuation of business. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
	
 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
 MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.en:
Cornelia is 57 years old. She is married and has five children. With one child in school, Cornelia works very hard to provide for her family.

Cornelia runs a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines. She requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell. Cornelia has been in this business for 30 years.

In the future Cornelia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Azhar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 20 years old, single and lives with two family members. One of the family members works.

Azhar has had a barber shop since 2006. He has more than five years experience. He has a deep understanding of the local consumer and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $3,000 loan to buy new furniture and to make a light box. He is aiming to gain more profits to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy new furniture and to make a light box.

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.en:
Virgilio is 63 years old and married with three children. He is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Virgilio has a seaweed farming business in the Philippines. Virgilio requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy seedlings for seaweed.

Virgilio has been in this business for six years. Virgilio would like to build and expand his business to secure the future of his family.

loans.use: to buy seedlings for growing seaweed.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Teresita sells viands like fried fish, afritada & pancit bihon. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients to cook dishes to sell.

Teresita has been a member of HSPFI since 2005. In the future, Teresita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for cooking dishes to sell

loans.name: Wanyange Tusubiira Women's Group

texts.en:
Business adversity invariably borrows its sharpest sting from most people's impatience. Impatience can spell doom for most businesses, especially if it's manifested from the threshold. This means it may most likely be somebody's second nature. That impatience, in most cases, stems from the desire to make profits hastily in a short spell of time. 

Harriet, a 46-year-old affable and high-spirited mother of five has always tried to steer clear of that bug that most people catch to make quick profits. From her perspective, patience in a desire to notch up something may be bitter, but the fruits will always be sweet. That, in essence, means she willingly and slowly takes all the bad and good experiences in stride and she knows that her fortitude in the face of all this, is the key to not only short term but also long term success.

Painstaking and unwavering diligence and tenaciousness have been her precepts in the course of the last two decades as she goes about her business trivial round-to with charcoal sales in Jinja.

Harriet is a happy go lucky lady who set forth in her business with savings from her erstwhile farming business. Prior to that, Harriet was at wits end, mostly doing house chores, as she had no job. Monthly, this business generates 120,000 Ugandan shillings. This Kiva loan, Harriet says, is to help her purchase more bags of charcoal to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of charcoal to resell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita works hard to support her family. Teresita is married and has a sari-sari (variety) store business in the Philippines.

Teresita requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like bread, sugar, soap and other miscellaneous goods to sell in her store. She has been in this business for 16 years.

Teresita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items like bread, sugar, soap and other miscellaneous goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 38 years old, married and has five children. 

Mohamad has had a car workshop since 2003. He has a lot of experience in this field. He has a deep understanding of the local consumer and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $3,000 loan to buy a nozzle-cleaning machine and to make a sliding door and outdoor ceiling for his shop. He is optimistic about his business development and hopes that the coming years will continue to bring him positive growth.

loans.use: To buy a nozzle-cleaning machine and to make a sliding door and outdoor ceiling for his shop.

loans.name: Begimai's Group

texts.en:
Begimai, 25, is a leader of this group of three. She is divorced and has a five-year-old daughter. They reside in the small southern town of Uzgen.

After her divorce Begimai was in despair with thoughts of providing her daughter with everything she needed. Her father’s advice and support helped her to gather herself and start her business of selling vegetables at wholesale. For almost a year Begimai has been involved in transporting them from Uzgen to the nearby town of Kara Kulja.

With a monthly income of 2,000 KGS she has managed to purchase a small piece of land and an automobile. Her 54,000 KGS loan will be used to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell.

One of Begimai’s long-term goals and wishes is to construct a house on her land.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab comes from the village of Kukhi in western Georgia. She is 63 years old, married and has a son, Michael, who is 27 years old. He is married and has a one-year-old daughter.

Zeinab already has two cows, the milk from which produces approximately forty kilograms of cheese a month. It is sold at the local market.

Zeinab is requesting a loan to purchase another milk cow. She will be able to produce and sell 50% more cheese a month when she has three cows.

Zeinab hopes that the increased income will be enough to purchase some new household items to make their home more comfortable.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Zaman

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 30 years old, single and lives with five family members. Three of the family members work.

Zaman has had a barber shop since 2007. He has more than eight years experience and has a deep understanding of the local consumer. He is well known in his area.

He is requesting an $1,800 loan to renovate the outside of his shop and to buy a generator. He is optimistic about his business development and hopes that the coming years will continue to bring him positive growth.

loans.use: To renovate the outside of his shop and to buy a generator.

loans.name: Kairy's Group

texts.en:
Kairy, 49, is the leader of this group of three. She is married and together with four children lives in the small southern town of Nookat.

Kairy has been farming for twenty years. She grows mainly potatoes and wheat. She started her farm with the cultivation of 300 square meters of land. Currently the area of the land is bigger, and accordingly, the size of her crops is greater. Despite their studies, her children do their best to provide assistance in the fields. Her monthly income is approximately 4,000 KGS.

The purpose of Kairy’s 45,000 KGS loan is to buy building materials so as to finish construction on a new house. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to buy building materials so as to finish construction on a new house.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 42 years old and is married with three children. For the past five years Gemma has grown and sold gemilina trees (or gmilina; like mahogany).

Gemma has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy fertilizer for the young gemilina trees.

In the future, Gemma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the young gemilina trees.

loans.name: Gulnura

texts.en:
Gulnura is 39, single and has two children. She graduated from trade school and has worked as an accountant.

As she is the only bread-winner for her children, in 2007 she started her business selling mobile phones and accessories. Her business became successful, and she expanded it to include mobile phone repairs and photocopying.

Gulnura is requesting a loan of 100,000 KGS, which she will use to broaden her assortment of goods in order to expand her business. It will allow her to save money to purchase a flat for her family.

loans.use: to broaden her assortment of goods.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 55 years old, married and has three children.

H. has had an office for audio engineering since 2004, selling audio equipment. He has good experience in this field and a good reputation. He is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $3,000 loan to enlarge his office, to make an advertising light box and to buy a generator. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To enlarge his office, to make an advertising light box and to buy a generator.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 38 years old and married with three children. For the past five years she has had a shop where she sells detergent, snacks and canned goods.

Lydia has been a member of HSPFI since 2007. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy more canned goods, detergents and beverages to sell from her shop.

In the future, Lydia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more canned goods, detergents and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en:
Sanaa is a 45 years-old married woman and a mother to five children.  She works selling clothes which helps her husband in covering their expenses, through the extra income she provides through her business.

Sanaa is a hardworking woman, who seeks perfection from her family and business at the same time.

Sanaa is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua, and this is her 10th cycle as an A. Majmoua-Kiva partner borrower, with a good standing history, in order to start a new business selling "abaya". Abayas are the loose, usually black, robes worn by Muslim women, especially in Arabic-speaking regions, covering the body from head to toe.  The abayas are in high demand during Lebanon's summer season since most of the tourists are Arabs enjoying its beauty.

Sanaa also works sewing curtains.  She really skilled in this domain and hopes to improve it in the coming days.

loans.use: to start a new business selling abayas.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is 42 years-old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children.

Concepcion has a pigpen where she raises to sell. She has had this business for nine years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy animal feed for the pigs.

Concepcion has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Concepcion hopes to improve her business.
