loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is a dairy farmer from Nkubu town in eastern Kenya. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last 10 years and employs two farmhands. Her farm produces milk, beans, carrots, maize, potatoes and cabbages which are all sold locally. She mainly depends on the income from her farm to cater for the basic needs of her family. She is 47 years-old and married with four children, three of whom are attending school.

Charity has requested a loan of 47,250Kes in order to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The proceeds from the sale of milk will enable her to pay school fees for her children and improve her family's livelihood. She faces the challenges of diseases and unpredictable weather which affects her production. She plans to acquire two dairy cows and expand her horticultural farm in the next five years.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 37 years old, married and has four children. One of the children works.

Ali has owned a generator since 2008.  He distributes power lines for houses. He has more than three years experience and has a good reputation. He is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $3,000 loan to build a soundproof room for the generator. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To build a soundproof room for his generator.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a piece of land for farming.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is 38 years-old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Geraldine has a shop that sells frozen foods such as seasoned chickens and hotdogs. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 in order to buy additional stocks of frozen foods such as seasoned chickens.

Geraldine has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Geraldine hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 29 years old, married and has one child.

Haydar is a blacksmith. He has had a metal workshop since 2004. He has more than 10 years experience in this field and has a good reputation. He is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $1,500 loan to buy a balancing machine for cars. He is aiming to gain more profits to improve his family’s quality life.

loans.use: To buy a balancing machine for cars.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Myrna has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and noodles. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy beverages, canned goods and snacks.

Myrna has been a member of HSPFI since 2007. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy beverages, canned goods and snacks for resale.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 19 years old, single and lives with seven family members,  three of whom work.


Hussein has had a food market since 2008, selling soft drinks, juices, cheese and dairy products. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. 


He is requesting a $2400 loan to buy showcases,  a generator and a refrigerator for his market. He is aiming to earn more profit so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy showcases, a generator and a refrigerator for his market.

loans.name: Rana

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 34-year-old divorced woman from Lebanon. She is living with her parents and two siblings. She has been running a clothing store since 2006. She sells women and children's clothes. She has a good number of clients passing by her shop because she always presents the newest collection. Her business income is vital for her family. She is supportive of her parents. Today, she is requesting to borrow $2000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to expand her store’s inventory with the new summer collection. In the future, she is hoping to add woman shoes to sell from her store.

loans.use: to expand her store’s inventory

loans.name: Nirvat

texts.en:
Nirvat is a 49-year-old married woman and mother of one child. She works as a sports trainer and has owned a gym for 20 years. She works hard to encourage people to take care of their health through sports. 

Nirvat is a hard working woman who seeks the best for her customers, family and business. That's why she's requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the first time, in order to do necessary maintenance to her exercise machines to keep customers satisfied and to encourage them to come every day to stay in good health.

Nirvat loves sports a lot and that's why she started this business, because she was sure that she would succeed in what she loves.

loans.use: to do necessary maintenance to her exercise machines

loans.name: Gia

texts.en:
Gia comes from the village of Charnali in the Adjara Region. He is 39 years old and lives with his big family: wife Medea, 9 year-old-son, two daughters (7 and 4 years old), his 32-year-old brother and his parents (retired). 

Gia works in a local glass workshop, which produces different household goods made from glass. Along with his main job, he is actively involved in his family's agricultural business. Gia’s family is engaged in a variety of agricultural activities: They have 6,000 square meters of citrus gardens. Harvested citruses are sold to local retailers. Also, the family has two milking cows, which give approximately 40 kg of cheese per month. The cheese is sold to local dairy products retailers. Along with the above-mentioned businesses, Gia runs beekeeping business. He has 70 beehives with bee colonies. Honey is sold on local market. Total average income of the family is 1,500 Laris per month.

Gia requested credit for expansion of the beekeeping business. He plans to purchase an additional 5-6 beehives and bee colonies. It will increase the amount of honey, and thus increase of family’s total income. 

With the increased income, Gia’s family will purchase new household goods to improve the living conditions for the children, as well as for the whole family.

loans.use: to purchase additional beehives and bee colonies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cultivate his banana farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, confectioneries, and basic household necessities for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a larger variety of different goods to stock her store.

loans.name: Blue Arrow Group

texts.en:
Joushua, 27, earns his keep from a restaurant business in the ever busy and melting pot metropolis of Jinja. Five years is the amount of time he has been diligently bearing a hand in this business venture that he began with savings from his previous teaching job. Joushua is happily married with two children who are all in school and doing well. 

A restaurant business cannot go wrong if one has a steady working capital base. This means that individuals operating that business will be in a position to restock the business every time the restaurant runs short on food.

With the current status quo where food prices are rising day in, day out, a person involved in this enterprise may fail to sustain it without a robust capital base. Joushua says this is not likely to happen in his business as he has quite a sufficient working capital. Not so big, he says, but at least strong enough to ensure he remains in business. It's just that he has other business operational expenses, which at times constrain his capital base and make it hard for him to make enough food purchases.
 
This business generates 18,000 Ugandan shillings weekly in sales revenue. This is quite paltry given the fact that food prices are up and most restaurant owners are increasing their food prices. Though his weekly sales revenue is minimal, he is not one to get disconsolate. He reckons he will be able to make sales income once he can get this loan to improve operations at his business. This Kiva loan, he says, is to aid him in the purchase of more food for his restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase more food for his restaurant.

loans.name: Abed El Hussein

texts.en:
Abed El Hussein is 32 years old, married, and the father of two precious children: Hassan, a 3 year-old boy, and Mona, a 9-month-old girl. They are his whole life and he works hard to provide them with the healthiest living they might need.

Abed El Hussein has sold plastics, tissue paper and cleaning detergents since 2007. His work is improving since he puts a lot of effort on it to reach perfection. 

Abed El Hussein is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, Kiva partner, for the fifth time, in order to increase his plastics capital. His previous loans made a positive impact on his social and financial life. He plans to expand his sales region by buying a new van and traveling among neighboring villages.
He hopes to keep up with his customers' desires and needs.

loans.use: to increase his plastics sales capital.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 43 years old, married and has one child.

Ali has had a food market since 2009 selling soft drinks, juices, cheese and dairy products, etc. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. 

He is requesting a $2400 loan to buy a generator, a split air conditioner and to make a sliding door. He is aiming to earn more profit so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a generator, a split air conditioner and to make a sliding door.

loans.name: Rima

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 39-year-old single woman living with her parents and three siblings. She is from Lebanon. She started her business selling lingerie from her home. Today, she is the owner of a lingerie shop. She also sells women's clothes, accessories and beauty products. She has been working hard in her store since 1990. She cooperates financially with her parents to be able to afford the high costs of living. With her requested loan of $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l., she will increase her store’s inventory. She hopes that the diverse selection of lingerie and accessories will allow her to expand her business even further. She expects that her sales and income will remarkably increase in the coming years.

loans.use: to increase her store’s inventory

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a married woman with one child who is still too young for school. She lives at a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, rent bills and clothing.

For the past two years, she has operated a cosmetic vending business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other cosmetic sellers in her area of operation. She dreams of establishing another branch in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of cosmetics and pay for transportation. She decided to join Yehu to access loans in order to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of cosmetics and pay for transportation.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 32 years old, married and lives with ten family members; six of them work.


Mohammad has owned a shop since 2005 selling funeral supplies and Islamic beads. He has more than five years' experience and has a good reputation and he is well known in his area.


He is requesting $3000 to make a sliding door, an outside ceiling and an advertising light box. He is aiming to earn more profit to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to make a sliding door, and an outside ceiling and an advertising light box.

loans.name: Dandé Légnol Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité dandé légnol a été créé le 29/06/2009.Il est composé de 19 femmes qui sont issues de la même localité.

Madame Sémou en position debout et à l'extreme droite est responsable du groupement,elle est âgée de 41 ans,elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants,en plus elle assure la garde de 04 autres enfants dont elle a la charge.

Sa principale activité est la restauration,activité qu'elle fait depuis longtemps.

Son prêt lui permettra d'acheter les condiments nécessaires pour la bonne marche de son restaurant.

Son  objectif est d'assurer la scolarité de ses enfants,augmenter la taille de son restaurant et renforcer sa capacité d'épargne.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Dandé Légnol was created on June 29, 2009. It is composed of 19 women who are all from the same town. Ms. Sémou (standing at the far right in the photo) is the group’s official. She is 41 years old, married, and the mother of four children. Plus, she is the guardian of four other children to support. 

Ms. Sémou’s main business is a restaurant, which is something she has done for long time. Her loan will enable her to buy the condiments necessary for operating her restaurant in the right way. 

Her goal is to ensure her children are educated, to increase the size of her restaurant, and to boost her ability to save money.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, and potatoes for her restaurant

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
Em is 36 year old, married, and has two children. She supports her family through the income she earns from making clothes. Her husband is a driver. They live in Ho Chi Minh City. 

She intends to take a loan to buy fabric and materials to make a greater range of clothing to better meet her customers' needs. She hope her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions and send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fabric and materials to make clothing.

loans.name: Benkady Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Benkady a été créé le 29/06/2009.Il est composé de 15 femmes qui sont issues de la même localité.

Madame Ramata en position assise à l'extreme droite sur la photo est responsable du groupement,elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants.

Sa principale activité est la vente de poissons fumés,de la banane et les mangues.

Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience de cette activité dufait qu'elle la pratique depuis longtemps.

Son prêt lui permettra de s'approvisionner en quantité suffisante de poissons fumés et de jus de fruits(bananes et mangues).

Son objectif est la construction de sa maison,l'achat d'un réfrigérateur et la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Benkady solidarity group was created 6/29/2009. It is composed of fifteen women originating from the same town.

Mrs. Ramata, who is sitting all the way to the right in the picture, is the group's leader. She is married and a mother of six. Her main business is the sale of smoked fish, bananas and mangoes. She is quite experienced in this business because she has been active in it for a long time.

Her loan will make it possible for her to procure sufficient quantities of smoked fish and fruit juice (bananas and mangoes). Her objectives are building her house, buying a refrigerator and sending her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase smoked fish, bananas and mangoes.

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 24 years old, married and lives with eight family members. Four of the family members work.

Haydar opened a bakery in 2010, making all kinds of bread and pastries. He has good experience and a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $2,400 loan to buy a generator and to make a ceiling and a sliding door. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a generator and to make a ceiling and sliding door.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 63 years old and married. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Teresita has two children, one of which is in school.

Teresita has a used clothing business in the Philippines. Teresita requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more used clothes to sell. Teresita has been in this business for four years. Teresita would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell in her fish vending business. Rosita has been in this business for four years. Rosita earns more income from raising pigs.

Rosita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 44-year-old single mother of 2 children, aged 17 and 23. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last 20 years in her hometown in eastern Kenya. Her farm currently produces milk, potatoes and cabbages, which she sells to the local market. She depends solely on the income from her farm to provide for her family's basic needs.

Jane has requested a loan of 36,400 KES in order to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says that this loan will enable her to acquire a quality cow that will produce enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. The extra income from the sale of milk will be used to pay her child's school fees. Jane's biggest challenges have been insufficient water for irrigation and poor weather conditions. She plans to buy 4 quality dairy cows and expand her farming project from half an acre to one acre in the next 5 years.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase printing colors and bundles of materials to print t-shirts.

loans.name: Anabel

texts.en:
Anabel works hard to support her family. Anabel is married, and she has a fruit and vegetable vending business in the Philippines.

Anabel requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of fruits and vegetables to sell. Anabel has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Anabel would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Andresita

texts.en:
Andresita is 52 years old and married with three children.

Andresita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling marine products in the Philippines. She requested a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more sea cucumbers and shark fins to sell.

Andresita has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her business for 12 years and also earns income from food vending.

Andresita aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more marine products to sell.

loans.name: Hicham

texts.en:
Hicham is a 38-year-old married man and the father of five children. He has been working in vehicle repairs for 20 years. He started his own business in 2010 to take a step forward in improving his family's social and financial situation, and he had all the support he needed to improve and prove himself positively.

Hicham is a man with a good standing credit history. He has partnered with Al Majmoua-Kiva for five consecutive cycles, which helped a lot in making necessary improvements to his business. Hicham hopes to stay capable of working at repairing and painting vehicles, in addition to taking good care of his family.

loans.use: To buy necessary paints and equipment

loans.name: Armelyn

texts.en:
Armelyn is 42 years old and has six children. Armelyn is married and has three children who are in school.

Armelyn is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Armelyn requested a 12,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Armelyn has been farming rice for four years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Armelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase sacks of mangoes for sale.

loans.name: Crispina

texts.en:
Crispina is married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Crispina is 49 years old and has two children who are in school.

Crispina has a food vending business in the Philippines. Crispina requested a 13,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her business.

Crispina has been in this business for 14 years. In the future, Crispina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius has been practicing banana farming for the last 14 years in his hometown of Nkubu in eastern Kenya. His farm currently produces bananas, which Julius sells to middlemen. He depends mainly on the income from his farm to provide for his family's basic needs. Julius is 52 years old and married, with 4 children aged between 13 and 29. 

Julius has made a loan request of 50,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo in order to cultivate his banana farm. The extra income from this loan will enable him to pay his child's school fees and improve his family's livelihood. Julius faces the challenges of diseases and insufficient agricultural land, which has made it difficult for him to expand his farming activities. He plans to expand his business in the future by acquiring more agricultural land.

loans.use: To cultivate his banana farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make repairs on his taxi, including improving the car’s body, changing the tires and repairing the engine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a blow dryer, hair weaves and hair chemicals.

loans.name: Hiep

texts.en:
Hiep, a 40-year-old married woman, lives in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband buys and sells goods in the local market. Hiep earns income to support her family by sewing clothes and selling fabric to people in the local community.

Hiep requires a loan to purchase better quality fabric and clothing materials that will enable her to make better clothes and provide a better quality service for her customers. She hopes that better materials will permit her to make more beautiful clothing and to attract more customers.

loans.use: to purchase better quality fabric and clothing materials

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, Rukia has owned real estate housing. She faces a major challenge of rent defaulters in her houses. Rukia dreams of establishing more real estate houses in the future.

Rukia plans to use this KES 20,000 loan to purchase cement and timber and to pay labor to expand her real estate houses. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cement and timber and to pay labor to expand her real estate houses

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Selina has been farming in Litien in the Rift Valley of Kenya for 15 years. Her farm produces tea, maize, vegetables and milk, which are all sold locally. She also owns and manages a beauty salon (pictured in the photo). Selina is 41 years old and a widowed mother of 3 children who all attend school.

Selina has made a loan request of 90,000 KES in order to purchase a dairy cow. With this loan, she says that she will be able to acquire a quality cow that will produce enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. The proceeds from this loan will help Selina pay her children's school fees.

Selina faces the challenge of diseases which affect her production. In 5 years' time, she wants to have increased the number of her dairy cows to 4 and to have purchased a van for transporting her farm produce to the market.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Umoja Virunga Group

texts.fr: La cliente Chiza, leader du groupe d’affaire « Umoja Virunga »,  est entrepreneur, âgée de 49 ans, mariée, mère de 6 enfants qui étudient tous et d’autres ont leurs propres foyers. Elle est  vendeuse de friperie. Son mari est un ingénieur constructeur. Elle installe ses marchandises au marché central Virunga. Il y a 15 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces activités. Elle commença son business avec ses fonds propres reçus de son mari. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner  avec  2 ballons de friperies.  En plus, elle ambitionne scolariser ses enfants et le nourrir confortablement.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe d’affaire « Umoja Virunga» est majoritairement féminins.
texts.en: Chiza, who is the leader of the « Umoja Virunga » business group, is a 49 year old businesswoman .She is married with 6 children who are all students and some of whom have their own lodgings. She is a second hand clothes saleswoman. Her husband is a construction engineer. She sets up her wares at the central market in Virunga. She has been practising this profession for 15 years. She started her business with her own funds that she received from her husband. This new loan will enable her to stock up on 2 packages of second hand clothes. In addition she intends to send her children to school and feed them comfortably. This client thanks Hekima for their activities in favour of poor women who are excluded from classic banks. It should be noted that the « Umoja Virunga» group is predominantly feminine.

loans.use: purchase 2 packages of second hand clothes.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Usha

texts.en:
Usha is a married woman with four school-going children. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, Usha has operated a green grocery business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high transportation costs in her business. Usha dreams of establishing a wholesale grocery business in the future. 

Usha plans to use this KES 20,000 loan to purchase four crates of tomatoes and four crates of onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase tomatoes and onions.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Sokha, 29 years old, is a cake seller. Her husband is an ice-cream seller and their combined income is $6 per day. They have two children, 1 and 4 years old. Every month, Sokha spends $25 on food, $10 on electricity, $10 on transportation and $10 on other expenses.

Sokha would like to request a loan of $700 to buy a motorbike to sell her cakes. Sokha plans to repair her house when she can save enough money. She wants to send her children to study at university when they finish high school.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to sell her cakes

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 21-year-old single man who has worked in construction for 5 years. He started his business at a young age to help his family cover their expenses. Hassan is specialized in installing tiles and he's talented enough to advise customers with the best quality of products.

Hassan is a hard worker. He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, for the third time, in order to buy a special lift necessary for his business. The lift will move tiles from one floor to another, which will help Hassan complete his work in a shorter period of time. Hassan is a good standing borrower. He hopes to have a small family of his own and provide his children with the best education ever since he didn't get the chance to finish his.

loans.use: To buy a special lift to move tiles

loans.name: Akeel

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 31 years old, married and has two children.

Akeel has owned a coffee shop since 2009 where he prepares fast food and all kind of juices and hot drinks. He has good experience and a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting $1,800 to renovate his shop and to tile the interior walls in ceramic. He is aiming to gain more profits to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To renovate his shop and tile the interior walls

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 40 years old. She is hard working and social. She is married and blessed with six children, three of whom are in school.

Elizabeth has been making her living by operating a retail shop for the last ten years. She also earns extra income from rental houses and from selling chips. Elizabeth wants to grow her business to wholesale in the next five years. Her dream is to expand her business and get a wider market. Elizabeth is requesting a loan of 50,000 KES to buy a chip warmer.

loans.use: To buy a chip warmer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new tools and supplies

loans.name: Reth

texts.en: Reth, 47 years old, sells food. Her husband is a fisherman and their combined income is $6 per day. They have one son at home; he is a construction worker. Every month, Reth spends $20 on food, $10 on electricity, $10 on rent, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy equipment for washing motorbikes in order to earn more income as compared to fishing. Reth plans to repair her house when she can make a good profit.

loans.use: To buy equipment for washing motorbikes

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Couturière de profession, AKossiwa est mariée à un couturier et mère de 02 enfants. Elle a une passion rendre belle toute personne. Depuis 2003 elle a ouvert son atelier. Ce prêt qu’elle sollicite lui servira d’acheter des machines à coudre et des tissus pour satisfaire sa clientèle. Elle a une ambition : devenir une couturière de renom.
texts.en: A seamstress by trade, Akossiwa is married to a tailor and the mother of two. She is passionate about helping people look their best. She opened her shop in 2003. This loan will allow her to buy sewing machines and fabrics in order to meet client demand. Her goal is to become a renowned seamstress.

loans.use: to buy sewing machines and fabrics

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 27 years old and married has one child. He lives with four family members. One of the family members works.

Ali is a spice dealer. In 2005, he opened his store where he sells herbs, spices and perfumes. He has experience and a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting an $1,800 loan to rebuild and renovate his store. He is aiming to gain more profits to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To rebuild and renovate his store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy souvenir items and materials for painting

loans.name: Kamau

texts.en:
Kamau has practised farming in Njabini for the last six years. He is 60 years old, married to Lilian and they have three children.  

Kamau was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his second loan. He repaid his previous loan of KES 10,000 well and in good time. Kamau plans to use this loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. In the future, Kamau hopes to become a leading farmer in the Njabini area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for planting

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph has practiced farming in Njabini for the last six years. He is 41 years old, married to Mary and they have two school-going children.  

Joseph was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his third loan. He repaid all his previous loans well and in good time.  Joseph plans to use this loan to pay his children's school fees. In the future, Joseph hopes to become a leading farmer in the Njabini area.

loans.use: to pay his children's school fees

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr: Komi est mariée à une tresseuse et est père de quatre(04)  enfants. Lui même est âgé de  37 ans et est revendeur de chaussures à Adidogomé. Komi à commencé son activité depuis 1986  et s’approvisionne à Lomé sur marché de chaussures  de la place(Hédzranawoé).Komi est à son quatrième cycle de crédit  et est de bonne moralité. Afin d’assurer son rôle de chef de famille  Komi se bat  au quotidien pour apporter  l’assurance financière aux siens.
texts.en:
Komi is married to a hair braider and is a father of four. He himself is 37 years old and retails shoes in Adidogomé. Komi launched his business in 1986 and gets his supplies from Lomé, at the public shoe market of Hédzranawoé.
Komi is on his fourth loan cycle and is of good character. In order to perform his role as the head of the household, Komi strives daily to bring financial safety to his family.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas is 30 years old and married, with two children. She has been operating a salon business for two years. She also sells mobile phone accessories and provides catering to generate more income. Dorcas is a hardworking woman who hopes to grow her business and become a successful businesswoman. She has requested a loan of 40,000 KES to buy hair conditioner and a blow dryer.

loans.use: To buy hair conditioner and a blow dryer

loans.name: Ibtissam

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 42 years old, married and has four children.

Ibtissam has been a tailor since 2000. She makes and repairs women’s clothing. She has a deep understanding of the local consumer. She has good experience and she well known in her area.

She is requesting a $1,000 loan to buy a new tailoring machine and to add more inventories (tissues, buttons, etc.). She is aiming to gain more profits so she can improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a new tailoring machine and more inventory

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther has been practicing mixed farming for the last 12 years in her hometown in the Rift Valley of Kenya. Her farm produces tea, maize and  milk, which she sells to the local market. She employs one farmhand. 

Esther intends to use this loan of KES 70,000 to buy a quality dairy cow which will produce enough milk for her domestic consumption and sale. She says that the proceeds from this loan will help her pay her children's school fees. Esther's major challenge has been insufficient dairy feed which affects her milk production. In the future, she would like to improve her dairy cows to pure breeds and build a zero grazing unit.

Esther is 51 years old and married, with 3 children who all attend school.

loans.use: To buy a  dairy cow.

loans.name: Tith

texts.en: Tith is a construction worker. His wife works in the factory and their combined income is $5. Tith has 6 children; three are studying and one is working. Every month, Tith spends $20 on food, $10 on electricity, $10 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses. He would like to request a loan of $500 to buy fertilizer and seed in order to farm in the rainy season. He hopes to earn more income by farming in the rainy season.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seed

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Célibataire et sans enfant, Adjo a 36 ans et est coiffeuse de profession. Parallèlement à son  activité principale, Adjo vent du jus et de l’eau en sachet et du glaçon. elle a débuté cette activité  en 2008 et nous sollicite  à nouveau pour un crédit  pour mieux asseoir son commerce en s’approvisionnant en sucres, en aromes ,puis en pure water. Adjo est une jeune femme active et  de bonne moralité.
texts.en:
Single with no child, Adjo is 36 years old and a hairdresser by trade. In addition to her main activity, she retails juice, water in pouches and ice. She started this business in 2008, and is requesting a new loan to better establish her business by stocking up on sweeteners, flavorings and pure water.
Adjo is an active young woman of good character.

loans.use: to buy pouches of pure water, bags of sugar and flavorings.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase her inventory of goods

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Fares

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 22-year-old Lebanese single man. He is an orphan living with his brothers.  Fares is a freelance IT specialist. He repairs PCs and electronic equipment, a hobby he picked up at an early age. He has lots of customers asking for his services due to his unique skills in his neighborhood and his fair prices. In parallel, he works in a local restaurant in order to get extra money and improve his standard of living. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a printer, which will facilitate his operation and keep it confidential since he will be using it mainly to print his quotations, bills, receipts etc. In the future, he is planning to open his own shop.

loans.use: to purchase a printer

loans.name: Sokong

texts.en: Sokong is a factory worker. Her husband is a construction worker and their combined income is $6 per day. Sokong has a 2-year-old child. Every month, Sokong spends $20 on food, $10 on electricity, $10 on rent and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $700 to buy fertilizer and seeds for farming in the rainy season in order to earn more income from doing this work. She wants to send her child to study at the university in the future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en:
Vanna is an animal seller. Her husband is a farmer and their combined income is $6 per day. Vanna has 5 children; one is studying and three work in the factory. Every month Vanna spends around $50 on all the family's expenses.

Vanna would like to request a loan of $800 to buy pigs to feed and sell. All of the family's expenses depend on her job so she needs to work hard to feed more pigs to sell to support her family. Vanna wants to repair her house and send her children to study at the university.

loans.use: To buy pigs to feed and sell

loans.name: San

texts.en: San is a garment factory worker. Her husband is a Tok Tok taxi driver and their income is $5 per day. They have three children and all of them are studying. Every month, she has to spend $25 on food, $10 on school fees, $15 on house rental fees, and $20 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $300 to buy a new motorbike for her husband's career as a Tok Tok driver because the current motorbike is old. In the future, she plans to buy grocery goods to sell at the house instead of working in the factory so that she can stay home and take care of her children.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok, 56 year old, is a cake seller. Her husband is a vegetable planter. Their income is $10 per day. She has two children. One of the children is studying and one is working in the factory with an income of $3 per day. Every month, she has to spend $25 on food, $5 on school fees, $5 on transportation and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $800 to buy wood to repair her house because her house right now is in bad condition. The roof is leaking and the columns and walls are rotten. Her business is running well, so she wants to extend it when she finishes repairing her house.

loans.use: To buy wood to repair her house

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 35 years old, married and has two children.

Alaa owns a shop selling car tires. He sells and repairs tires and large machinery.  He has good experience in his field and a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $2,400 loan to pay the annual rent for his shop and to add more inventories (tires, accessories). He is aiming to gain more profit so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To pay the annual rent for his shop and to buy more inventory

loans.name: Mher

texts.en:
Mher was born in 1956 in Getahovit village, Tavush marz. He was educated at Yerevan State University’s mining and smelting department. After University, since 1983, he worked at Ijevan city’s “Bentonite enterprise” as a shift man. Until 2004, Mher changed different jobs at various organizations. Starting in 2005, he has been engaged in cattle breeding. Mher sells his farm products in Ijevan city’s market and thus keeps his family, which consists of his wife and son. Mher’s wife works at school as a teacher and at the same time, she and their son help Mher on farm. 
  
This is Mher's fourth loan from Nor Horizon and now he is seeking a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy a large lot of fodder and transport it to his farm. Mher intends to use his future profit to setup an auto repair station, which will allow him to increase his family’s income in the future.

loans.use: To buy a large lot of fodder and transport it to his farm

loans.name: Munira

texts.en:
Munira is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, she has operated a green grocery, i.e. potatoes, green vegetables, onions and tomatoes. She sells to her neighbors. Munira faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding and establishing a poultry business in the future.

With the KSHS 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase crates of tomatoes, onions and vegetables. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase crates of tomatoes, onions and vegetables.

loans.name: Khorn

texts.en: Khorn is making doormats to sell. Her husband is working in a hotel as a cleaner. Their income is $5 per day. There is only one child staying in her family. He is working in the hotel with his father. Every month, she has to spend $20 on food, $15 on transportation, and $40 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy more fabrics to make doormats. This loan may help her family to continue her career and make more income if she can make the doormats faster every day.

loans.use: To buy more fabrics to make doormats

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is 43 years old. She is a hard working businesswoman. She is single and blessed with two children aged 20 and 18. To cater to her family's needs, she has been running a general shop for the last one and a half years. In the next five years, she wants to have a wholesale business. She wants a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings to buy rice, sugar, maize flour, sweets and biscuits.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, maize flour, sweets and biscuits

loans.name: Too

texts.en:
Too is a dairy farmer from Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya, where he has been farming for 10 years now. He sells his milk to a local dairy plant. He earns additional income from his small-scale farming of tea and poultry farming. 

Too has made a loan request for 50,000 Kenyan shillings in order to purchase a dairy cow. The extra proceeds from this loan will enable him to improve his family's livelihood and expand his farming activities. His biggest challenge has been lack of a stable market for milk which makes it hard to budget financially. He plans to construct a dairy unit and acquire at least four dairy cows in the next five years. 

Too is age 29 and married with a one year old child.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mavlon

texts.en: Mavlon owns a comfortable minivan and offers transportation services in Pendjikent city. Mavlon is a very careful, professional driver. He has rich experience working as a driver and has been working in the sphere of transportation services for five years. Mavlon is requesting a loan of 9,000 somoni to purchase new tire covers and other spare parts which he believes will provide extra safety for his passengers and will help him lessen his fuel costs. There are many passengers who travel on his itinerary and this makes his business very profitable and brings in a stable income. Mavlon is thinking about possibly buying a second van and starting a new scheduled route. We believe the reliability and responsibility that have characterized Mavlon will ensure the timely repayment of this loan. Mavlon is married with two children. More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his minivan.

loans.name: Voun

texts.en:
Voun, 48 years old, is a fortune teller. Her husband is a farmer. Their income is $4 per day. She has three children: two are students and one is working for $4 per day. Every month, she has to spend $30 on food, $20 on school fees, $10 on transportation and $40 on other expenses for the family. 

Voun would like to request a loan of $400 for her son to start his business cutting and polishing jewelry. She expects her son will make more income so that her family can live in better conditions. For the other children who are studying, she wants to send them to university when they finish high school.

loans.use: to support her son starting his business of cutting and polishing jewelry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Him

texts.en:
Him, 46 years old, sells cooked beans. Her husband is a salt seller. Their income is $7 per day. She has six children; two are studying and another three are working in the factory with $3 per day income for each of them. Every month, she has to spend $45 on food, $15 on transportation, $5 on school fees and $25 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $1,200 to buy stock of salt and pigs to fatten to sell to earn more money. She plans to extend her husband's business in the future and will repair her house when she has enough money. She wants to send her children to study to at least finish high school.

loans.use: To buy a stock of salt and pigs to fatten for selling.

loans.name: Khursandmurod

texts.en:
Khursandmurod is a responsible father of three children.  From the time he was a boy, he learned the honorable work of raising livestock, activities which were passed down from his parents and which today bring him satisfaction.  He also runs the business of selling fodder for cattle. 

Thanks to his valuable knowledge of the livestock trade, he has been able to obtain good results from his sales.  This enterprising gentleman’s wish is to invest more capital in young animals.  Khursandmurod hopes to continue his dedication to his work, believing that by improving his stock and feed, his cattle will bring better prices.  For this reason, he is turning to you for the support that would permit him to continue developing his business.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle in order to expand the business.

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice is a resident and farmer in the Kisii area of South Rift Kenya. She is aged 54 and has been in farming for the last 30 years, employing four farmhands on a casual basis and producing a variety of products but mainly onions, vegetables, potatoes, millet and milk. She is married with seven adult children, though the last two are still taking their post secondary education. 

Loice has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. She says the income generated will be used to put the last two children through their education. She also adds that the milk will improve their nutritional consumption. She says she wants to expand her farming, especially by raising pedigree cows and growing high value crops  

Loice sees limitations in finances and a poor transportation system as the major challenges in farming.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Lunh

texts.en: Lunh is a palm sugar seller. Her husband makes palm sugar. Their income is $4 per day. She has six children. Three of the children are studying and the other three are working in a factory. Every month, she has to spend $66 on food, $25 on transportation, $10 on school fees and $25 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy a motorbike to transport the palm sugar to sell. She plans to buy more palm sugar to sell so that she can make more income to support her children to study in the university.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to transport palm sugar

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce has practiced farming in Njabini town for the last eight years. She is 59 years old and a single mother of two school-going children.  

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.  She normally sells her produce at Njabini market.

In the future, Joyce hopes to become a leading farmer in the Njabini area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Kepha

texts.en:
Kepha is 47 years old and has been farming for 10 years in the Kisii area, South Rift Kenya, employing five farmhands in his farm.  His produce of vegetables, tomatoes, maize, beans and onions are sold locally.

Kepha has requested a loan of 30.000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow.  He says the milk produced will improve the health of his children as well as enable him to educate them.  He adds that he is focusing on expanding his farm acreage to improve tomatoe and onion farming both in quantity and quality.

Kepha believes farmers are facing challenges of  poor knowledge in crop diseases and training on the same would be appropriate.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy has practiced farming in Njabini town for the last three years.  She is 38 years old and the single mother of three school age children.  

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her first  loan.  She practices small scale farming and she plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.  She normally sells her produce at Njabini market.

In the future, Nancy hopes to buy more land and become a large scale farmer in Njabini area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Veromena

texts.en:
Veromena has practiced farming in Njabini town for the last two years.  She is 47 years old and the single mother of three school age children.  

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy potato seeds and fertilizer.  She normally sells her produce at Njabini market.

In the future, Veromena hopes to become a leading farmer in Njabini area.

loans.use: To buy potato seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Akmal

texts.en:
Akmal is married with 3 children.  He sells women's shoes at the central market of Istaravshan.  He takes his entire inventory with him by car and provides local clients with the shoes they need.  He has been in this business for 10 years. 

Akmal sells women's shoes because women buy shoes more often.  Akmal is a hardworking person.  His goal is to fix his house and take good care of his children.  He wants to borrow $2,500 USD to purchase seasonal inventory.  The loan would help Akmal to increase his sales and reach his goals faster.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy shoes

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: A 55-year-old single mother of one school-going child, Florence has practiced farming in the town of Njabini for the last seven years and normally sells her produce at Njabini market. She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers, and this will be her first loan which she plans to use to buy seeds and fertilizer.  In the future, Florence hopes to buy more land and practice large-scale farming.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Lankeu

texts.en: Lankeu has been earning a living as a livestock farmer rearing sheep for the past seven years. A favourable climate and the availability of grazing land have afforded him a livelihood, and he has grown his business through a number of loans since he joined Faulu Kenya. Now requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more sheep, Lankeu hopes to become a large-scale farmer in five years so as to generate more income.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en: A 36-year-old widow with three school-going children, Miriam has practiced farming in Njabini town for the last seven years, normally selling her produce at Njabini market. She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers, and this will be her first loan with which she plans to buy seeds and fertilizer. In the future, Miriam hopes to become a leading farmer in the Njabini area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Akpar

texts.en:
Akpar is 49 years old. He is married and has three children. 

He sells cattle for a living. As a rule, Akpar purchases small cattle in the central market, feeds them and then resells them at higher prices in the local market. 

Being in this business for 12 years, he knows very well how to choose the animals, how to breed them and look after them. Thus, he gets up every morning in order to feed the animals and to look after them. His knowledge and skills allow him to make his business successful and generate a stable and considerable income for his large family. 

Akpar is planning to enlarge the stock and to purchase more cattle. With this purpose, he requests 2,500 USD that he will spend for the purchase of young cattle and sheep. Akpar deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him.          

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes having been a key post along the Silk Road and having witnessed the end of Alexander the Great's rule. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase cattle and sheep for expanding the business.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice has practiced farming in Njabini town for the last three years. She is 34 years old and a single mother of three school-going children.  

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. She normally sells her produce at Njabini market.

In the future, Eunice hopes to become a leading farmer in the Njabini area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is a married woman with one child who attends school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past one year, she has operated a bodaboda (motorcycle) business. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. During rainy season, transportation becomes difficult. 

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase cloth materials to start selling clothes. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

She dreams of establishing more businesses in the future.

loans.use: To purchase cloth material to start selling clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a married woman with two children. One attends school while the other is still young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a tailoring business, selling in a shop to her neighbors and passersby. Janet faces a major challenge of seasonality. During holidays and weddings, she experiences high numbers of customers in her business. She dreams of establishing another business in the future.

With the KES 10,000 she wants to purchase bundles of cloth materials and threads. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of cloth materials and threads.

loans.name: Najmiddin

texts.en:
Najmiddin is a hardworking man. He is married and the responsible father of two children. His wife is not working. 

For more than three years Najmiddin has been running a public transportation service. He has his own car, a “Gazelle,” that he drives through Isfara city. The profit that he makes from this business he spends to provide for his family’s needs. 

In addition to his transportation business he also processes dried fruits. Najmiddin would like to get a loan of 10,000 TJS for purchasing of new car in order to expand his business and make a good profit. 

This loan will be his second loan from IMON International and he has a good credit history.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes having been a key post along the Silk Road and having witnessed the end of Alexander the Great's rule. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy an additional car

loans.name: Kawama Omunaku Group

texts.en:
The consumption rates of alcohol in Uganda are at an all time high. Alcoholic beverages of all types sell highly, not only in urban areas, but also rural areas where most people live below the breadline. Those who have studied this rising phenomenon made deductions to the effect that most people in Ugandan urban centers are social drinkers. 

The best part of it all is that people usually gather for this drink in the evenings after a hard day's work.

Most Ugandans take the example of 38-year-old Rose in Jinja and have been cashing in as the phenomenon grows. Rose, for example, opened her own pub in the metropolis of Jinja three years ago and the happily married mother of three says it’s been by every inch a worthwhile experience. 

She began this enterprise with capital from her erstwhile general merchandise retail trade. She sells all sorts of alcoholic beverages that she says are in high favor with old and new clients alike.

She says her sales revenue totals up to 100,000 UGX weekly. 

Rose says she is going to use this Kiva loan money to purchase more crates of both hard and soft beverages to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more crates of both hard and soft beverages to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Khairiddin

texts.en:
Since 2004 Khairiddin has been a livestock farmer. He breeds calves, cows and sheep. He is single and lives with his parents.

Khairiddin's father was also a cattle breeder and from childhood he has gained rich experience in the livestock business, enabling him to improve his situation. 

Nowadays, his biggest dream is to expand his business and to also to offer related products such as dairy products in the surrounding community.

Therefore, his biggest need is to get a loan in order to buy more cows. Khairiddin is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to improve his living.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase more cows.

loans.name: Leparakuo

texts.en:
Leparakuo is a livestock farmer who mainly rears sheep. He has been farming for almost 10 years. He is able to practice livestock farming because of the good climate and availability of grazing land. He has retained his business because he has learned the art of good customer care. He has also been trained on business management skills by Faulu Kenya.

Leparakuo hopes to own more sheep in the future. He has requested a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy sheep.

loans.use: To buy sheep.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David has practiced farming in Njabini town for the last five years. He is 37 years old and married to Beth; they have two school-going children.  

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers, and this will be his third loan. He paid all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy a dairy cow, which will supplement his other farm income.

In the future, David hopes to become a leading farmer in the Njabini Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Noroy

texts.en:
Noroy is an entrepreneur from Istaravshan. She lives there with her husband and two children. 

Noroy sells children's clothing. All the merchandise she offers for sale in her business is trademark quality at affordable prices. 

When Noroy launched her enterprise 20 years ago, it was pretty basic. However, she has consistently increased her clientele and the assortment of discount clothing imported from neighboring cities. 

Noroy is seeking a loan of 7,500 TJS to add to her stock and meet the growing demand for clothing. At this point, one of her business goals is to find reliable and accountable suppliers to partner with. 

Noroy has already repaid six loans to IMON International without any delinquencies. We believe her outstanding credit history and willingness to strive for higher goals will help her repay the current loan and reach success in her business.   
  
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty.

IMON's History:
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase clothing for sale.

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.en:
Gulbahor has been running a children’s clothes and women’s fabrics sales business for 20 years. Gulbahor sells her goods in the local market in Isfara city.

She has great business experience. She started her business selling children’s clothes, but now her business has expanded and she has added women's fabrics to her sales. 

Gulbahor purchases her merchandise from Khujand city two or three times a month from her regular suppliers. She would like to a loan of 10,000 TJS to purchase new children’s clothes and women's fabrics in order to increase her working capital. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes having been a key post along the Silk Road and having witnessed the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to epic mountain passes, a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC, and communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty.

IMON's History:
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy new children’s clothes and women’s fabrics.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman with three school-going children. They live at a house that she owns, but it has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past year, she has operated a charcoal-selling business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. Josephine faces a major challenge of the high cost of transporting charcoal from rural areas to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and supplying as a wholesaler in the future.

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 38 years old. She is married and blessed with five school-going children. 

She has been practicing dairy farming for over five years. She wants in the next five years to have added to the number of her dairy cows so that she is able to live her dream of being financially stable and thus able to develop herself.

Jane is thankful to Faulu Kenya for training her on business management. This has helped her to grow her business. She wants a loan of 20,000 KES to buy animal feeds.

loans.use: To buy animal feeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more flour to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more goods for her shop to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 45 years old, married to Rachael and they have two school age children. He has operated his retail shop in Njabini town for the last eleven years.

John was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan funds to buy more retail goods in bulk. He will later repack them and sell them in small quantities.

In the future, John hopes to change his business to wholesale.

loans.use: To buy more goods for sale

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with three children. Two attend school while one is still young for school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Saumu  has operated a business  selling natural fruit juices, like mango juice and banana juice. She sells  from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of opening more businesses in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000, Saumu wants to purchase sacks of mangoes, bananas and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of mangoes, bananas and sugar.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 28 year old single woman she owns a cafe in Tala market where she supplies food to her daily customers. She has been doing this for  one year and gets an income of KES.15,000 per month. 


Mary  was introduced to KADET by a KADET officer. She has a good credit history and she is applying for her second loan of KES 20000 from KADET LTD.  She plans to buy cooking cereals, maize, beans, flour, utensils and others items for her cafe.


Mary  will use the extra profit to put back to business. She hopes to own a big restaurant. She is very hardworking.

loans.use: To buy cooking cereals, maize, beans, flour, utensils and other items.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is 41 years old. He is a hard working business man who is married and blessed with three children ages 11, 7 and 3 who go to school. He has been engaging in dairy farming for the last ten years to cater for the needs of his family. In the next five years, he wants to own several dairy cows for more income generation. 
Joel is asking for a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy two calves.

loans.use: To buy two calves

loans.name: Loan

texts.en:
Loan, a 53-year-old married woman, lives in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband no longer works. Loan earns an income to support her family by sewing clothes and selling fabric to people in the local community.

Loan requires a loan to purchase fabric and materials that will enable her to make more clothing and provide better services for her customers. She hopes that better fabric and materials will permit her to work more efficiently and to attract more customers.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and materials

loans.name: Hiyam

texts.en: Hiyam works in preparing mouneh requested by loyal customers. "Mouneh is an old food tradition still produced in rural Lebanon involving the annual processing of fruits, vegetables, herbs, flowers, and animal by-products. It is done naturally according to availability during each season. The foods are later stored away in the pantry or "oodet el mouneh" – which translates to the mouneh room and these preserves are consequently consumed all year long." Hiyam is a 40-year-old married woman, the mother of four children, who works hard to provide them with the best living conditions. She works hard to help her husband increase their income and cover most of their expenses. In addition to preparing mouneh, Hiyam is going to help her son fix his garage that was in a fire, so he can continue his work fixing motorcycles. She hopes to improve her business more and more through expanding her mouneh varieties. . .

loans.use: to start preparing her mouneh requests.

loans.name: Thao

texts.en:
Thao is a 32-year-old married woman with 2 sons. She lives in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a bricklayer. 

Thao earns a living by raising and selling pigs. She has done this since 2006. The income earned from Thao's piggery is used to meet her family's basic needs. 

Thao requires a loan to provide her with capital to buy more pigs and repair her piggery. She hopes that the new stock and increased capacity of her piggery will enable her to generate more income to support her family.

loans.use: to buy more pigs and repair her piggery.

loans.name: Abdusami

texts.en:
Abdusami is a responsible husband and the loving father of two children. He lives in Isfara, Tajikistan. His wife sells fabric and educates children. Since 2005 Abdusami has been running a business of selling dried fruits in the market of Isfara. He purchases fruits. and after processing he sells them at the market for an affordable price. This will be his 6th cycle loan, and he has a good credit history. He wants to increase his working capital, and for this reason he requested a loan of 10,000 TJS. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy fresh fruits for processing.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 39 years old, married to Katumbi, and they are blessed with children. He owns a carpentry shop in Kangundo market where he does his carpentry work. He has been doing this for the last four years and gets an income of about 16,000 KES (~$180)per month.

Peter is applying for his first loan of 20,000 KES from KADET LTD with which he plans to increase his stock of things like timber, paints, chisels, nails and sandpaper.

He will use the extra profit to cover the increasing needs of his family, like school fees. Peter hopes to have a model business that can one day become a showroom. He wants to educate his children to be self reliant in the future and to live a comfortable life. He is very hardworking.

loans.use: To purchase timber, paint, chisels, nails and sandpaper.

loans.name: Muthiani

texts.en:
Muthiani is 43 years old, married to Jane, and they do not have children yet. He owns a retail shop in Kituluni Tala where he sells things like cooking fat, flour, sugar and so on. He has been doing this for the last eight years and gets an income of about 10,000 KES (~$117) per month. 

He was introduced to KADET by a KADET officer. He has got a good credit history and he is applying for his fourth loan of 30,000 KES. The loan will increase his capital for buying stock like cooking fat, sugar, flour, etc.

Muthiani will use the extra profit to expand his business. He hopes to open extra branches. He is very honest and obedient.

loans.use: To increase his stock of needed items like cooking fat.

loans.name: Mkhitar

texts.en:
64-year-old Mkhitar lives in Ddmashen village, in the area of Sevan, with his wife. Mkhitar’s 3 daughters and son have already married and they live separately from their parents. For 30 years Mkhitar had worked as a lorry driver in different organizations.
 
He has been running a farm for about 12 years. On his farm he has cows, sheep, pigs and chickens. He also grows potatoes. With his wife’s help, Mkhitar manages his farm and sells his farm produce (milk, fermented milk, cheese, potatoes) in the Yerevan food market. He and his wife like their occupation and they work very hard, so they were able to organize their children’s weddings, and now they support themselves independently.

Mkhitar needs an 800.000 AMD loan to increase his number of sheep, which will lead to his family’s income growth in the near future.

loans.use: To buy more sheep.

loans.name: Soan

texts.en:
Soan is a 41-year-old married woman with 2 sons. She lives in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a bricklayer. 

She has been selling handmade pottery products such as floral vases and ornaments since 2000. Her daily income is used to meet her family's basic needs.
