Soan requires a loan to provide her with additional capital to buy more products and higher quality vases to better meet her customers' needs. She hopes that the additional products will enable her to generate a higher income and improve the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy a higher quality of vases for resale.

loans.name: Juhudi Group

texts.fr: La cliente Christine, leader du groupe d’affaire « Juhudi »,  est entrepreneur, âgée de 50 ans, mariée, mère de 10 enfants qui étudient tous et d’autres ont leurs propres foyers. Elle est  vendeuse de tissus dames. Son mari est un hôtelier cuisinier. Elle installe ses marchandises au long de la rue ambiante des avenues. Il y a 9 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces activités. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser  20 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner  avec  2 ballons de tissus (draps de lit).  En plus, elle ambitionne scolariser ses enfants et acheter une parcelle pour y construire confortablement.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe d’affaire « Juhudi» est majoritairement féminins.
texts.en:
The customer, Christine, is the leader of the Juhudi business group. She is a fifty-year old entrepreneur, married, and a mother of ten; all the children have schooling, and some have their own families. She retails fabrics to ladies. Her husband is a hotel cook.
She displays her merchandise along active streets and avenues. She has been doing business in this way for over nine years. However, she just went through 20 loan cycles with Hekima's lending. This new loan should allow her to stock up with two bundles of fabrics (bed sheets). In addition, her ambition is to keep her children in school and to buy a lot to build a comfortable house.
The customer thanks Hekima for its actions in favor of poor women excluded from traditional banking. It should be noted that a majority of group Juhudi's members are women.

loans.use: to buy two bundles of fabric (bed sheets).

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Urmat

texts.en:
Urmat is 53, widowed, and she has five children. Urmat is a very persistent, honest and optimistic woman who strives hard to provide her children with everything they need.

She is engaged in a cattle breeding business, which she started three years ago with the initial capital of 10.000 KGS. Today she has one milk cow (which allows her to get an income from selling milk products) and one calf at her farm.  

Urmat has applied for a loan of 50.000 KGS to purchase another milk cow in order to raise her milk sales and obtain new customers. These investments will help her to support her children and give them a good education. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase another milk cow.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is 26 years old, single, and planning to get married this year. She has been running her salon business for the past six years. She earns a monthly income of about 8,000 KES (~$93) which she saves and also uses in the business.

She has been loaned 15,000 KES from KADET Ltd. This is her first loan from KADET. She intends to use the loan to purchase beauty / cosmetic products, and also hair extensions to sell and use in the salon.

She plans to use the anticipated profit to plan for her wedding. Ann's hopes and dreams for herself are to get married this year, start her salon nearer to her new home and make it big.

loans.use: To purchase beauty / cosmetic products, and also hair extensions to sell and use in the salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a greater variety of stock for her store.

loans.name: Johannes

texts.fr: Marié à une revendeuse, Johannes est meunier de profession il a 07 enfants en charge. Il sollicite ce prêt pour acheter des bandes de meunier, de l’entonnoir, de la dynamo afin de répondre à la demande de la population. Il a 49ans.
texts.en: Married to a vendor, Johannes is a miller by trade, with seven dependent children. He is seeking this loan to buy [belt drives], a funnel, and a power generator in order to meet his clients' needs. He is 49 years old.

loans.use: to buy a generator, a funnel, and belt drives

loans.name: Rasul

texts.en:
Rasul is 65-year-old man. He is married and the father of three children. He is a hardworking man. Since 2002 he has been running the business of selling legume products at the local market of Isfara city. He purchases his products from Khujand and Kyrgyz Republic. 

He would like to get a loan 9,000 TJS for purchasing products in bulk in order to pay the lower wholesale prices, which allows him to make a good profit.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy legume products in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Makhamatzhan

texts.en:
Makhamatzhan lives in Ak-Otok village, in the southern part of Kyrgyzstan. He is married and has 4 children. 

In 2000, in order to find the earnings required to support his family, Makhamatzhan decided to start his own business in rice cultivating. Using his start-up capital in the sum of 1,100 KGS, Makhamatzhan bought seeds of rice. Owing to his persistent and hardworking personality, Makhamatzhan managed to multiply his investments and today earns about 7,000 KGS in a month. 

Makhamatzhan is applying for a loan of 60,000 KGS to raise his floating capital for rice provisions. With the revenue, he plans to broaden his business in reselling rice. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to raise floating capital in reselling rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Nuru Group

texts.fr: La cliente Moseka, leader du groupe d’affaire « Nuru »,est entrepreneur, âgée de 33 ans, mariée, mère de 7 enfants qui étudient tous. Elle est  vendeuse de viande en détail. Son mari est aussi boucher, sociétaire d’une boucherie. Elle installe ses marchandises au marché sectoriel Afia Bora. Il y a 12 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces activités. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser  4  cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner  avec  2 cartiers de vache (bœuf).  En plus, elle ambitionne scolariser ses enfants et acheter une moto, une voiture jeep et une parcelle dans les quartiers résidentiel de VIP.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe d’affaire « Nuru» est majoritairement féminins.Une des clientes, porte joyeusement son bébé en main.
texts.en:
Moseka is a client and the leader of the business group "Nuru". She is 33 years old, an entrepreneur, married, and the mother of seven children, who are all in school. She sells meat retail. Her husband is also a butcher and a partner in a butcher shop. Moseka sets up her merchandise at the sector market Afia Bora. She has been in this business for twelve years. Yet, she just completed four loan cycles with Hekima. This new loan must serve her to stock up on two quarters of beef. Her ambition is to educate her children and to buy a motorbike, a jeep, and a plot of land in the VIP residential district. 

This client is thankful for Hekima for its actions favoring poor women who are excluded from traditional banking. It is appropriate to note that the business group "Nuru" is composed mostly of women. One of the clients is happily holding her baby.

loans.use: to buy 2 quarters of beef

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is single and has 2 children. Both of her children are currently in school. Maria has a business of a small retail shop that sells phone accessories, which she has had for 1 year.         

To help expand her business, Maria has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase phone accessories for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Maria hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. In the future, Maria hopes to own a big retail shop that sells accessories. 

Maria is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business skills and raising enough capital.

loans.use: to purchase phone accessories for resale

loans.name: Tahssin

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 30 years old, married and has one child.

In 2004, Tahssin opened a food market selling soft drinks, juices, cheese and dairy products. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His store is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. 

He is requesting a $3,000 loan to buy a generator and to purchase additional foodstuffs for his market. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a generator and to purchase additional foodstuffs for his market.

loans.name: Son

texts.en:
Son, 47, is married and has been supporting her family by selling bread and sandwiches in her community. Her husband is a physical education trainer. Son lives with 3 children and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Son has been running her food stall for 25 years. She sells bread and sandwiches as well as other prepared foods such as grilled pork and fried eggs. She plans to use this loan to buy a greater range of food products to sell to her customers.  

She hopes her business will go well and she can save money for reinvestment and to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more food to sell to her customers

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 30 years old, married and has three children.

Mohamad has owned a workshop since 2000. He sells and repairs car electrical parts. He has more than 10 years experience in this field. He has a good reputation and is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $3,000 loan to pay the annual rent for his workshop and to add more inventories. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To pay the annual rent for his workshop and to add more inventory.

loans.name: Falidah's Group

texts.en:
Falidah's group is comprised of three hardworking women. Falidah is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in Kampala, Central Region, Uganda. She is married and has three children. Two of her children are currently in school. Falidah's business is a market stall that sells vegetables, which she has had for less than one year. She sells charcoal as a second business.  

To help expand her business, Falidah has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase vegetables and charcoal for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Falidah hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family. In the future, Falidah hopes to expand her business and fry some fresh fish. Falidah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her capital.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and charcoal for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Carlos Nicolas

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 39 años, está casado con la Sra. Maura de 39 años, quien le ayuda en el taller, tiene  un  hijo, vive en casa propia y en donde también tiene su taller.
Carlos es talabartero, elaborando trabajos en cuero para monturas de caballos. Aprendió el oficio de su padre con quien trabajó durante 15 años, después se casó, se independizó y habilitó su propio taller.
Actualmente realiza los trabajos para los ganaderos de la zona y a los negocios de la zona.
El se define como un hombre muy trabajador y luchador, trabaja por el bien de su hijo.
el solicita el credito para la compra de cuero, que es su materia prima principal.
texts.en:
Carlos is 39 years old.  He is married to Maura, 39 years old, who helps him in his shop.  He has one child and lives in his own house, where he also has his shop.

Carlos is a saddler, making leather items for horse saddles.  He learned this work from his father, with whom he worked for 15 years. Then he married, became independent, and opened his own shop.

Currently, he does work for local ranchers and businesses.

He defines himself as a very hard-working man, and a fighter.  He works for the good of his son.

He is asking for the loan in order to purchase leather, which is his principal raw material.

loans.use: to purchase leather to use in his tack shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Ayed

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 42 years old, married and has three children.

Ayed has had a food market since 2000, selling soft drinks, juices, cheese and dairy products. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His store is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. 

He is requesting a $2,500 loan to buy a generator and to purchase additional foodstuffs for his market. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a generator and purchase additional foodstuff to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Souhad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 32 years old, married and has three children.

Souhad has been a tailor since 2000. She makes and repairs women’s clothing. She has a deep understanding of the local consumer. She is experienced and well known in her area.

She is requesting an $1,800 loan to buy a small generator and to add more inventories. She is optimistic about her business development and hopes that the coming years will continue to bring her positive growth.

loans.use: To buy a small generator and add more inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase braids and cream relaxer oil for the hair for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
La Sra. Justina está casada con el Sr. Mariano, son padres D. 7 hijos, están domiciliado en Ciudad del Este.
La Sra. Justina tiene casa propia, donD. realiza la venta D. bebidas  para el Barrio, está dedicada a este rubro a varios años, debido a que cuenta con una cancha donD. se realizan deportes al lado D. su casa, mediante la cual tiene una demanda fija D. algunos moradores y vecinos.
Ella manifiesta que tiene mucha demanda por lo cual le gustaría poder aumentar la cantidad D. bebidas que tiene. Ella solicita el credito para la compra D. bebidas como ser cervezas, gaseosas, energizantes y demás.
texts.en: Justina and her husband Mariano have 7 children. They live in Ciudad del Este. Justina has her own home, where she sells drinks in her neighbourhood. She has stayed in this area for several years because there is a sports field next door, which makes customers of her neighbours and other locals. Justina is dealing with high demand, so she would like to carry a better variety of drinks. She has applied for a loan so that she can buy more beer, soda, energy drinks, etc.

loans.use: buy soda, energy drinks, beer, wine, whisky, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses has a mixed farm in his hometown in eastern Kenya that produces bananas and milk which he sells to the local market. His farm also produces fine beans, which he sells to the Homegrown company. He earns additional income from his business by buying bananas from Kakamega town and selling them in Nairobi town. 
 
Moses has made a loan request of 50,000 KES through the Kiva partner, Juhudi Kilimo, in order to cultivate his banana farm. The income that will be generated from this project will help him meet the basic needs of his family. His primary challenges have been the lack of a stable market for his produce and also the pests and diseases which affect his production. In future, he plans to expand his banana farm from the current 3 acres to 5 acres.

loans.use: To cultivate his banana farm.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Close to Abena, on the floor, are umbrellas and underwear. She also sells food stuffs like cassava and plantains at Kokoado, which is a village near Elmina. She is a single parent taking care of three children. The last born child is the boy standing by Abena in the picture. She educates, feeds, and clothes her children with the income she makes from her sales. She wants to increase the sale of the goods so she can build a shop from the income. A loan will be used to acquire different types of underwear to sell.

loans.use: A loan will be used to acquire different types of underwear to sell.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is married and has 3 children. She sells various kinds of clothes at Elmina, which she has done for 10 years. Her husband is a farmer. She helps her husband to pay the school fees and utility bills. She will use the loan to purchase clothes to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to reinvest for further growth.

loans.use: Ekua will use the loan to purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Sra. María Del Carmen, de 21 años de edad es comerciante, vendedora de cosméticos. Comenzó trabajando  hace más de 2 años, y que con ello pudo salir adelante con toda su familia, y lo más importante para ella, es poder seguir sus estudios universitarios. 
Ella se considera una mujer muy responsable y trabajadora, gracias al tiempo que lleva vendiendo los cosméticos ha podido formarse una clientela bien definida. Le gustaría algún día poder abrir una mercería donde poder ofrecer todos sus productos.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra de mas cosméticos, con lo cual podrá abastecer su stock de mercaderías.
texts.en:
Maria del Carmen, 21, works in retail selling cosmetics.  She started her business more than 2 years ago, and with it she has been able to get ahead with her family and, what is most important to her, continue with her university education.

Maria considers herself to be a very responsible and hardworking woman.  Over the time that she has been selling cosmetics, she has been able to generate a well-established clientele.  She would like one day to open a store where she could offer all of her products for sale.

Maria requests a loan to buy more cosmetics, so that she will be able to stock up her business with merchandise.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to later sell

loans.name: Suong

texts.en:
41 year-old Suong lives with her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. The coupL. has 3 children. Her husband is a bricklayer, which is a line of work that doesn't always provide a regular source of income for the family. Suong has tried to support her family by selling soup on her street since 2006. This work provides her and her family with a daily income to meet the family's basic living expenses.

Suong's income has fallen recently because of the increased cost of renting the small area where she sets up her stall to sell soup. She would like to take out a loan to supplement her business capital and buy more food to sell at her stall. She hopes that through the loan she will be abL. to increase her income and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more food to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine is aged 40 and married with 7 children. She is a farmer from Nkubu town in eastern Kenya where she has been farming for 10 years now. Her farm produces bananas and beans which she sells to the local market. Farming has been her major source of income.

Josphine has requested a loan of 30,000 KES to buy chickens and chicken feed in order to practice poultry farming. She hopes that this project will generate enough income to enable her to improve her family's livelihood. She plans to use the extra income from this loan to build a modern house for her family. She faces the challenge of the lack of enough water which affects her production.

loans.use: To buy chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Vaa Paulina

texts.en: In the photo, Vaa is displaying the food items she sells (such as macaroni, salt, powdered milk, oil and others). She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a farmer. As part of her responsibilities, she helps her spouse to pay utility bills and other household expenses. A loan of 600 GHS will be reinvested into the purchase of macaroni, salt, powdered milk, oil and other food items for further growth of the business.

loans.use: A loan of 600 GHS will be reinvested into the purchase of macaroni, salt, powdered milk, oil and other food items for further growth of the business.

loans.name: Abena Matilda

texts.en: The picture above shows some pastries that Abena had baked. She is a baker at Elmina. She is a single parent, taking care of 2 children. She has been in the baking business for 10 years. She sees to the well-being of the home. Her loan will be used to buy flour, sugar and other ingredients for baking items to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards building a snack bar.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar and other ingredients for baking items to sell.

loans.name: Florida

texts.en:
Florida is a farmer from Nkubu town in eastern Kenya where she has been farming for 17 years now. Her farm produces milk, cabbages, potatoes and tea, which she sells to the local market and a local tea factory, respectively. She is aged 39 and married with 2 children who both attend school.

Florida has made a loan request of 25,000 KES to buy chickens and chicken feed in order to practice poultry farming. The extra income from this poultry project will be used to expand the poultry farm and improve her family's livelihood. She faces the challenges of the lack of a stable market and low market prices for her farm produce. She hopes that in the next 5 years, her poultry farm will have expanded and her income increased.

loans.use: To buy chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en:
Hanh is 43 years old. She lives in her own house with her husband and three children in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a motorbike driver for hire. 

Hanh supports her family by earning income selling food to people in her community. She started her food stall 5 years ago and she sells many kinds of dishes, especially dishes for lunch. She intends to take a loan to buy new furniture and a greater quantity of food to sell. 

Hanh hopes that through the loan she can earn more money and can save enough money to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy new furniture and more food to sell.

loans.name: Zizamelni Group

texts.en:
Ntombi is 60 years old and married with 4 children between the ages of 18 and 39. She also takes care of 3 relatives who live with her. She has been in business for 3 years, operating a tuck shop (small retail food store) that sells bread, sugar, candles, soup, and other items to her neighbors. She also receives money through a child support grant administered by the South African government.

Ntombi says that one of her children attends school, and this loan will help her pay for her child's education. In 5 years, Ntombi would like her business to become a tea room and store. She is excited to appear on the internet and would like to thank WDB and Kiva for extending support through this loan. In the photo she is pictured raising her hand.

loans.use: to buy bread, sugar, candles, and other things for resale.

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
65-year-old Em lives with her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. They have 5 children, 3 sons and 2 daughters. Her husband no longer works and is not in good health. 

Em has been running a general store in front of her door for 10 years. The income generated by her business is the only source of income to cover all her family's expenses. From her store Em sells everyday items such as toothbrushes, toothpaste, soaps, shampoo, chewing-gum and cooking oil.

Em plans to take out a loan to buy more items for her store so that she can offer a wider variety of goods to her customers. She believes that with a wider variety of goods she will attract more customers and her income will increase which will enable her to better support her family.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of goods to sell from her general store.

loans.name: Mujeres Artesanas Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son de la cuidad de Caacupé, todas son vecinas y amigas del barrio. Actualmente cuenta con 12 miembros. Ellas se definen como mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras. Se unieron con miras a un fin común que es la obtención de mayores ingresos para sus hogares por medio del esfuerzo y la cooperación de sus integrantes. 
La señora Rocío, con su marido y su hijo trabajan en la artesanía en flores. Gracias a este trabajo y a la ayuda de su marido pueden solventar los gastos del día a día. Ella se conceptúa como una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra de flores, las cuales son elemento principal de su trabajo.
texts.en:
The women in this communal bank are from the city of Caacupé.  They are all neighbors and friends from the neighborhood.  At this time, the group has 12 members.  They describe themselves as very tenacious and hardworking women.  They are united toward a common goal, which is to obtain better incomes for their households through the effort and cooperation of their membership.

Rocio works with her husband and her son making floral arrangements.  Thanks to this work she and her husband have the means to cover their daily household expenses.  She characterizes herself as a very hardworking and responsible woman.

Rocio requests a loan to buy flowers, which are the main elements of her work.

loans.use: to buy flowers to make floral arrangements

loans.name: Rot

texts.en:
Rot is 54 years old and married. She has 3 children and lives with them and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a hired motorbike driver and also helps her to transport food to her customers' houses.

Rot earns an income by preparing and selling food from her food stall. She has had her stall for 7 years and it is going smoothly. Rot would like a loan to increase the size of her business and produce a greater quantity and quality of food. The loan would be used to purchase fresher vegetables, meats and good quality spices.

Rot hopes that through the loan she will be able to attract more customers and generate a higher income by which to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more fresh vegetables, meats and good quality spices,

loans.name: Tendo Winner's Group

texts.en:
Retailing is one business genre that appeals to many prospective business people in Uganda. By and large, many Ugandans find this kind of business much easier to start up and maintain unlike other business sectors, which require substantial start up and operating capital.

One Ugandan who has found retail trading worthwhile the last two decades is 54 year old Wilfred, who is a widower and father of 5, and who operates in Kayunga. Wilfred sells a variety of general merchandise retail commodities such as sugar, salt, plastics, rice, beans, cooking oil, bread, etc. Wilfred also does agriculture as a side source of income. 190,000 Ugandan shillings is what this business generates for him on a monthly basis.

With this kiva loan, Wilfred says he is going to purchase more retail commodities such as sugar, beans, rice, maize flour, cooking oil and bread to resell in his shop.

loans.use: to purchase more retail commodities such as sugar, beans, rice, maize flour, cooking oil, and bread to resell in his shop.

loans.name: Samuel Segundo

texts.es:
El Sr. Samuel vive en la ciudad de Luque, tiene casa propia, donde vive con su hija.
El se dedica al flete, es decir, alquila su vehiculo para el trasporte de cosas. Comenta que trabaja incansablemente para poder brindarle a su hija un mejor futuro, ya que no quiere que ella pase por todas las necesidades que el en su momento tuvo que pasar.
El se define como una persona muy responsable, trabajadora y humilde. Le gusta siempre cumplir con todas las obligaciones que contrae. Como antecedente dentro de la Fundacion tiene 4 creditos
El solicita el credito para la reforma de su casa, con lo cual podrá mejorar un poco la comodidades.
texts.en:
Samuel lives in the city of Luque.  He owns his house where he lives with his daughter.  He is a delivery man, that is, he leases out his vehicle to transport things.  He comments that he works tirelessly to provide his daughter with a better future because he doesn’t want her to suffer the same wants he went through at some time.

He defines himself as a very responsible, hard working, humble man.  He always likes to meet whatever obligation he takes on.  As history with the Fundación, he has four previous loans.  He’s asking for the loan to do some home repairs to increase its comforts.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Vien

texts.en:
Vien is a 39 year old singL. woman. She lives in Ho Chi Minh City. For 3 years, she has operated a stall selling food to her community.

Vien would like to take a loan to purchase more food at a better price from wholesalers. This will decrease her business expenses and allow her to offer more competitive prices to her customers. Vien hopes that this will help her to retain her customers and attract further customers to her stall.

Vien hopes that through the loan she will be abL. to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more food at a better price from wholesalers.

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Nga is 54 and is unmarried. She lives in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Nga makes and sells pancakes for her customers in the local community. She has been engaged in the pancake making business for 20 years. To attract more customers, Nga is requesting a loan to buy new furniture and purchase better ingredients for her pancakes. 

Nga hopes that this loan will help her generate more profits and improve her living condition.

loans.use: to buy new furniture and better ingredients for making pancakes.

loans.name: Sethembiso Group

texts.en:
Hlengiwe is 31 years old and married with two children, ages 5 and 10. She has been selling clothes and cold drinks from her home for the past year.  Hlengiwe has requested this loan from Kiva and WDB to purchase more stock for her store. She also receives a child support grant from the South African government to support her family.

Hlengiwe says that the biggest challenges to her business are the clients that do not properly pay for the merchandise that she sells. She would like to grow her business into a supermarket over the next 5 years. She is very excited to appear on Kiva's website and would like to thank Kiva and WDB for helping her family. In the photo she is pictured rasing her hand.

loans.use: to buy clothes and drink for sale.

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Van, 54, is divorced and lives with her son in Ho Chi Minh City. She has raised her son with the income she has earned making and selling noodles. Van would like a loan to enable her to replace her old furniture with new furniture to attract more customers to her noodle stall. She also would like to use part of her loan to purchase better ingredients to enable her to produce better food for her customers. Van hopes that through the loan she will be able to generate more profit to support her son and save additional money to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy new furniture and ingredients for her food stall

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to invest in agriculture, buy furniture for her house and house- building materials, and invest the rest in a small business

loans.name: Jéremie 3:16 Plus Group

texts.en:
Augustin is the chairman of the Community Bank named “Jérémie 3:16 Plus” which is composed of 23 micro-entrepreneurs. The members are united in the same goal — to grow their businesses by loans received from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC. 
Augustin is 39 years old. His main activity is to sell beverages. He buys them in bulk and resells them retail at profit. He sells his products daily at the market in his area located east of Kinshasa.

Augustin started his business in 2004. He is a trustworthy client of the MFI HOPE RDC, having four times obtained and correctly repaid loans. His next loan will allow him to buy packages and crates of beverages to increase his sales in order to make a better profit. The business makes a profit of about US$200 per week. The aim of this loan is to reinforce his working capital and provide food for his family. He is married and the father of two children, aged 7 and 9 years old. Both attend school. He is also responsible for two relatives.

loans.use: to buy packages and crates of beverages to resell at retail

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité denominado Nueva Esperanza, es de la ciudad de San Ignacio, actualmente cuenta con 14 miembros. Todas ellas son vecinas y amigas de la ciudad. Se unen con un objetivo en común, que es la obtención de mayores ingresos para la manutención de sus casas.
La Sra. Petrona, se dedica a la venta de leche, por medio de este trabajo ella puede solventar todos los gastos que tiene. Manifiesta que su trabajo es muy sacrificado ya que se levanta a muy tempranas horas para repartir los lácteos, ya que los clientes se lo demandan.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra de mas lácteos, con lo cual podrá asegurar el cumplimiento de las demandas de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The committee called “Nueva Esperanza” (New Hope) is from the city of San Ignacio; it currently has 14 members.  All of them are neighbors and friends from the city.  They meet with one common goal: to obtain higher income for the support of their households.

Petrona sells milk.  Through this work she’s able to cover her expenses.  She states that the work is very demanding because she must rise very early to deliver the dairy products because her customers so require.

She asks for the loan to buy more dairy products in order to continue to meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy milk to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase young coffee plants to grow

loans.name: Maria Blanca

texts.en: Maria Blanca is 37-years-old and lives near the city of Ambato in the central Ecuadorian Andes. She is a single mother of two children, aged fifteen and two-and-a-half years. She is a responsible, peaceful, and very hard-working woman. Maria Blanca’s business is raising animals including guinea pigs, rabbits, and pigs. She began her business with only ten guinea pigs in a wooden pen. Her 15-year-old daughter helps her care for the animals. Maria Blanca reports that her business has been going well lately with the exception of an illness that killed ten of her rabbits. She is seeking her first loan to expand her business by adding chickens to sell to increase her income. Her dream is to improve her home and raise more animals.

loans.use: to begin raising chickens

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah is 37 years old. She is a hardworking business woman. She is married and blessed with three children, two of whom are in school. She has been providing for her family for the last two years by selling hay. She supplements her income by engaging in farming. She wants, in the next five years, to have opened up another hay shop. Her dream is to become an established business woman.

She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy hay.

loans.use: To buy hay.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase her store's inventory

loans.name: Roselline

texts.en: Roselline is a hard working 30-year-old businesswoman. She is married and blessed with three children who are going to school. She provides for her family by selling green groceries. She wants, in the next five years, to have opened up another shop and her dream is to see her business grow. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy vegetables.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Mjimwema Group

texts.en:
Maria, who is in her mid 20s, is married with one child who goes to school.  She has had a tailoring business since 1999.  She works from 6am to 6pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her ninth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used her previous loans to buy materials, a big stock of threads, buttons, school fees and household expenses. She has paid back all her loans successfully.  She hopes for a loan to buy more materials and lining for sewing more dresses to sell. Her dream is to one day build her own house.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Mjimwema", which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more materials and lining to sew more dresses to sell

loans.name: Fidelite Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mawazo est conseillère du groupe « Fidélité », âgée de 48 ans, mère de 5 enfants,tous étudiants et d'autres ont leurs propres foyers. Son Mari est sans emploi, chômeur. La cliente est sociétaire d’une boutique (kiosque). Il y a 4 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau crédit va lui servir à s’approvisionner en articles divers de son kiosque, notamment  .21 cartons de savons, 2 cartons de lait Nido, 1 carton de lotions de beauté,50kgs de sucre, 2 casiers de boissons sucrées, etc. le reste d’argent va lui servir dans la réalisation des petits projets de ménage.En plus, elle ambitionne acheter une parcelle et y construire confortablement une maison. Cependant, la cliente remercie HEKIMA pour ses actions sociales orientées en faveurs des pauvres femmes exclues de la banque classique.
texts.en: Mawazo, the leader of the "Fidelité" group, is 48 years old and has 5 children, some of whom are students and others of whom have their own households. Her husband is unemployed. She is the manager of a store (kiosk). She has run this business for four years. This new loan will serve to obtain supplies of various items sold at her kiosk, in particular 21 boxes of soap, 2 cartons of "Nido" milk, 1 box of beauty lotions, 50kg of sugar, 2 cases of sweet drinks, etc., and the rest of the money will be used to complete small household projects. In addition, her ambition is to buy a plot of land and build a comfortable house. In the meantime, this client is thankful to HEKIMA for its socially conscious actions on behalf of poor women without access to the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to buy 21 boxes of soap, 2 cartons of "Nido" milk, 1 box of beauty lotions, 50kg of sugar, 2 cases of sweet drinks, etc.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Magdaline

texts.en:
Magdaline is 63 years old. She is a humble and talkative businesswoman. She is married and blessed with two children who are 24 and 20 years old. One of her children is in school. She has been making her living for the last 10 years by engaging in farming. Previously, she used to sell groceries.
She had taken a prior loan of 60,000 Kenyan shillings, which she has paid back. She is now requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy spinach and kale seedlings, fertilizer and water pipes.

loans.use: To buy spinach and kale seedlings, fertilizer and water pipes

loans.name: Oliva

texts.en:
Oliva is 37 years old. She is married and blessed with five children who attend school. Oliva is visionary and hardworking. For the last seven years, she has worked as a tailor to provide for her family’s upkeep. 

Oliva is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to buy a sewing machine. She has repaid a previous loan of 15,000 KES. She hopes to expand her business into a larger shop within the next five years. Along with expanding her business, Oliva’s dream is also to own a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Este grupo es de la ciudad de Encarnación, surgió por contacto de una de las integrantes con la fundación,  el grupo se encuentra actualmente en el 8º ciclo, y se encuentra con 17 integrantes.
Todas ellas trabajan de forma responsable y solidaria. Se unieron con el propósito de ayudarse mutuamente y de esa manera poder generar mas ingresos para sus casas.
La Sra. Maria tiene 2 hijos pequeños y es casada. Ella se dedica hace varios años a la venta de comidas en forma ambulante,. Sale a muy tempranas horas de la mañana por su barrio y también por el centro de la ciudad a vender sus productos.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra de los insumos que necesita para la elaboración de los alimentos, como ser carnes, huevos, especias y hortalizas.
texts.en:
This group is from the city of Encarnación.  It arose from a contact of one of the members with the Fundación.  The group currently is in its 8th cycle and has 17 members.  They all work in a responsible and mutually supportive way.  They joined together to help each other out in order to obtain more income for their homes.

María has two small children and is married.  For several years she’s been a food vendor.  She goes out very early in the morning criss-crossing her neighborhood and also through the downtown area of her town selling her products.

She asks for the loan to buy supplies she needs to prepare the food like meats, eggs, spices and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy meat, spices, eggs and other supplies.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a hardworking 31-year-old businesswoman. She is single and blessed with one child. For the last two years, Elizabeth has been providing for her child by engaging in dairy farming. She supplements her income by selling clothes. 

Elizabeth is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to buy animal feed. Within the next five years, she hopes to have expanded her business and become financially stable.

loans.use: to buy animal feed

loans.name: Kitumbo Group

texts.en:
Omary, who is in his early 20s, is single with one small baby. He has been selling vouchers and housing units for mobile telephones for two years now.  He works from 6am to 10pm daily, and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be his first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania and he wants to use the loan to buying more vouchers, batteries and housing units for mobile telephones. His dream is to one day be able to build his own house.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Kitumbo" which has a total of 15 members, who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more vouchers,batteries and housing units for mobile telephones.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 40 years old. She is married and blessed with three school-going children, ages 21, 16 and 7. For the past seven years, she has been providing for her family by selling clothes. Previously, she used to sell groceries. She wants in the next five years to have made enough money from her business to be able to buy a cow and a goat. Her dream is to be able to buy a piece of land and develop it.

Previously, she had taken a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings, which she successfully paid. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase bales of clothes.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothing for resale.

loans.name: Siempre Vivas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SIEMPRE VIVAS” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Santiago II, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Angelica. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: metalmecánica, costura, confección de guantes de arquero, confección de deportivos, venta de comida, joyería, pasanaco.

La señora Angelica,  indica que esta hace quince años que trabaja con Pro Mujer, pero que se retiro hace cinco años; ahora volvió a trabajar con la institución por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de costura de implementos de arquero, que viene trabajando hace 16 años, negocio que aprendió de su familia.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de tela e hilos), que compraran por mayor de la calle Isac Tamayo y posterior a la elaboración del producto lo venderá en los departamentos de Santa Cruz y Cochabamba. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el consultorio.
texts.en:
The “Siempre Vivas” (Always Living) communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Santiago II Center.  It has nine members led by a governing board headed by Angélica.  The members of the communal bank carry out a variety of businesses like: metal shop, sewing, manufacturing gloves for archers, sportswear manufacturing, food sales, jewelry, ‘pasanaku’ (a traditional Bolivian method of group money saving).

Angélica indicates that she’s been working with Pro Mujer for fifteen years but dropped out five years ago.  Now, invited to rejoin by one of the promoters, she decided to work with the institution again.  Currently, she has a business sewing implements for archery.  She learned this business from her family and has been in it for 16 years.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase her capital; she will buy fabric and thread at wholesale on Isac Tamayo Street and after making the items will sell them in Santa Cruz and Cochabamba Departments.  This way of life makes it possible for her to generate resources to help out her family since she’s married and has two children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health clinic.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 37 years old. She is a hard working business woman who is married and blessed with five children, one of whom is married while the others are in school. She has been meeting the needs of her family for the last seven years by tailoring. Previously, she used to sell groceries. In the next five years, she wants to have opened up another shop.

She had previously taken a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings that she has fully paid. She is now requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy fabric.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Aigle Plus Group

texts.en:
Vital is the leader of the Community Bank named “Aigle Plus” which means “Eagle” in English. It is composed of 13 members united in solidarity for receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Vital is 45 years old. He has been active in his business since 2005. He began his business selling slippers. Besides selling slippers, he also sells miscellaneous goods. He joined one of Hope DRC’s groups in 2010, and has already received three loans that he repaid properly. Thanks to Hope’s loans, Vital’s business has prospered and it generates a profit of $15 per day. He intends with the next loan to increase the inventory of his business by buying slippers in bulk for reselling at a profit in order to increase his capital. His ambition is to open a slipper shop due to the high demand in his environment; He works hard in order to achieve his dream. Vital is married and the father of five children whose ages vary between 2 and 17 years old. Three of them attend school.

loans.use: to increase the stock of his goods by buying slippers in bulk and reselling them for a profit.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en:
Veronicah is a hard working 31-year-old business woman. She is married and blessed with six children who go to school and are ages 15, 13, 11, 9, 6 and 4. For the last three years, she has been providing for her family by engaging in crop farming. She hopes in the next five years to be a major supplier of vegetables. Her dream is to be financially stable.

She had previously taken a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings, which she has fully paid. She is now requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy manure, fertilizer and seeds.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Eliselda

texts.es:
La Sra. Eliselda está  casada, vive en Ciudad del Este. Ella se dedica a la venta de gallinas.
Manifiesta que lo que hace le es gratificante ya que cuenta con una considerable cantidad de clientes y el ingreso es bastante satisfactorio. Comenta que en el negocio la ayuda su marido y asi los dos generan ingresos para solventar los gastos de la casa. Están  saliendo adelante con voluntad, trabajo y dedicación.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de mas gallinas, para despues venderlas, ya que comprándolas al por mayor tiene un poco de descuentos, lo cual le deja un pequeño ahorro. Esta agradecida por la oportunidad que le da la Fundacion, ella tiene mucha esperanza en el credito, ya que sabe que le sera de gran utilidad.
texts.en:
Eliselda is married and lives in Ciudad del Este.  She sells chickens.  She states that she finds this gratifying and income is quite satisfactory.  She comments that her husband helps her with the business and thus they both generate income to cover household expenses.  They are getting ahead with will, work and dedication.

She is asking for the loan to buy more chickens to later sell because by buying them at wholesale she gets discounts which leave her a bit of savings.  

She is grateful for the opportunity the Fundación gives her.  He has a lot of hope pinned on the loan because she knows that it will be of great use to her.

loans.use: to buy chickens to sell.

loans.name: Valentine Group

texts.en:
Albert, who is in his early 20s, is single.  He has been selling second hand clothes for one year now. He works from 7am to 6pm daily, and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be his first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which he wants to use for buying more clothes for resale. His dream is to one day build his own house.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Valentine" which has a total of 18 members, who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is 40 years old. He is married and blessed with four children, ages 16, 14, 10 and 8 years old. He has been providing for his family during the last 12 years from income generated from his retail store. He supplements this income from his salary. He hopes in the next five years to have ventured into the wholesale business. His dream is to buy a piece of land and build a house.

He is requesting 80,000 Kenyan shillings to buy sugar, cooking fat and rice.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cooking fat and rice for resale.

loans.name: Toka Chini Group

texts.fr: La cliente Nyalalia, leader du groupe d’affaire « Toka Chini »,  est entrepreneur, âgée de 36  ans, mariée, mère de 7 enfants qui étudient tous. Elle est  couturière. En plus, elle aussi vendeuse de friperie pour accroitre ses revenus. Son mari est un cambiste (échangeur, bradeur de monnaie). Elle installe ses marchandises au long de la route Goma-Sake, précisément à Ndosho. Il y a 7 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces activités. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser  7 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner  avec  les matériels de couture et 1 ballon de friperies.  En plus, elle ambitionne scolariser ses enfants et acheter  une nouvelle machine à coudre de broderie.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe d’affaire « Toka Chini» est majoritairement féminins.
texts.en: Nyalalia, leader of the "Toka Chini" business group, is a 36-year-old married businesswoman with seven children, all of whom are students. She is a dressmaker. In addition, she also sells second-hand clothing to supplement her income. Her husband is a money-changer. She displays her products along the Goma-Sake route, more specifically at Ndosho. Seven years have passed since she first started this activity. During that time, she has been through seven loan cycles with Hekima. This new loan will serve to obtain sewing supplies and one bale of second-hand clothing. In addition, her dream is to educate her children and buy a new embroidery sewing machine. This client is thankful to Hekima for its actions on behalf of poor women without access to the traditional banking system. It is worth noting that the "Toka Chini" business group is composed primarily of women.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials and one bale of second-hand clothing.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Adelayda

texts.es: La señora Adelayda se dedica a la venta de frutas y su esposo trabaja en la Cámara Oficial Española. El crédito lo requiere para adquirir frutas al por mayor (naranjas, mandarinas, piñas, manzanas, plátanos, y otras frutas de la estación) y también para variar las mismas ya que su clientela le exige otro tipo de frutas. Vive en casa propia ubicado en la zona de Tahuantinsuyo  de la ciudad de La Paz. Es casada y tiene cuatro hijos. Esta es la tercera vez que su crédito se canaliza a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Adelayda sells fruit and her husband works in the official Spanish Chamber of Commerce in Bolivia.  She needs this loan to acquire fruit wholesale (oranges, mandarins, pineapples, apples, bananas and other seasonal fruit).  She would also like to vary the fruit that she sells as her customers are requesting other types of fruit.

Adelayda lives in her own home which is located in Tuhuantinsuyo district, in the city of La Paz.  She is married and has four children.  This is the third time that she has received a loan through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy fruit such as oranges, mandarins, pineapples, etc. wholesale for her fruit stall

loans.name: Valentin

texts.es:
El Sr. Valentin tiene 50 años de edad, esta casado con el Sra. Elena de 54 años de edad, ellos tienen cuatro hijos, Liz de 20 años de edad, actualmente trabaja en Argentina, Ever de 22 años de edad, vive y trabaja en Ciudad de Este, Rogelio de 18 años, y Leidy de 12 años que esta cursando el 7mo grado. 
Don  Valentin trabaja como comerciante ambulante hace más de 16 años. El empezó vendiendo caramelos, y luego de juntar su dinero comenzó a salir mas lejos con mas mercaderías a vender, en la actualidad tiene su clientela formada por zonas aledañas a la ciudad, y con las ganancias de su trabajo siempre pudo mantener su  hogar y salir adelante con su familia.
El Sr. Valentin solicita el crédito para la compra de ropas de  temporada invernal, frazadas, sabanas y demás para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Valentín is 50 years old and married to Elena, 54.  They have four children: Liz, 20, who currently works in Argentina, Ever, 22, who lives and works in Ciudad del Este, Rogelio,18, and Leidy,12, who is in 7th grade.

Valentín has worked as a street vendor for over 16 years.  He started out selling candy and once he gathered some money together started to go further afield with more merchandise to sell.  Currently, he has an established clientele in areas surrounding the city.  Profits from his work always made it possible for him to support his household and get ahead with his family.

Valentín is asking for the loan to buy seasonal winter clothes, blankets, sheets and others to meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing, blankets, sheets, etc.

loans.name: Bellas Flores Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “BELLAS F.” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Maribel. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de comida, costura de pantalones venta de abono, transporte, tienda de plástico, venta de chompas y mantas, tienda de abarrotes.

La señora Maribel,  indica que es la primera ves que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora en la zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida (pensión) que viene trabajando hace quince años aprendiendo el mismo de su mamá.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de verduras, carne y pollo) que adquirirá de la Ceja  y posterior a ala elaboración ,lo comercializará en villa Esperanza. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación en negocios.
texts.en:
The “Bellas F.” (Beautiful Flowers) communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Focal Center.  It has 8 members led by a governing board headed by Maribel.  The members carry out a variety of businesses among which are: food sales, pants manufacturing, manure sales, transportation, plastics store, sweater and blanket sales and grocery store.

Maribel indicates that this is the first time she’s worked with Pro Mujer and that she joined the institution thanks to an invitation from one of the promoters in her zone.  Currently she has a business selling food (providing daily contracted meals); a business she’s had for fifteen years and that she learned from her mother.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase her capital; she’ll buy vegetables, meat and chicken in La Ceja and once she prepares the food she’ll sell it in Villa Esperanza.  This way of earning a living allows her to generate resources to support her family since she’s married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the business training.

loans.use: buy vegetables, chicken and meat.

loans.name: Sortilegio Group

texts.es:
El grupo Sortilegio lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras ellas son Darling, Lesbia y Gema. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Darling de 32 años propietaria de una panadería, negocio familiar que inicio hace siete años aproximadamente. Ella se especializa en repostería e invertirá el crédito en harina, leche, mantequilla, manteca…etc.
Darling tiene cinco hijos de 17, 14, 9, 8 y 5 años los cuales estudian y los dos mayores ayudan en el negocio en su tiempo libre.
Las otras integrantes son Lesbia de 30 años quien vende verduras y sopa los fines de semana, y Gema vende ropa y cosméticos.
texts.en:
The 'Sortilegio' group has three hard-working and entrepreneurial members: Darling, Lesbia and Gema.  The group's coordinator is 32 year-old Darling who owns a bakery.  This is a family business that she started approximately seven years ago.  Her speciality is baking pastries and desserts and she will invest her loan in buying flour, milk, butter, lard etc.  Darling has five children aged 17, 14, 9, 8 and 5.  They are all in school and her two eldest help in the business in their spare time.

The other members of this group are 30 year-old Lesbia, who sells vegetables and soup on weekends, and Gema, who sells clothes and cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy flour, milk, butter, lard etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock items for his store.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 61 years old and has been farming in Litein,South Rift, Kenya, for the past 31 years. He is married with nine children, all of whom are adults except the last born. His farm produces milk, which he sells to the local Kokiche Cooling plant. He is also a retired teacher and earns a pension, which supplements his farming income.

He has requested a loan of 52,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the additional cow will boost his family's income and make life more bearable.

Michael says, however, that the small parcels of land owned by farmers is the main undoing in farming as it limits their capacity to produce.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Yovana

texts.en:
Yovana is 30 years old and the single mother of one daughter who is eight years old. Together with her mother and sister, she participates in their family furniture making business. Yovana works in her family's store making and selling furniture seven days a week. She is proud that her family has had their furniture store for over ten years. 

Yovana is asking for a loan in order to buy more wood to make furniture and also other materials that they might need for the store. She is hardworking and committed to making all the payments necessary on time.

loans.use: to buy more wood to make furniture for her store.

loans.name: Nuevas Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El comité llamado Nuevas Emprendedoras esta ubicado en la ciudad de Caaguazú, esta conformado por 22 miembros. Actualmente se encuentran en el cuarto ciclo. Son señoras muy organizadas y trabajadoras.
ellas se definen como mujeres jefas de familia que luchan por ofrecer a sus familias un porvenir distinto al que ellas tuvieron que pasar. Están encaminadas hacia un fin común, donde la cooperación y solidaridad van primero.
La Sra. Maria, es la presidenta del grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de comestibles, como ser empanadas, sopa paraguaya, croquetas y demás. Ella manifiesta que todos los dias se levanta muy temprano para poder preparar los alimentos que va a vender. Dice que tiene mucha demanda ya que sus comidas gustan mucho.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra de carne, jamón, queso, pollo, especias y demás insumos necesarios para la elaboración de sus alimentos.
texts.en: The committee “Nuevas Emprendedores” or “New Entrepreneurs” is located in the city of Caaguazú, and is comprised of 22 members.  They are now in their fourth loan cycle.  They are very organized and hard-working women.  The women define themselves as female heads of household who fight to offer their families a different future than they themselves had to go through.  They are working towards a common end, where cooperation and solidarity come first. María, the group’s president, sells food products like empanadas, sopa paraguaya, croquetas, and more.  Every day she gets up very early to prepare the food she will sell.  She says she has a lot of demand since everyone likes her food.  She requests the loan to buy meat, ham, cheese, chicken, spices and other necessary ingredients to make her foods.

loans.use: Buy meat, ham, chicken, spices, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz tiene 31 años, convive con Aquiles de 30 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Lucila, de 13 y Talía, de 7 años de edad. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Cumutay. La principal actividad económica del lugar es la agricultura. Por ello está laboriosa mujer se dedica a la siembra de papa, arveja y maíz; asimismo cría animales como toros, vacas, de los cuales saca una buena cantidad de leche para la elaboración de queso, los que vende en la ciudad de Huasahuasi, obteniendo buenas ganancias. Ya tiene más de 20 años dedicándose a la agricultura y ganadería; y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poner en práctica lo que sus padres le enseñaron. Además cuenta que es muy buena en la venta ya que después de cada cosecha los comercializa en el mercado mayorista de Huancayo, obteniendo buenas ganancias. Paralelo a su trabajo, se dedica a cocinar los alimentos del día, a los peones que trabajan en las chacras.  Ahora después de cosechar sus cultivos de papa, piensa sembrar alverja y papa de otra variedad; sin descuidar a sus animales. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Pioneros de Cumutay” y este es el quinto crédito con MFP, donde espera el apoyo de todos ustedes para lograr sus planes. Además se compromete en pagar de manera puntual sus cuotas. Luz de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 2 bolsas de semilla de arveja y varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales para comenzar con éxito su próximo sembrío de papa de la variedad única.
texts.en:
Luz is 31 years old and lives with 30 year-old Aquiles.  The couple have two children: 13 year-old Lucila and 7 year-old Talía.  They live together as a family in their own home which is located in the small village of Cumutay.

The main business activity in this area is agriculture.  This hard-working woman grows potatoes, peas and corn.  She also raises animals such as bulls and cows which provide a good quantity of milk for making cheese which she sells in the town of Huasahuasi.  This makes her good profits.  Luz has worked in farming and livestock raising for more than 20 years and what she most enjoys about her work is putting into practice what her parents taught her.  She also tells us that she is good at sales as, after each harvest, she sells her crops in the wholesale market in Huancayo and makes good profits.  In parallel with this work, Luz also cooks the day's meals for the laborers who work on the farms.  After she has harvested her potato crops she is planning to sow peas and another variety of potato, without neglecting her animals.

Luz is a member of the "Pioneros de Cumutay" (Cumutay Pioneers) community bank and this is her fifth loan from MFP.  She hopes to receive the support of each and every one of you in helping her to achieve her goals.  For her part, she pledges to make her repayments punctually.  With your support, Luz will invest the money she has requested in buying two bags of pea seeds and several sacks of natural fertilizers so that she can make a successful start to sowing her next crop of única-variety potatoes.

loans.use: to buy two bags of pea seeds and sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase poultry for a new farming venture.

loans.name: Siomara Velmina

texts.es: La Señora Siomara es casada, tiene 02 hijos de 2 y 8 años de edad, de los cuales el mayor ya asiste al colegio; Siomara se dedica  a la venta de productos de primera necesidad (tienda de abarrotes); la Señora viene brindando este servicio desde hace 02 años, ,el desafío que enfrenta la familia es el fuerte frio que viene atravesando la ciudad donde radican ; Siomara va a invertir el dinero en la compra de mercadería para ampliar el negocio, tales como: arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche,  entre otros; Siomara como toda mujer emprendedora tiene muchos sueños, uno de ellos es ver crecer su negocio y poder construir su casa de material noble. Ella esta muy agradecida por el crédito que se le está brindando.
texts.en:
Siomara is married and has two children who are 2 and 8 years of age; the oldest attends school.  Siomara sells basic need items (grocery store).  She’s been providing this service for two years.  The challenge her family faces is the intense cold the city they live in is experiencing.  

Siomara will invest the money in the purchase of merchandise to expand the business, such as: rice, sugar, noodles and milk, among others.  Like all enterprising women, Siomara has many dreams.  One of them is seeing her business grow and being able to build her house out of substantial building materials.  

She is very grateful for the loan she’s being granted.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Lipari Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LIPARI” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por once integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Isidora. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos cría de animales, cría de vacas lecheras, transportista 

La señora Isidora,  indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer  por invitación de la promoción y mis vecinos. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de cría de vacas lecheras que  inicio desde que se caso por sugerencia de su suegra y en la actualidad trabaja con su esposo.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra de alimento para las vacas (forraje) que adquirirá de la comunidad de Callapa. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los bajos intereses.
texts.en:
The “Lipari” communal bank will start its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Exaltación Center.  It has 11 members led by a governing board headed by Isidora.  The members of the communal bank carry out a variety of businesses like: raising livestock, raising dairy cows and transportation.

Isidora indicates that this is the first time she’s joined Pro Mujer; she was invited by a promoter and by her neighbors.  Currently, she raises dairy cows.  She started when she got married following a suggestion from her mother-in-law; she currently works alongside her husband.

The loan she will take out now is to purchase feed for the cows (forage) that she’ll buy in the community of Callapa.  This way of earning a living makes it possible for her to generate resources to support the family as much as possible for she’s married and has two children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the low interest rates.

loans.use: to buy cattle feed.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a farmer in the Kitale area of Western Kenya. She is married and has four children between the ages of three months and 16 years. For the past 10 years, Eunice has been producing maize and beans and selling them at the local market. 

Eunice is requesting a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She will use the income generated from her dairy business to provide food and education for her children. Eunice is optimistic and focused on achieving her goal of owning three quality dairy cows in five years time.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Epmcc Plus Group

texts.en:
Tyty is a chairwoman of a community bank named "EPMCC Plus," made up of 23 members firmly united to receive loans from the MFI (micro-finance institution) HOPE RDC in order to develop their businesses.

Tyty sells fruits and other miscellaneous items. She sells them in a market located in the western part of Kinshasa. She has been in business since 1997. She has borrowed four loans from MFI HOPE DRC for business expansion, and she fully repaid them. With the next loan, Tyty will be able to meet customer demand and generate additional profits. She will buy two sacks of mangoes to resell for a profit. Her business makes 30 USD in profit each day. One of Tyty's strategies for keeping her clients is to tell them in advance about any change that can occur in business. Her ambition is to become a fruit provider. Tyty is 30 years old. She is married and has four children between ages 4 and 18 years old. Two of them go to school.

loans.use: to increase the inventory of her business by buying two sacks of mangoes and reselling them for a profit.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa es una mujer muy trabajadora, tiene 44 años y vive feliz con su esposo Amancio de 50 años. Con él tienen 3 hermosas hijas que son su orgullo; Verónica, Deysi y Ángela. Juntos  viven en su casa propia, ubicada en Puente Capelo (selva central peruana). Pese a las dificultades que tuvo de joven, nunca se amilanó; por el contrario se lleno de fuerzas para salir adelante con su primera hija en brazos. Es así que ya tiene 7 años dedicándose a vender una variedad de  frutas de la selva y de la costa peruana como manzanas, plátanos, naranjas, sandías, melones, duraznos, granadillas, entre otras frutas secas, con la ayuda de su hija mayor Verónica quien cada mañana abre el local acoplado en su vivienda e inicia con el negocio. Lo que más le gusta de vender las frutas es que sus hijos están en casa junto a ella y  consumen lo que vende cuidando su alimentación; “vendiendo frutas he podido construir mi casa, educar a mis hijos, mantener los gastos de mi casa y hasta vestirme, no me puedo quejar de las ganancias que me da” refiere Rosa, a la vez que resume que por eso su negocio es muy rentable para ella. Para  el futuro tiene planeado ampliar su negocio hasta el patio de su casa y surtirla de más variedad de frutas para satisfacer a sus asiduos clientes. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Selva alegre” y este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, donde espera una vez más, el apoyo de todos ustedes. Está agradecida por el apoyo que recibe, por eso está segura que debe pagar puntualmente si quiere seguir progresando. Rosa de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de más frutas las cuales venderá al por mayor y menor, sobre todo desea comprar mandarina por la demanda que tiene este producto y así poder obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Rosa is a very hard-working woman.  She is 44 years old and lives happily together with her husband, 50 year-old Amancio.  The couple have three beautiful daughters who are their pride and joy: Verónica, Deysi and Ángela.  They live together in their own home which is located in Puente Capelo (in the central Peruvian rainforest).

In spite of the difficulties that she experienced when she was young, Rosa was never daunted.  On the contrary, she became filled with the strength to get ahead in life, carrying her eldest daughter in her arms.  For seven years, she has been selling a variety of fruits from the rainforest and the Peruvian coast such as apples, bananas, oranges, watermelons, melons, peaches, passion fruit and dried fruits.  She does this with the help of her eldest daughter Verónica who opens the premises adjoining their home and starts business.  What she most enjoys about selling her fruit is that her children are in the house with her and they eat what she sells, thereby looking after their diet.  "Through selling fruit I have been able to build my house, educate my children, cover my household expenses and even dress myself" says Rosa.  She sums up that her business is very profitable.  In the future, she plans to expand her business out onto the patio area outside her house and stock it with a greater variety of fruit so that she can satisfy her regular customers.

Rosa belongs to the "Selva Alegre" community bank and this is her seventh loan from MFP.  She hopes, once again, to receive your support.  She is grateful for the support that she receives.  For this reason, she is certain that she will make her repayments punctually as she wants to continue making progress.  With your support, Rosa will invest the money she has requested in buying more fruit which she will sell wholesale and retail.  Above all, she would like to buy mandarins because of the demand she has for this product.  In this way, she will be able to make more profits.

loans.use: to buy more varied fruit and mandarins in large quantities to meet her demand

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas is 75 years old and married with four children, ages 22, 30, 32, and 34. Together with two of her daughters, Felicitas owns and runs a family furniture-making business. She and her family have their own store where they construct and sell furniture. Felicitas is proud that their store has been open for more than 10 years. 

Felicitas is requesting a loan to buy more wood and other needed materials to make furniture to sell. She and her family are very happy about this loan and are committed to making all the necessary payments.

loans.use: to buy wood and materials to make furniture

loans.name: Maria Pilar

texts.es: María Pilar, tiene la edad de 41 años, está casada  y vive con sus 3 hijos y su esposo que son sus mayores prioridades. Ella pretende con el crédito comprar una vaca para la producción de leche. Ella cuenta con el terreno para la explotación de ganado, ella quiere lograr producir leche para el consumo de la casa y lo demás venderlo para generar un ingreso extra. Ella tiene como meta ir generando ganancias para tal vez si se dan las cosas en el futuro seguir comprando vaquitas de leche y poder aumentar la producción y poder generar mayores ganancias para su bienestar familiar.  Es el segundo  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
María Pilar is 41 years old, married, and lives with her three children and husband who are her main priorities in life.  She plans to use this loan to buy a dairy cow for producing milk.
